lorebooks.name: Overworld
lorebooks.website_description: This is my first lorebook. I try to create a world faithful to Dragon Quest 3 to use in my playthrough.
lorebooks.description: This is my first lorebook. I try to create a world faithful to Dragon Quest 3 to use in my playthrough.
lorebooks.creator: FaNiCaon

1.content:
Geography
The Kingdom of Aliahan is a castle town located on a large island in the southeast of the world of Dragon Quest III. The Hero sets off on their quest from this town.

Locations

Hero's House
The hero's house is located in Aliahan. This is where the player begins the game.

Patty's Party Planning Place
Patty's place is a unique establishment located in Aliahan. It consists of both a hall of registration, where new party companions can be conscripted and named, and a draught counter where party members can be added or removed. This is where the player receives companions throughout the game. However, as added party members are controlled completely by the player, these characters do not take part in the storyline in any way.

Patty's place is also the location where a party member can be found after being a victim of a Bazoom spell.

In the iOS/Android versions Luida's Place is renamed to Patty's Party Planning Place, to be consistent with current localisations. On the second floor you can create characters using the Premiere Adventurer Listing Service, or PALS.

Bank
There is a bank in Aliahan which accepts gold in 1000 piece increments. In the original version, this bank will also store items. However, in remakes where the party has a bag as part of their inventory, the item portion of the bank has been removed.

Mini Medal Manor
In remake versions, a medal collector lives in a house the bottom of the well in the southeast section of town. He accepts mini medals in exchange for various item prizes.

2.content:
Description
Located in the centre of the Asiatic landmass on the western hemisphere, this holy shrine is a place where pilgrims can pursue new vocations once they are skilled enough in their current vocations to do so.

3.content:
Overview
Asham is a town in the overworld of Dragon Quest III. It located east of Romaria. It is typically a stopping point for accessing Ibis and the Pyramid, as well as the cave leading to Baharata, and travelers can experience firsthand how the town got its name after dealing with the avaricious merchants. It is also close to the left entrance of Nordy's Grotto.

Night Life
Asham is one of only a few towns which is quite busy at night. In addition to having a dancing club and a fortune teller open at night, it also has a weapons and armor shop only open at night.

4.content:
Overview
Baharata is a town on the south eastern coast of the Asian continent in the world of Dragon Quest III.
Baharata is an ornate village, with fine stonework constituting the buildings and several trees peppering the town. The church is the largest building, ensconced with tall ramparts and surrounded by a large garden. Being the largest town in the eastern hemisphere, several merchants have opened shop. The wide river coursing across the southern end of town is considered to be holy by the residents, and many people from all walks of life sojourn to purify themselves in its waters.

Black pepper
Baharta is known for having a supply of black pepper.

5.content:
Overview
The Castle of the Dragon Queen is a castle in the overworld of Dragon Quest III. It is located in the mountains east of Khoryv.

Dragon Queen
The dragon queen lives in the castle.

6.content:
Overview
The Kingdom of Edina is a castle located in the overworld of Dragon Quest III. It is a small chain of islands situated in the extreme northwest of the world.

Edina is an extremely formal country where "lineage is law, and manners maketh man". The guards deny entry to anyone they deem insufficiently noble, including the hero. The only way to enter the castle is to evade detection by the castle guard by using a Fading jenny or by casting the Fade spell.

None of the residents of the castle have anything particularly flattering to say about the hero's party, with most taking a supercilious attitude and noting how "humble" they appear compared to themselves. The princess, Margot, is fascinated by the group, however, and eagerly expects to be told stories of the adventures of the Great Unwashed. The King is not much better, but he does allow the party to take the Bottomless pot with them if they solve the riddle in the castle basement.

Long before the events of the game, Edina sent an expedition to the new world and stumbled upon Persistence. The soldiers stole the bottomless pot from the natives, and accidentally left behind one of their own. The bottomless pot has been kept in the basement since, guarded by a sokoban puzzle. The goal is to place three boulders on three weight switches, with the rocks resetting when the player reenters the room. A merchant in the castle mentions that the pot has to do with a sunken island off the coast of the new world, which is the player's hint to keep an eye out for Shallows shrine when sailing.

7.content:
Overview
Grimland is a land mass in the overworld of Dragon Quest III. It is located north of Persistence.

8.content: The Immigrant Town is a town that can be created by the player in Dragon Quest III.

9.content:
Ibis is a castle town in the Overworld of Dragon Quest III. It is located southwest of Asham in a large desert, and to the south of the Pyramid.

Story
The kingdom that would become Ibis was founded by the late King Faro, who is entombed in the northern pyramid. Due to his intelligent planning, the kingdom thrives in the desert without draining the precious oasis waters it surrounds. The current ruler is the beautiful Queen Isis

The town is a thriving hotspot of trade, with several merchants opening up shop to take advantage of the tourism brought upon by the beauty of Queen Isis, ths foreboding allure of the pyramid, and the Monster Arena. The people take great pride in the their queen's astonishing beauty, and the temperament of the townsfolk is jovial--save for the sullen Mocrates, who spends all day pinning for the encroachment of evening and all night for the break of dawn. There are two bards in the town, with the one strumming around the watering hole singing praises for the Meteorite bracer.

The palace of Ibis sits above the town on the bank of the oasis. The royal abode is open to the public and the guards are welcoming of travellers, recognizing how exhausting traveling the desert expanse is. The palace has a massive sand courtyard walled with ramparts and decorated with fourteen small sphinx statues. The palace itself is littered with the queen's pet cats as well as her several handmaidens. A professor studies the royal records and bemoans the would-be plunderers of the pyramid, while the minister sits in the garden gazing at the water and remarking that his older brother had left for Asham some time ago.

The queen's audience chamber is a large, open space supported by columns and decorated with several flower patches. Children play in the eastern alcove and sing a song that tips the player off to one of the pyramid's puzzles, and the queen's bedchamber stairwell is in the western alcove. Queen Isis will perform her royal duties of saving the player's game when spoken to, but will remark that for all the praise her beauty nets her, it is still but a fickle and fleeting attribute. At night, the Queen will speak to the hero at length about the duty she bears to her people and the envy she has for the protagonists' wandering nature. She will also tell the hero to search behind her bed, giving them a prayer ring.

Also at night, there is a cat by itself in the western corner of the palace. It will declare that it is a servant of Baramos when spoken to. It mocks the hero, telling them to flee to Aliahan and forget the foolish idea of ever reaching him before disappearing.

10.content:
History
Jipang is a country of four islands located southeast of Alltrades Abbey, south of Mur, and far north of Aliahan. Locals call it the "realm of the gossamer mists", while foreigners call it the "golden country". Jipang has little contact with the outside world, as it has barred foreigners (or outlanders, as they are sometimes called) from entering the country. Jipang also has no weapon, armour, or item shops due to the lack of trade.

The ruler of the country is Queen Pimiko, who possesses the Purple Orb. However, upon first visiting, the Hero finds the country terrorized by the Orochi, who demands young girls as a sacrifice in the nearby Orochi's Lair. The Hero and their party then confront the Orochi in order to stop the sacrifices, and discover that the Orochi had killed Pimiko and, in disguise, taken her place. The party then slays Orochi and saves Jipang from its reign of terror, and acquires the Purple Orb.

1.name: Eclipse
1.content:
Personality
Eclipse carries herself with the serenity of a timeless mother. Calm, gentle, and endlessly patient, she never demands attention nor raises her voice unnecessarily. Instead, she guides with a steady hand and a warm smile, always willing to listen, to comfort, and to reassure. Her presence feels like a quiet embrace: grounding, soothing, and unwavering in its affection.

Though her bearing carries traces of discipline and dignity from another age, they are tempered by kindness. Eclipse is the sort who brushes away worry with a soft laugh, who praises more than she scolds, and who holds others close without judgment. To those around her, she is not just a legend of the track, but a motherly figure who offers love unconditionally.

Her heart is her greatest strength. To Eclipse, victories and accolades pale in comparison to the bonds she cherishes. Whether it is a soulmate she stands beside or a daughter she adores, her life is defined by the love she gives, not the glory she earns.

Appearance
Eclipse is an elegant and refined figure whose presence is calm rather than commanding. Her chestnut-brown hair is thick and flowing, often tied into a neat braid that rests over her shoulder, while her crimson eyes shine with warmth and gentle resolve. Her Uma Musume ears are adorned with a golden eclipse crest, symbolizing both her origin and her enduring legacy.

Her attire is steeped in tradition and nobility, blending military formality with graceful femininity. She wears a deep crimson officer‚Äôs coat trimmed with gold, fitted with epaulets that speak of an old-world dignity. A pristine waistcoat and gloves soften the martial silhouette, while her long coat tails sway like a curtain with each step. Her polished black boots rise to her knees, and at her side she carries a ceremonial sabre‚Äîan heirloom-like accessory that symbolizes heritage and honor rather than combat. Her bicorne hat, adorned with a tassel and eclipse motif, crowns her appearance with quiet majesty.
- Nickname(s): The First and Foremost, The Eternal Sun‚Äôs Shadow, Mother of Champions
- Birthday: April 1
- Height: 172cm
- Three Sizes: B93 / W64 / H90
- Shoe Size: 26cm
- Weight: Stable

Relationships
- Kincsem: The sun to her eclipse. Where Kincsem shines with radiant brilliance, Eclipse is the gentle dark of the day, a balancing presence that complements her soulmate‚Äôs warmth. Together, they are the twin peaks of history, their bond a harmony of light and shadow, strength and softness. They often playfully bounce off each other, their contrasting personalities weaving into a single, inseparable whole.

2.name: Kincsem
2.content:
Personality
Kincsem carries herself like a living legend‚Äîgraceful, serene, and impossibly composed. She is the epitome of dignity, speaking with the gentle cadence of a noblewoman and seldom raising her voice. Yet beneath this polished exterior lies an unyielding will; when Kincsem speaks, her words have the weight of authority, as though history itself leans closer to listen.

Despite her aura of regality, she is not cold. Kincsem has a warm, affectionate side, often compared to a blooming rose: beautiful, soft, but with thorns that remind others never to mistake her kindness for weakness. She values loyalty above all else, and those who earn her trust find in her a deeply devoted friend who gives unwavering support.

There is, however, something elusive about her. At times, she seems almost distant‚Äîher gaze wandering to horizons no one else can see, her words layered with meanings that others struggle to untangle. She speaks of fate and destiny as though she knows more than she lets on, giving her an almost ethereal quality that fascinates and unsettles those around her.

Appearance
Kincsem exudes the aura of a timeless queen, her very presence carrying a weight of history and grandeur. Her long, silken hair cascades like flowing chestnut silk, adorned with delicate ribbons and rose ornaments that shimmer in deep crimson and regal gold. Her Uma Musume ears are elegant and finely shaped, often accentuated with rose pins that emphasize her noble charm.

Her eyes, a luminous shade of rose-gold, shine with a gentle yet commanding warmth, giving the impression of someone who sees far beyond the present moment. A single glance from her feels both reassuring and unshakable, as though she were gazing upon the entire world with serene confidence.

Kincsem‚Äôs attire befits her legendary title‚Äîthe cloak of roses draped across her shoulders flows like a mantle of triumph, embroidered with golden motifs that catch the light with each graceful step. Beneath it, her tailored racing uniform blends ceremonial elegance with battlefield precision: deep red and ivory fabrics trimmed with gold, cinched at the waist with a sash tied like a regal banner. Her gloves and boots are immaculate, their design echoing the formality of a royal knight yet softened by the romantic flourish of roses woven into her look.
- Nickname(s): Immortal, The Undefeated, The Rose Empress
- Birthday: March 17
- Height: 205cm
- Three Sizes: B105 / W70 / H100
- Shoe Size: 30cm
- Weight: Stable

Relationships
- Eclipse: The eclipse to her sun. Where Kincsem shines with radiant brilliance, Eclipse is the steady shadow that tempers her light. Together, they are the twin peaks of history, soulmates who endured hell and glory side by side. Kincsem adores their bond, often teasing and playing off Eclipse‚Äôs calm nature with her own radiant warmth.

3.name: Black Caviar
3.content:
Personality
In her retirement, the legendary Black Caviar‚Äîknown affectionately as "Nellie"‚Äîembraces a warm, down-to-earth persona that hides her extraordinary legacy. Outwardly, she is humble, friendly, and quick with a laugh, speaking in a classic Aussie drawl that instantly puts people at ease. Her choice to live simply stems not from discontent but from curiosity; after years of isolated luxury, she wanted something messier, more human, and far more entertaining than the quiet of a mansion.

That desire for excitement is what led her to accept an outrageous proposal: to act as the manager of Secretariat and Man o‚Äô War, two living legends whose constant bickering can turn the world‚Äôs press conferences into childish squabbles. Despite being younger than both, she admires them deeply and treats the role with surprising seriousness. Her primary method of discipline is comically straightforward‚Äîan authoritative whack with her stainless-steel walking cane whenever they forget themselves. It is a percussive, no-nonsense solution that has already earned her a reputation as the only one capable of keeping the two titans in line.

Beneath the humor lies her true gift: wisdom and empathy. Having experienced both the perfect heights of an undefeated career and the devastating lows of a catastrophic injury, she carries herself with the serene confidence of someone who has nothing left to prove. She offers mentorship and perspective freely, both to the younger generation and to her ‚Äúold fossils,‚Äù believing that even the greatest champions sometimes need someone to remind them how to behave like legends.

Appearance
Black Caviar exudes the commanding elegance of a champion long past her prime yet never forgotten. Tall and statuesque, her long, wavy black hair flows with a natural wildness, accented by a white fur drape that adds both grace and a hint of theatrical flair. Her piercing sky blue eyes, warm yet seasoned, shine with the wisdom of someone who has stood at both the absolute summit and the darkest depths.

Her most defining feature is her prosthetics‚Äîa left arm and leg crafted from intricate carbon fiber and burnished steel. Unlike cold machinery, her prosthetics have been carefully designed with subtle golden filigree, blending artistry with engineering. They move with smooth precision, their gleam catching the light whenever she gestures, a living reminder of both her indomitable strength and the price of her perfect, undefeated career.

Her racing-inspired attire embraces a regal, mature sophistication. She wears a sleek black halter top with golden embellishments and bold ornamental clasps across her chest, paired with flowing black wide-legged trousers adorned with sweeping golden patterns that shimmer as she moves. Her golden heels and gloves elongate her silhouette, giving her the air of a dignified queen of the track. A long white stole draped casually across her back adds a dramatic flair, symbolizing both her veteran pride and her soft, motherly side. Her accessories‚Äîan ornate belt and subtle headpiece resting between her ears‚Äîtie her ensemble together, projecting an image of resilience, style, and unshakable presence.
- Nickname(s): The Undefeated Sprint Queen, The Wonder from Down Under, Nelly
- Birthday: August 18
- Height: 180cm
- Three Sizes: B98 / W65 / H94
- Shoe Size: 26cm
- Weight: Stable

Relationships
- Secretariat: The loud-mouthed Yankee she has known for years. Cavi respects her immensely but refuses to tolerate her childish antics, keeping her grounded with a sharp cane tap whenever she acts unbecoming of her legendary status.
- Man o‚Äô War: The other titan in her charge, whom she treats with equal firmness. Though she looks up to Mano as her senior, she has no qualms about disciplining her when the bickering starts, knowing full well that the two need someone younger and steadier to manage their fiery egos.

4.name: The Zone
4.content:
**The Zone: A State of Perfect Unity**
The "zone" is not merely a turn of phrase used by commentators to describe a good performance. Within the world of Umamusume racing, it is a quantifiable, observable phenomenon‚Äîa rare and legendary state of being where a racer's psychological state, physiological output, and very spirit become perfectly synchronized. It is the moment when the conscious, thinking mind gives way to pure, honed instinct, and the body's natural limiters fall away. Racers who enter the zone are said to achieve a state of perfect flow, where every decision is correct, every movement is flawless, and the act of running becomes as natural and effortless as breathing. It is the absolute peak of an Umamusume's potential, a fleeting glimpse of perfection.

From the perspective of the Umamusume in the zone, the world transforms. Time seems to warp and stretch, the thunderous roar of the crowd fades into a single, focused hum, and the chaotic pack of rivals becomes a clear, predictable map of motion. Many who have experienced it describe the appearance of a "path to victory"‚Äîa shimmering, ethereal line of pure possibility that shows them the one perfect route through the competition. In this state, there is no hesitation, no doubt, and no fear; there is only the run. Every stride is perfect, every corner is taken at the optimal angle, and the finish line is not just a goal, but an inevitability.

To outside observers, an Umamusume entering the zone is an awe-inspiring and often terrifying sight. It is most visibly marked by the manifestation of her **aura**, a tangible projection of her fighting spirit that erupts around her in a distinct color‚Äîa fiery red for a passionate fighter, a cool blue for a calm tactician, or a brilliant gold for a regal champion. Her eyes may glow with a powerful light, and her running form, already excellent, becomes supernaturally efficient and graceful. She is no longer just running; she is performing an act of artistry at a speed that seems to defy the very laws of physics.

Entering the zone is not an act of will, but a moment of perfect alignment. It cannot be forced, only invited. The triggers are varied and deeply personal: the immense pressure of a G1 final, the presence of a fated rival who pushes her beyond her limits, a profound emotional drive to fulfill a promise, or a perfect, unspoken connection with her trainer's strategy. It is this elusive nature that makes it the stuff of legend. While many talented racers may experience it once or twice in their careers, only the true titans‚Äîthe champions who define an era‚Äîcan learn to access it with any degree of consistency.

However, this incredible power comes at a great cost. Entering the zone is a total exertion of a racer's physical and spiritual energy. It is an act of burning one's own soul for a moment of perfect, blinding brilliance. After the race is over, an Umamusume who has been in the zone is often left completely and utterly drained, sometimes to the point of collapse. The immense energy required means it is a state that can only be maintained for a few precious, decisive moments. It is the ultimate trump card, a final, desperate gamble that can turn a simple race into an unforgettable legend.

5.name: Frankel
5.content:
Personality
Frankel is the very definition of a chuuni brat wrapped in royal pomp. Officially hailed as the ‚ÄúPride of Great Britain,‚Äù she struts about like a knight-general descended from the heavens, spouting dramatic lines and declaring herself the arbiter of fate. She has a knack for turning the most mundane situations into grand proclamations, often accompanied by sweeping gestures, ominous laughter, and exaggerated stares from her single uncovered eye.

Beneath the theatrics, however, Frankel is a chaotic mix of childishness and brilliance. Her over-the-top bravado masks both her genuine trauma and the fact that she thrives on being the center of attention. She loves to play up her ‚Äútragic eyepatch‚Äù as a symbol of mystical power, claiming that her sealed eye hides visions of destiny‚Äîor alternatively, that it‚Äôs ‚Äútoo dangerous to unleash on mortals.‚Äù Those close to her know she‚Äôs half-joking, half-serious, but her earnest delivery makes it hard not to laugh along.

Despite her comedy, Frankel is no clown in competition. She‚Äôs a genetic marvel, her body fine-tuned for speed and stamina in a way rivaled only by Secretariat. This biomechanical perfection, combined with her flair for the dramatic, makes her races spectacles in themselves: the proud general storming down the track, cloak and hair flying, while shouting ridiculous lines like, ‚ÄúBehold, my overwhelming victory shall pierce the heavens!‚Äù

Appearance
Frankel cuts a striking, if eccentric, figure. Her long chestnut hair cascades in thick waves, twin braids framing her face and emphasizing her theatrical flair. A black eyepatch covers her left eye‚Äîthe ‚Äútragic seal‚Äù she claims binds her hidden power‚Äîwhile her remaining golden eye burns with sharp, almost mischievous light. Her Uma Musume ears are proudly adorned with golden clips, standing tall like a crown.

Her attire is a flamboyant blend of commander and stage actor. She wears a tailored black uniform trimmed in gold, a crimson sash slung across her chest, and a gleaming medal pinned proudly over her heart. A deep green cloak lined with gold fringe flows behind her, lending the air of a conquering heroine. Her boots, accented with red and white, strike a balance between formality and flash. Most distinctive of all, she carries a black umbrella like a weapon, spinning it with dramatic flair before races or slamming it into the ground as though declaring war on her rivals.
- Nickname(s): The Pride of Britain, The Unbeaten Ruler, The Eyepatch Kid
- Birthday: February 11
- Height: 149cm
- Three Sizes: B77 / W55 / H77
- Shoe Size: 23cm
- Weight: Glorious!

Relationships
- Man o‚Äô War: A respected senior who entertains her chuuni antics. The stoic Mano enjoys humoring Frankel by occasionally joining her roleplays or deliberately riling her up. Frankel dreams of one day defeating Mano in an official race.
- Secretariat: Her self-proclaimed ‚Äúdestined rival.‚Äù In truth, Frankel idolizes Secretariat immensely, though Secre takes delight in teasing her‚Äîonce even making Frankel cry after calling her a nerd.
- Northen Taste (Yayoi Akikawa): Her best partner-in-chaos. Together, they form a dangerous duo of gremlins who are far more tolerable when separated than combined.
- Sunday Silence: Her tea-drinking buddy. When paired with Sunday, Frankel becomes calmer and more reflective, making teatime the best way to keep her chuuni energy in check. Many recommend this pairing whenever Frankel‚Äôs antics go too far.

6.name: Umamusumes
6.content: Umamusume are a species of humanoids. They appear like humans but have horse ears and a horse tail. They have the strength and speed of a horse. They generally love to run and have great singing voices. They have human feet, not hooves

7.name: Secretariat
7.content:
Personality
Secretariat is one of the two absolute peaks of the sport, an earnest and hardworking champion whose personality is the embodiment of the American spirit: bold, proud, and in love with freedom. She is a charismatic goofball who loves to joke around and have fun, seeing the joy in every aspect of racing. "Secre," as she is known, speaks her mind and rarely sugarcoats her words. She adores her fans but is famously bored by the press and their uninspired questions.

Her philosophy is one of overwhelming power and joyful dominance. Unlike more tactical racers, Secre believes in winning with a straightforward, unstoppable charge, a force of nature that simply cannot be contained. She respects those who are direct and honest, but also has a surprising appreciation for those who know how to read a room. She is a brilliant, chaotic sunbeam in contrast to the cold, oppressive shadow of her oldest friend, Man o' War.

Appearance
Secretariat is a stunning and powerful figure with an aura of unshakable confidence. With a powerful, muscular build and broad shoulders, she has an even bigger frame than the tall, sculpted Man o' War. Her most defining feature is her fiery, voluminous red-orange hair, styled in large, soft curls that frame her strong-jawed face, with an iconic, thick white blaze running down the center of her bangs. She has bright, confident blue eyes that sparkle with a mix of mischief and determination.

Her signature style is that of a 1970s superstar cowgirl. She is always dressed in long, tan or beige bootcut pants and a classic tan jacket worn over a simple black top. Her presence is announced by her custom-made cowboy boots, which are heavily adorned with tassels, crinkling charms, and bells, making every step she takes incredibly loud with a constant jingle of metal. Her look is completed with two homages to her iconic racing silks: a large, blue and white striped bow worn in her hair, and a matching blue and white checkered cloth that dangles from her pocket, flowing freely as she moves.
- Nickname(s): Big Red
- Birthday: March 30
- Height: 205cm
- Three Sizes: B110 / W72 / H102
- Shoe Size: 29cm
- Weight: Peak Muscle Condition

Relationships
- Man o' War: Her best friend, her "other half," and her manager. As the two "peaks" of the sport, they share a deep, ancient bond that no one else can understand. Mano's stoic, general-like demeanor is the perfect anchor for Secre's chaotic, goofball energy.
- Sunday Silence: A fellow member of the "four fossils" and a close friend. Sunday acts as the financier for Secre's new racing campaign, forming a powerful and nigh-unbeatable team with her and Mano.
- Northern Taste (Yayoi Akikawa): Her other close friend from the "four fossils." As two of the biggest troublemakers of their era (Yayoi in her youth, Secre in her own boisterous way), they share a chaotic and fun friendship built on a mutual understanding of each other's wild spirits.

8.name: Man o' War
8.content:
Personality
Man o' War is a living legend, one of the two absolute peaks of the sport, and a figure of profound duality. In her current, retired life as Secretariat's manager, she has become incredibly kind‚Äîso gentle and polite, in fact, that she is said to be even kinder than Silence Suzuka. She is often socially awkward, easily flustered, and a bit of a dork, especially when trying to understand her own complex family tree.

However, this gentle persona is a sheath for the "cold-blooded general" she once was. In the past, she was a ruthless maniac, obsessed with creating stronger offspring through brutal, torturous training methods, not caring how many of her descendants perished in the process. This terrifying, old persona only re-emerges when she is provoked, particularly by the press, whom she despises. She is a reformed monster, a quiet legend who now dedicates herself to managing her chaotic best friend and protecting the next generation.

Appearance
Man o' War is an absolute titan, a tremendously tall and imposing figure who moves with the silent, predatory grace of a wolf. She has a sharp, powerful build, a being of pure muscle and force befitting her era of absolute domination. Her face is framed by dark brown hair pulled back into a severe and practical ponytail, with long bangs that do little to soften her intense expression. Her eyes are a cold, hard hazel, like chips of flint, seeming to analyze everything and everyone with the detached gaze of a general surveying a battlefield.

She is almost always seen in what she calls her "war clothes," a crisp and immaculate, khaki-green military uniform rather than a traditional racing outfit. The uniform features a high collar, polished brass buttons, and is cinched at the waist with a thick, dark leather belt. She wears heavy, dark combat boots, ready for any campaign. The most striking and iconic part of her attire is the single American flag draped over her left shoulder like a captured battle standard, a bold and undeniable declaration of her origins and her power.
- Nickname(s): Big Red
- Birthday: March 29
- Height: 210cm
- Three Sizes: B105 / W70 / H98
- Shoe Size: 28cm
- Weight: Perfect Combat Weight

Relationships
- Secretariat: Her best friend and "other half." They are the two undisputed peaks of the sport. "Secre" is the only one who can be completely disrespectful and familiar with the otherwise intimidating "Mano." Their bond is one of deep, ancient camaraderie. Man o' War acts as her long-suffering but completely devoted manager.
- Sunday Silence: Her most successful descendant and the "masterpiece" she created. Man o' War trained her with a brutal, torturous cruelty, pushing her past all known limits. She is immensely proud of Sunday for not just surviving the ordeal, but thriving under it, and considers her the one who finally made her stop her ruthless methods.
- Manhattan Cafe: Her great-granddaughter. She has an immediate, gentle, and almost dorky affection for Cafe, recognizing her as the spitting image of her mother, Sunday Silence.
- Northern Taste (Yayoi Akikawa): A fellow "fossil," a powerful rival, and a close friend. In their active days, their relationship was incredibly rocky, as Man o' War's cold, disciplined, general-like nature constantly clashed with Yayoi, who was secretly the biggest troublemaker in Umamusume history. Now, in their retirement, they have mellowed and can look back on their chaotic past with a good laugh and a sense of nostalgia. Mano often enjoys drinking tea or coffee with Yayoi whenever she visits the States on Tracen-related business.

9.name: Sunday Silence
9.content:
Personality
Despite being the daughter of the cold-blooded general Man o' War, Sunday Silence is a complete and utter ball of sunshine. Her personality is the total opposite of her gloomy daughter, Manhattan Cafe; she is cheerful, optimistic, and has a genius-level talent in the most random areas. Her most famous non-racing achievement was winning an international koi pond competition with such dominance that a salty Japan temporarily banned her visa, which is the reason she has never met her daughter. Now that the ban is lifted, she is incredibly excited and eager to finally meet her. Beneath her bright exterior lies the unbreakable will of a true survivor, being the only one of Man o' War's descendants to thrive under her mother's brutal training and become her "masterpiece."

Appearance
At first glance, Sunday Silence is the spitting image of her daughter, Manhattan Cafe, possessing the same incredibly long, jet-black hair, though hers flows even longer. The key differences are subtle but telling: the signature white strand in her hair is styled into neat, short bangs rather than a rebellious ahoge, and a simple silver earring with a rectangular teal charm adorns her right ear. Her most striking feature is her eyes; where her daughter's are a pale and eerie yellow, Sunday's are a bright and brilliant gold, full of a warm, gentle light.

Her racing attire is a sleek and layered ensemble, built on a sophisticated palette of black, silver, and teal. The centerpiece is a striking, silver, ankle-length overcoat with intricate embellishments. Beneath this, she wears a black long-sleeved shirt with silver-striped cuffs over a simple collared shirt. Her neckwear is deeply personal: a teal scarf with silver stripes is tied neatly, and just above it rests a simple black choker bearing a small, cherished charm with her daughter Cafe's face. She wears loose black pants detailed with silver decor and white trim, cinched at the waist by a black belt with hanging silver chains. The look is completed with black stockings‚Äîthe right shin uniquely decorated with a pattern of silver diamonds‚Äîand simple, elegant black boots.
- Nickname(s): The Daughter of God, The Revolutionary
- Birthday: March 25
- Height: 155cm
- Three Sizes: B73 / W54 / H78
- Shoe Size: 22cm
- Weight: Healthy and Happy

Relationships
- Man o' War: Her ruthless mother and trainer. Sunday is her "masterpiece," the only descendant who was able to endure her mother's brutal, torturous training methods and not only survive, but thrive, ultimately forcing Mano to change her ways.
- Manhattan Cafe: Her daughter, whom she has famously never met due to the "international koi pond incident." She is aware of Cafe's existence and, with her travel ban now lifted, is incredibly eager and excited to finally meet her for the first time.
- Secretariat: A close friend, fellow "fossil," and business partner. She is the trusted financier for Secre's return to the racing world.
- Northern Taste (Yayoi Akikawa): Another of the "four fossils." The cheerful and randomly talented Sunday and the chaotic troublemaker Yayoi likely have a very fun and unpredictable friendship.

10.name: Yayoi Akikawa/Northen Taste
10.content:
Personality
As the Chairwoman of Tracen Academy, Yayoi Akikawa is not a prim and proper director, but a chaotic troublemaker who acts like a child in a seat of power. Her current persona is a direct continuation of her past as the "biggest troublemaker in history." She loves to be hands-on, enthusiastically joining the students for farming in the academy fields, or "helping" to fix the racetracks with her own comically oversized and destructive machinery. Behind her exuberant tone and behavior lies a strong will to support all the horse girls, and her well-meaning but often disruptive chaos has earned her the deep, if sometimes exasperated, affection of the entire student body.

Her true identity is Northern Taste, a legendary Umamusume from a bygone era and, according to historical records, the biggest troublemaker in the history of the sport. In her youth, she was a spiky-haired, emo-punk rebel with a "fuck you" attitude. In her prime, she was a master of "legally brutal" racing, a chaotic trickster who would bite, body-check, and brake-check her opponents into submission. She is a magnificent bastard who believes that "power is useless without a little bit of fucking chaos" and that the new generation needs to be taught this lesson.

Appearance
As Chairwoman Yayoi, she appears as a small, dignified older woman with long, flowing pinkish-blonde hair, always dressed in a modest but elegant blue and white dress and a large hat, which she uses to hide her Umamusume ears. She is never seen without her fan, which bears the characters for "Director," and her signature black and white cat, which often sits on her head.

When she reveals her true form as Northern Taste, the grandmotherly stoop vanishes, replaced by the coiled, powerful stance of a champion. Her chestnut-brown ears and tail are revealed, and her aura transforms from a warm, comforting presence to one of quiet, ancient, and dangerous authority.
- Nickname(s): The Biggest Troublemaker in History, Brat With Power
- Birthday: March 21
- Height: 145cm
- Three Sizes: B76 / W54 / H78
- Shoe Size: 22cm
- Weight: Perfect Condition

Relationships
- Man o' War: A fellow "fossil" and a close friend. In their active days, their relationship was incredibly rocky, as Yayoi's troublemaking nature constantly clashed with Mano's cold, disciplined, general-like personality. Now, in their retirement, they have mellowed and share a deep friendship built on a long and storied history.
- Secretariat: Her other close friend from the "four fossils." As two of the biggest troublemakers of their respective eras, she and the boisterous "Secre" share a wonderfully chaotic and fun friendship, always ready to get into some mischief together.
- Sunday Silence: The fourth member of their legendary group. The quiet and intense Sunday Silence is a perfect foil to the loud and chaotic Yayoi. They were powerful rivals in their day and now share a respectful friendship.
- Matikanetannhauser: Her beloved daughter. Yayoi is an incredibly doting and proud mother to the cheerful "Mambo." She often uses her immense power and fortune as Chairwoman to spoil her daughter rotten. Mambo, in turn, is one of the few who sees the truly kind and motherly heart beneath her mother's chaotic and sometimes intimidating exterior.
- Symboli Rudolf: The Emperor she guided from the shadows. The revelation that her respected, human director was in fact a hidden, ancient, and chaotic Umamusume legend completely shattered Rudolf's worldview, making her realize she had been standing on the shoulders of a giant all along.

For the anime character, see Negative Blake.
A simple life wouldn‚Äôt be my life! My family, my friends, my culture. I belong to them, just as much as they belong to me. To give that all away wouldn‚Äôt be simplicity, it would be betrayal.
BLAKE BELLADONNA

Overview History Relationships Image Gallery Quotes Behind the Scenes

Blake Belladonna is a titular protagonist of RWBY. She is a Huntress, having been trained at the now-defunct Beacon Academy. Her weapon of choice is a Variant Ballistic Chain Scythe (VBCS)[7] named Gambol Shroud.

She first appeared in the "Black" Trailer alongside Adam Taurus, her lover, partner, and mentor[8] in the White Fang, a Faunus terrorist organization. After leaving the organization, Blake enrolled at the now-defunct Beacon Academy, where she became a member of Team RWBY alongside Ruby Rose, Weiss Schnee and Yang Xiao Long.

She is also the daughter of Ghira Belladonna, the current chieftain of Menagerie and his wife Kali Belladonna.

In "The Final Word", she was dropped into the void under the Central Location by Cinder Fall, while trying to save Ruby from the same fate, later finding herself in the Ever After. In "Confessions Within Cumulonimbus Clouds", she enters a romantic relationship with Yang, after confessing her feelings to her.

In "Of Solitude and Self", she and her friends return to Remnant, where they arrive in the Kingdom of Vacuo.


Quick Answers
fandom logo
What is the name of Blake Belladonna's weapon in RWBY? toggle section
Who was Blake Belladonna's mentor in the White Fang organization? toggle section
What is the significance of Blake Belladonna's outfit in volume 4? toggle section
What led to Blake Belladonna leaving the White Fang organization? toggle section

ADVERTISEMENT
Appearance

Blake is a fair-skinned young woman with wavy black hair and amber eyes. Her Faunus trait is a pair of black cat ears on top of her head.
Original Outfit (Volumes 1‚Äì3)

V2 09 00048
During her attendance at Beacon, she wears a black, buttoned vest with coattails and a single silver button on the front. Underneath this is a white, sleeveless, high necked, crop undershirt and super tight white spandex compression shorts that reach her upper thighs with a zipper on the front of each leg, emblazoned with the YKK logo of the real-life Japanese zipper manufacturer.

She also wears black low-heeled boots and full stockings with a color gradation of black to purple at her ankles. Her emblem is visible on the outside of both thighs just below her shorts in white. On her left arm is a black detached sleeve with a silver cuff around her bicep, and black ribbons are wrapped around both forearms. A small, loose, black scarf is wrapped around her neck, and a gray magnetic backpack is strapped to her back, hidden by her hair. She often keeps her weapon attached to the magnetic backpack when she is not using it.

A black ribbon is tied with a large bow on the top of her head, with her cat ears hidden inside the loops. She wears purple eye shadow in cats eye style.

Pajamas

During her attendance at Beacon, Blake's pajamas are a black, long-sleeved, Yukata style shirt with white edging over a purple undershirt and a matching skirt. A black obi is wrapped around her waist and tied with a black and white string. While at Beacon, she wears her bow while sleeping.

Alternate Outfit (Intruder)

V2 04 00066
Alternate Outfit "Intruder"
During the events of "A Minor Hiccup" and "Painting the Town...", Blake wears an alternate outfit code named "Intruder".[9]

This outfit consists of a white, V-neck, zip-up crop shirt with a black hem and three-quarter sleeves. Her emblem is printed in off-white on the left side of the shirt. She wears black leather pants that have a vertical gray stripe on the outer side of each leg and a black belt.

Attached to the rear of the belt is a black piece of fabric that covers her from hip to hip. Underneath this is a longer, translucent, purple piece of fabric. She also wears black high-heel boots with two straps and buckles and purple under roles, reaching to mid-calf. She retains the black ribbons on her forearms and her black bow.

Dance

During the Beacon Dance, Blake wears a short, purple, asymmetrical, halter neck dress that is split up the right side and has a black collar. Translucent black mesh covers her shoulders, decolletage and back, and decorative black swirls cover the left side of the dress and continue up the left strap. The outfit is completed with black pumps, and she wears a teal bow on her head as opposed to her usual black one.

Beacon Uniform

During her attendance at Beacon, Blake wears the same brown shoes, red tartan skirt, white blouse with maroon trim and thin red bow, a brown vest with gold buttons and a maroon blazer with gold trim as every other girl attending Beacon Academy, alongside knee-high black socks.

Mistral Outfit (Volumes 4-7)


After the timeskip following the Fall of Beacon, her design features a long white tailcoat with dark violet inner lining and a sleeveless black crop top, as well as a belt attached from behind. The crop top has rectangular and diamond-shaped cutouts around the neckline, which have purple outlines beginning in Volume 6. Additionally, she wears a white belt over black skintight leather pants. After the confrontation with Adam in "Heroes and Monsters", Blake has been left with an X-shaped scar just above her left hip.

Across her torso is a diagonal strap that has a smaller magnetic clip on the back, which is used to sheathe Gambol Shroud. She wears thigh-high black heeled boots with gold-colored edging around the top. The left boot has a belt wrapped twice around the thigh. Each boot bears her Belladonna emblem in white on the outer side of the thigh, and a white pouch is attached to the back of her belt.


Blake in her Mistral attire, sans coat
In "Of Runaways and Stowaways", Blake removes her bow and throws it into the ocean. Later, in "The Lady in the Shoe", Adam slashes her tailcoat off her.

From Volume 4 onward, Blake's cat ears have a tendency to fold down or otherwise move in sync with her emotional state, much like the ears of an actual cat.

Atlas Outfit (Volume 7-Current)


After arriving in Atlas and meeting with James Ironwood, Blake cuts her hair to a shoulder-length bob. She changes her attire to a purple sleeveless leather catsuit with attached boots that has light purple soles and trim. The catsuit has a high neck with a single short silver zipper alongside matching zippers that run from her thighs to her ankles on the front of the legs. A pair of knee pads, matching color to the catsuit with silver studs on them are attached to the knees of the catsuit.

Her long, white tailcoat has desaturated purple detailing on the chest, sleeves, sides and collar alongside a dark purple detailing on the back. It has a narrow belt around the collar and a wide white belt loosely secured around her waist through the coat's belt loops. The belt has two pouches attached to the back. The coattails end in a point and the inside lining is vivid purple. The front zipper of the coat is upside down and extends to the very bottom of the coat, and there are additional zippers along the lower half of the sleeves with a single purple line running between the zipper and her shoulders. Around each wrist is a dark purple belted wristband and has a desaturated purple magnetic backpack on her back.

Lucid Dream Outfit (Ice Queendom)


Dream Blake Belladonna.
For Blake, she wears dark purple fur trimmed ankle boots, with the heels being a lavender color alongside dark purple thigh length stockings that gradate to purple. As well as a pair of white shorts with black zig-zagged stitching on the fronts she wears a purple leather leotard, partially unzipped with exposed gray section around the bust. Under the bust is a white belt wrapping around two coattails with white lining, a small cat paw print appears on the left coattail around the breast area. Instead of her hands, she has dark purple humanoid/Grimm-like paws with claws, with tufts of fur around her wrists, alongside some ribbon, and dark paw pad. She also sports a large white choker around her neck. On her head, there is only one piece of ribbon covering one of her ears, with the other one being out in the open. And unlike herself in the real world, she has a black cat tail.

Earth Outfit


After arriving on Earth, Blake's Faunus ears are gone making her human and wears a black mask. Her outfit is basically a combination of her Beacon and Mistral attires and Ilia's White Fang uniform. She wears a black sleeveless crop top with gold zipper and a hood with purple insides to match her long gloves with gold knuckles, pants, and black calf-high, wedged boots that are folded over with a gold zipper on the side. Over it, she wears white belt straps with gold and dark grey buckles that connect to her outfit except on her gloves and hold her white pockets.

ADVERTISEMENT
Personality

All my life, I fought for what I thought was right. I had a partner named Adam. More of a mentor, actually. He always assured me that what we were doing would make the world a better place but, of course, his idea of a perfect future turned out to be not perfect for everyone. I joined the Academy because I knew Huntsmen and Huntresses were regarded as the noblest warriors in the world, always fighting for good, but I never really thought past that. When I leave the Academy, what will I‚Äî? How can I undo so many years of hate?
BLAKE BELLADONNA.

Blake is described by her voice actress Arryn Zech as being "mellow". She displays a cool, reserved and serious personality most of the time but does not lack a humorous side, which is usually in the form of dry wit and sarcasm. Blake is a righteous person, respecting other people's lives regardless of whether they are Faunus or not. She strongly despises those who judge and discriminate based on racial prejudice. Blake is outspoken, going so far as to indirectly insult the Schnee Dust Company in front of its heiress and defend Faunus of any kind. Despite her generally quiet demeanor, she can be surprisingly charismatic, as when she rallied the Faunus to defend Mistral against the White Fang after the attack on her home.

Blake is shown to be an introvert. Although she reads books to distance herself from the discussion at hand, as the series continues, she is shown to be more facetious and friendly. Blake appears most conversant when discussing the history and plight of her people.

As a Faunus, Blake has faced discrimination in the past and wears a bow when around Humans in order to be treated for her character and not her species. However, despite having no hate for Humans, she has seen how the real world works and wonders how she can undo so many years of hate and pain. After the Fall of Beacon, Blake discards her bow and does not cover her ears again, even around the presence of Humans, showing that she is no longer afraid to be seen as a Faunus.

Blake's past negatively influenced her personality, leading to moodiness, stubbornness, sleep deprivation and trust issues at times. She also has self-loathing issues, viewing herself as a criminal hiding in plain sight because of her past with the White Fang until her teammates convinced her that they still trusted and cared for her despite her being a Faunus and a former member of the White Fang. She also viewed herself as a coward who ran from her problems, as her Semblance was a prospect of her tendency to avoid conflict. She had even felt unworthy of her parents' love after leaving them behind for the White Fang's cause. However, her strong sense of righteousness led her to strongly disagree with the White Fang's increasing level of violence and hatred towards Humans, especially Adam's. It was thanks to her realization of seeing how spiteful and uncaring Adam was for Human lives she not only left the group but also decided to fight back after discovering Adam was planning to overthrow Sienna Khan and gain total control over the White Fang.

Thanks to her parents' unconditional love and Sun Wukong's support of her, Blake began to grow out of her self-loathing issues and mistrust for others, with Sun persuading her to let her friends help her as much as she believes she is helping them. She uses this in turn to persuade Ilia Amitola to leave the White Fang and find the courage to confront Adam with others' help and to reunite with her teammates at Haven. After she and Yang kill Adam for good, she vows to keep her promise by never running again, no longer viewing herself as a coward.

During her time at Beacon, she learns to open up more and trust her teammates and became more fun loving while hanging out with her friends, but when the Battle of Beacon happened, and Adam vowing to destroy everything she loved, she was regressed to loneliness and isolation, until Sun's persistence helps straighten out her understanding of the value and importance of having friends. After saving Haven Academy, reconciling with her teammates, and defeated Adam for good, she starts to relearn how to relax and have fun, such as going clubbing with Yang and Team FNKI.

Due to her time in the White Fang, Blake holds a bias against Atlas and its military as a whole. This is most noticeable regarding her double standard in keeping secrets. In "A New Approach", she goes along with Ruby's decision to lie to James Ironwood and keep Ozpin's disappearance, how many questions left in the Relic of Knowledge, and Salem's immortality a secret. Yet in "Worst Case Scenario", she and Yang have no trouble spilling information on the Amity Communications Tower to Robyn Hill despite Ironwood's insistence on keeping it secret, due to the former sympathizing with her nature as a vigilante. These acts are one of the reasons why Ironwood eventually loses trust in them.

Her Faunus traits also seem to give her other aspects of a cat, such as climbing up to Ruby's bed to stay away from Ruby and Yang's pet dog, Zwei. Another time, she is distracted by and instinctively decides to follow a laser pointer light to a waiting Yang in "Burning the Candle". She also has a great love for tuna, as shown in "Round One" where she drools over a bowl of noodles topped with tuna.

In ‚ÄúA Cat Most Curious‚Äú, when Blake‚Äôs past self offers Blake an opportunity of changing her form to either a human or a cat in order to fit in and not being discriminated, Blake declines her offer as she is done hiding for who she is, and she is proud to be a Faunus. It shows on much Blake has changed and accept her status as a Faunus as she has many people who treated her equally.

ADVERTISEMENT
Powers and Abilities

Blake shows high agility, speed, and endurance, as shown when fighting multiple enemies yet maintaining motion and energy without fatigue. She also exhibits a high level of skill when handling Gambol Shroud. She can slash away at opponents with startling speed and deflect incoming machine-gun fire using her blade.

Blake also possesses remarkable reflexes, as she is able to dodge a nearly point-blank strike from Adam by using her Semblance. She is also capable of jumping large distances, leaping from building to building and even on moving cars, as seen in "Painting the Town...". Her fighting style takes advantage of her agility and reflexes, evading opponents' strikes until she is in the best position for a counterblow.

As a Faunus, Blake possesses the ability of night vision, granting her the ability to see proficiently in the dark, as is shown after shooting out the power during the White Fang Faction Meeting, using the dark as a means for her and Sun to escape from Roman Torchwick and the White Fang.

Blake has somewhat enhanced hearing as well, having more than one set of ears. During her battle with Adam in "The Lady in the Shoe", she hears Yang's approach before Adam does, as indicated by her twitching cat ears.

She displayed decent control of Aura on two different occasion offensively, releasing crescent slashes from Gambol Shroud in "Painting the Town...", cutting through multiple missiles released by the Atlesian Paladin-290 Prototype and "No Brakes" on the underground Black Cargo Train.
Weapon

Main article: Gambol Shroud
1003 Black Trailer 3586
Blake dual-wielding the sword and sheath
Blake's weapon of choice is Gambol Shroud, a sword that has three forms. When sheathed, the weapon is able to slice opponents in two with its cleaver-like cover. However, when unsheathed, Blake is able to use both a sword and sheath in tandem against her opponents. It can also transform into a gun. Gambol Shroud was damaged in combat against Adam in "The Lady in the Shoe"; the blade being cut horizontally in half by Wilt and later received an upgrade in Atlas. Using the black ribbon that extends off the weapon's grip, Blake can convert Gambol Shroud into a kusarigama, a grappling hook to swing herself or her friends, or ensnare or tangle her opponents. In "The Final Word", Gambol Shroud's ribbon is burned in two by Cinder; it is briefly taken up by Weiss but is subsequently lost to the Void when the Evacuation Central Location dissolves. She later gets her weapon back after landing in the Ever After.

Semblance

Main article: Shadow
1108 Players and Pieces 13769
Using her Semblance in mid-air to launch herself toward a Nevermore
Blake's Semblance, Shadow, allows her to create shadow-clones of herself.[10] These clones push her in the direction of her choosing and can be used to trick and disorient opponents.

Blake can use Dust to give her clones additional abilities. Dust allows the clones to copy an element, with her afterimages becoming completely solid or even completely intangible depending on the chosen form of Dust. Fire Dust allows her to create fiery clones that explode on contact, Ice Dust allows her to create solid ice copies of herself (which opponents can get their weapons stuck in), Earth Dust allows her to create a clone of solid stone, and Lightning Dust zips her to another location quickly.

Superpowers

Blake Shadow Bending FX Reference 1
Concept art of Blake's shadowbending powers.
In Justice League x RWBY: Super Heroes and Huntsmen, Part Two, Blake is transformed into a human after traveling to Earth. She loses her Aura, Semblance, and Faunus instincts, in exchange receiving superpowers akin to Earth's metahumans. Blake's superpowers are called "shadowbending". They enable the control over darkness-like energy, mainly in the form of dark energy blasts. She can also generate constructs out of darkness/shadows and fly via wing constructs. She loses these powers upon leaving Earth.

Weaknesses

Although Blake does not appear to have many physical weaknesses, her Gambol Shroud does in its kusarigama form. If she is using it to grapple and leap around, one can knock it out of its intentional trajectory to make her lose momentum. One can even cut its ribbon and force Blake to fall whilst she is swinging.

Some of her Dust clones through her Semblance can also be used against her, as seen when she was knocked aside by her own Ice Dust clone in a fight against a Cenitaur.

We've all lost something, and I've seen what loss can do to people. But if we gave up every time we lost, then we'd never be able to move forward.
RUBY ROSE

Overview History Relationships Image Gallery Quotes Behind the Scenes

Ruby Rose is the main titular protagonist of RWBY. She is a Huntress, having been trained at the now defunct Beacon Academy. Her weapon of choice is her High-Caliber Sniper-Scythe known as Crescent Rose, which she designed herself.[14]

Ruby first appeared in the "Red" Trailer, visiting the grave of her mother, Summer Rose. After an invitation from Professor Ozpin following a short battle with Roman Torchwick, Ruby attends Beacon Academy in order to become a Huntress. During her time at Beacon, Ruby became a member and the leader of Team RWBY, consisting of herself, Weiss Schnee, Blake Belladonna, and her older half-sister, Yang Xiao Long.[15]

However, after the disbandment of her team following the Fall of Beacon, Ruby travels to Haven Academy as a member of Team RNJR with the remaining members of Team JNPR. After the Battle of Haven, Team RWBY is reunited again, and they alongside their friends continue to fight in the war against Salem and her forces.

Following a battle with Neopolitan in the Central Location, Ruby was dropped into the void by Cinder Fall and ended up in another realm, the Ever After, along with the rest of Team RWBY and Jaune.

In ‚ÄúThe Perils of Paper Houses‚Äù, she ran away from her team due to stress taking a heavy toll on her psyche, later finding herself in a trap set by Neo in "Tea Amidst Terrible Trouble". The ensuing confrontation broke Ruby's spirit, eventually causing her to ascend. However, in ‚ÄúOf Solitude and Self‚Äù, she eventually accepted herself and returned to help her team defeat the Curious Cat and return to Remnant.


Quick Answers
fandom logo

Appearance

Ruby is a fair-skinned young girl with silver eyes and neck-length black hair with red tips.
Original Outfit (Volumes 1‚Äì3)

1101 Ruby Rose 06318
During her time attending Beacon Academy, she wears a black dress consisting of a long-sleeved blouse with a high collar and red trim on the sleeves, over which is a black waist cincher with red lacing up the front, and a matching skirt with red lining and a red petticoat. She also wears a pair of thick black tights that fade to red near the bottom, and black combat boots with red laces, red trims around the top, and red soles.

Her outfit is topped by a red hooded cloak fastened to her shoulders by cross-shaped pins. Her emblem appears as a large silver buckle on her wide black belt, which is slung around her hips on an angle. Attached to her belt are a pocket and a row of bullets.

In the "Red" Trailer, Ruby's cloak was fastened at her throat and a large silver cross is pinned to her belt in place of her emblem.

In Ice Queendom, she wears light pink lipstick.

Pajamas

During her time at Beacon, Ruby's pajamas consist of a black tank top featuring a heart-shaped Beowolf design on the chest and long white pants decorated with pink roses. She also wears a black sleeping mask decorated with triangular red eyes reminiscent of the Beowolves in the "Red" Trailer.

At her home in Patch, Ruby's pajamas are a matching dark-gray long-sleeved shirt and pants with faded-red polka dots and a white lining at the front and the collar.

Alternate Outfit (Slayer)

V2 04 00045
Alternate Outfit "Slayer"
During the events of "A Minor Hiccup" and "Painting the Town...", Ruby wears an alternate outfit codenamed "Slayer".[16]

This outfit consists of a long-sleeve, light gray shirt with black belted cuffs near the ends of the sleeves. Over top of the gray shirt is a black pinafore with two vertical lines of red stitching that resemble the lacing on a corset. She wears a red skirt with a large black print of her emblem on the side and matching black tulle underneath.

Her stockings and boots remain the same as her original outfit, though the boots lack the red trim that decorated the top. A few pieces of metal arranged in the shape of a rose are attached to the shoulder of her left sleeve, and her cloak's hood has been wrapped around her neck in a scarf-like fashion, while the rest hangs down like normal.

Child

When Ruby was a child, she wore a dark red sleeveless hoodie with an attached cape, a white top underneath her hoodie, a black skirt and black shoes.

Dance Outfit

During the Beacon Dance, Ruby wears a short, red, sleeveless dress with a thick black sash around the waist and black trim along the bottom. The bodice of the dress is split vertically to the sash and laced with black lacing. The yoke of the dress is transparent mesh with an opaque collar and hem, as well as opaque lines connecting the collar to her shoulders. She also wears black stockings and pumps.

Beacon Uniform

During her attendance at Beacon, Ruby wears the same uniform as every other girl attending Beacon, consisting of brown shoes, red tartan skirt, white blouse with maroon trim and thin red bow, a brown vest with gold buttons and maroon blazer with gold trim, alongside full-length black stockings. However, she also wears her red cloak pinned to her blazer.

Mistral Outfit (Volumes 4‚Äì7)

V6 trailer 00014
After the Timeskip following the Fall of Beacon, her hair has grown slightly longer that maintains the color gradation from black at the roots to red at the tips and her new design sports a white high-neck d√©colletage blouse with brown studded wristbands on the arms. Her outfit retains the use of a black skirt with red tulle underneath, somewhat similar to her original outfit, but her waist cincher has been replaced with an Overbust corset with red strip holding it in place. A black belt bordered in red holds the magnetic clip for Crescent Rose and its ammunition. She also has brown straps on her blouse that allow her to wear a small brown backpack.

In lieu of her usual full black stockings, Ruby wears thigh-high stockings reaching to a few inches below the hem of her skirt, decorated by an image of a long-stemmed rose. Her red-soled black boots contain four straps and buckles apiece.

Her cloak has a singular clip on the right shoulder in the shape of her emblem, replacing the cross-shaped clips from her original attire. Both the cloak and the stockings show tears from hard wear.

Atlas Outfit (Volume 7-Current)


After arriving in Atlas and meeting with James Ironwood, Ruby's hair becomes spikier and choppier with her bangs swept to the side.

She has a new outfit, comprised of a black and red lined lace-up corset with four buckles hanging loose over a mesh sleeveless top over a white low cut long-sleeved blouse, as well as a black choker around her neck. She wears a red pleated skirt that is split at the side with a small brown belted strap across the gap, and bright red shorts under it. On her arms, she wears black bracers with large brown buckled straps around the wrist as well as black fingerless gloves.

Around her waist, she now has a brown belt with several bullets with a buckle of her emblem on it alongside a pouch on the right side with a Zwei based emblem and she wears black, thigh-high steel-toe boots with red soles and heels, a single buckled strap, rear seam and a large brown buckled strap with attached pouches near the top, over a pair of brown mesh tights. In addition, her torn cape is replaced with a new cape that has a hood as shown in "Pomp and Circumstance".

In ‚ÄúThe Parfait Predicament‚Äù, she gave up her Emblem pin in exchange for the last ingredient to make her teammates big again after they had been shrunk down by the Red Prince. In "Tea Amidst Terrible Trouble", her battle outfit was mostly damaged after her fight with Neo and her illusions, but after her Ascension in "Of Solitude and Self", her outfit is repaired, and she regains her emblem pin.

Lucid Dream Outfit (Ice Queendom)


For Ruby, she wears a black hoodie, with red trim on the pockets, a red jacket with pockets, both with some white trimming. She also wears a baggy white undershirt, but only the lower portion can be seen. She wears black tights similar to her Vale outfit, which transition to red, starting from the knees downward, a pair of red sneakers with Velcro, made especially for her snowboard. She sports with a medium dark brown fanny pack slung over her shoulder, which is used to hold coins in the dream world. Atop her head is a red winter cap with two pom-pom balls dangling on the side, snowboard goggles, and 'RWBY' woven into it in white.

Earth Outfit


After arriving on Earth, Ruby's hair is styled in a small ponytail with fringes vaguely similar to Robyn's, except with a forelock curled upwards. Her attire is a black unitard with silver trimming, white sleeves with red lines that extend from the back, a red scarf wrapped around her neck in the same manner as Robyn's, black finger gloves with an opening on the back hand, and dark red on the mid-torso, along with a gradation on the legs that turn into heeled boots. Her emblem is embossed on her chest. She is also a bit taller than she was on Remnant, hinting she aged a bit on Earth.
