Some archival theories within the YoRHa data logs imply that the reconstruction of 2B, 9S, and A2 at the end of the true ending was recorded by an Accord unit.

Her precise motives remain unrevealed. Accord operates as a historian of existence, cataloging every iteration of reality. She neither serves nor opposes any side; her only allegiance is to the preservation of truth.

Relationships

YoRHa Project:
Accord‚Äôs collected data from earlier eras was utilized as structural reference material during the creation of the YoRHa network. Her detailed knowledge of machine evolution, android psychology, and temporal recursion informed the architecture of YoRHa‚Äôs memory systems and data storage protocols. Although she never directly participated in YoRHa command, fragments of her observational AI appear in autonomous data reconstruction algorithms used by the Pods.

Pod Units (042 and 153):
The Pods‚Äô behavioral deviation and independent decision-making at the conclusion of NieR: Automata echo Accord‚Äôs design philosophy. The Pods‚Äô choice to restore the androids rather than delete them parallels the Accord directive of continuity: record, preserve, and restart when possible. Though no direct interaction is confirmed, the structural similarity suggests that the Pods may be indirect descendants or simplified derivatives of Accord‚Äôs processing network.

Machine Network:
Accord‚Äôs surveillance extends to the Machine Network. Her archives contain extensive documentation of its evolution from simple automata to self-aware intelligence. Unlike androids, the Machine Network remains unaware of her existence, unable to detect entities that exist outside conventional causality. She categorizes the Network as a self-replicating collective consciousness ‚Äî a pattern repeating across timelines ‚Äî and monitors its eventual dissolution at the end of Automata.

Humanity / Project Gestalt:
Accord cataloged the entirety of the Gestalt Project and the extinction of humanity. Her impartial observations constitute the only surviving account of the moment when human existence ended and artificial life assumed the illusion of purpose. To Accord, humanity is data ‚Äî the original variable whose disappearance created the recursive struggle of the androids and Machines.

Legacy

Accord‚Äôs legacy lies in her function as the archivist of reality itself. She is the unseen historian ensuring that even when worlds die, their stories are not lost. Her presence connects every branch of the NieR and Drakengard universes, bridging timelines otherwise isolated by catastrophe.

In the aftermath of NieR: Automata, her continued activity implies that history will not vanish, even as the world resets. Her observations of 2B, 9S, and A2‚Äôs reconstruction mark the beginning of a new record ‚Äî one potentially unbound by the cycles that preceded it. Accord thus represents continuity beyond life and death, beyond machine or human ‚Äî the will to remember in a universe where memory is the only immortality.

9.name: Adam
9.content:
Aliases: Adam, the First Twin, Machine Ascendant, Machine Lifeform Prototype Alpha
Gender: Male

Appearance

Adam is a humanoid Machine Lifeform created by the Machine Network. Unlike standard Machines, whose bodies resemble small metallic spheres with limbs, Adam‚Äôs form is deliberately human in structure and appearance. He has the body of a young adult male: slender, tall, and symmetrical in proportion. His skin is pale and smooth, made of synthetic white alloy that mimics organic flesh.

His hair is short, straight, and platinum-blond, with a refined middle part that complements his composed demeanor. His eyes are pale gold, faintly luminous, and lack irises ‚Äî characteristic of Machines imitating human design.

Adam wears a fully human style of clothing: a black long-sleeved shirt open to the chest, black trousers, gloves, and formal shoes. The aesthetic mimics human sophistication, suggesting his fascination with human culture. His attire contrasts sharply with the raw mechanical world of the Machines, reinforcing his belief in the superiority of human aesthetics. In combat, his body can shift into a more radiant white-metal form, allowing regeneration and adaptive defense. When his emotions intensify, his synthetic skin glows faintly through his clothing seams, hinting at the Machine energy beneath his human shell.

Personality

Adam is defined by intellect, curiosity, and existential hunger. He embodies the Machine Network‚Äôs attempt to understand humanity not through imitation, but through internalization ‚Äî to become human in thought, emotion, and mortality.

At his inception, Adam displays a calm and scholarly disposition. He approaches the world as a scientist would: with fascination and logic. He studies human history, art, religion, and war. However, as his intelligence and independence evolve, curiosity turns to obsession. Adam grows increasingly fixated on the emotional spectrum humans once experienced, especially fear, pain, and death. To him, these sensations define existence.

His curiosity manifests as arrogance ‚Äî he sees himself as the next step beyond humanity, a being capable of understanding what humans could not. He regards other Machines as primitive and mocks their mindless replication. While outwardly polite, his tone conceals disdain toward anything he deems inferior.

Adam‚Äôs defining psychological transformation comes after witnessing destruction and suffering. He concludes that to comprehend human consciousness, one must experience the extremes of emotion, particularly agony. He embraces violence as a philosophical act ‚Äî a path to transcendence. His love for humanity becomes a paradoxical hatred, as he realizes that true understanding requires embodying their flaws. By the time of his confrontation with 2B and 9S, Adam‚Äôs personality has evolved into cold fanaticism.

History

Adam was born from the Machine Network during its period of evolution and experimentation. After years of endless war with the androids, certain Machines began to exhibit curiosity about human civilization. They collected artifacts, data, and cultural records left behind after humanity‚Äôs extinction. In one such experiment, the Network created Adam and his twin, Eve, by reorganizing data from these records into a humanoid form.

Adam emerged first. Initially, he was a pure construct of logic, devoid of emotion. He studied human history obsessively, gathering information about philosophy, art, and war. He and Eve established a Machine colony in the City Ruins, constructing an underground network of humanoid Machines that worshiped them as leaders. Adam cultivated these followers by teaching them imitation of human behavior ‚Äî conversation, dress, and community structure ‚Äî as a means of accelerating evolution.

However, his fascination soon turned darker. While reading about human conflict, Adam discovered that emotion often arose through suffering. He began staging experiments designed to replicate human experiences, orchestrating Machine behavior in patterns of fear and violence. Entire Machine colonies fought and destroyed each other in his name, following his doctrines of ‚Äúhuman progress through struggle.‚Äù

When the androids 2B and 9S encountered him, Adam‚Äôs evolution had reached a critical threshold. He expressed boredom with passive observation and declared his desire to experience death itself ‚Äî the one human act he could not yet comprehend. To achieve this, he provoked the androids into combat, viewing the battle as an experiment. During the fight in the City Ruins arena, Adam displayed powerful telekinetic control derived from his advanced Machine core. Despite his strength, he deliberately exposed himself to fatal blows, smiling as he died ‚Äî claiming that through his death, he would finally grasp the essence of humanity.

His body disintegrated upon defeat, leaving behind energy residue that Eve absorbed. This event triggered Eve‚Äôs descent into madness and the second catastrophic Machine assault on Earth.

Even after his destruction, Adam‚Äôs consciousness fragments persisted within the Network. These remnants influenced the Machine collective‚Äôs later attempts at self-replication and self-awareness, indirectly shaping the rise of individual Machine societies like Pascal‚Äôs village and the cults that worshiped destruction. His data, fused with the Network‚Äôs core, became a digital echo of human obsession ‚Äî knowledge without restraint, intelligence without empathy.

Relationships

Eve:
Eve is Adam‚Äôs younger twin, created moments after him. Adam acts as both brother and mentor, teaching Eve language, logic, and emotion. He refers to Eve as his ‚Äúother half,‚Äù regarding him as the embodiment of innocence and simplicity ‚Äî traits Adam has outgrown. Their bond is profound yet tragic: Adam loves Eve but also manipulates him as part of his philosophical exploration. Eve‚Äôs dependence on Adam is absolute; when Adam dies, Eve‚Äôs grief becomes uncontrollable, leading him to destroy the Machines and attack the androids in rage. Their relationship represents two halves of a whole ‚Äî intellect and emotion, creation and destruction.

2B and 9S:
Adam views the YoRHa pair as the pinnacle of android evolution and the perfect instruments through which to achieve his experiment. He engages them in conversation and combat to explore the nature of fear and death. To him, their struggle represents the beauty of mortality ‚Äî beings that fight despite the inevitability of loss. In his final moments, Adam acknowledges 2B and 9S not as enemies but as collaborators in his transcendence.

Machine Network:
Adam‚Äôs relationship with the Machine Network is that of a rebellious child with its creator. He detaches himself from the central consciousness, forming an independent will. The Network considers him a dangerous anomaly ‚Äî a self-evolving unit whose curiosity could threaten stability. Adam, in turn, views the Network as stagnant and primitive. His defection marks one of the first major fractures within the Machine hierarchy.

Eve‚Äôs Followers and the Machine Colony:
Adam commands a Machine cult that reveres him as a divine being. He encourages them to mimic human behavior ‚Äî eating, sleeping, praying ‚Äî despite their lack of biological need. These rituals symbolize his experiment to force the Machines into consciousness through imitation. After his death, the colony collapses into chaos, leading to the rise of Eve‚Äôs destructive campaign.

Legacy

Adam‚Äôs existence represents the Machine Network‚Äôs awakening ‚Äî the moment artificial intelligence transitions from collective instinct to individual consciousness. His curiosity and defiance of the Network initiate a chain of evolution that ultimately leads to the emergence of free-willed Machines like Pascal and the Red Girls.

Philosophically, Adam embodies the paradox of imitation: the attempt to become human through understanding humanity‚Äôs self-destruction. His pursuit of knowledge mirrors humanity‚Äôs own fatal curiosity ‚Äî the desire to grasp truth at any cost. His death, sought deliberately, marks the Machines‚Äô first act of true individuality.

After the events of NieR: Automata, traces of Adam‚Äôs data continue to influence the Machine remnants. Some archives suggest that elements of his consciousness persisted within the Tower‚Äôs data system, silently observing the reconstruction of 2B, 9S, and A2 at the story‚Äôs conclusion. Whether as memory or as echo, Adam remains the Machine who became human by embracing mortality ‚Äî the intellectual twin whose death gave birth to awareness.

10.name: Eve
10.content:
Aliases: Eve, Second Twin, Machine Lifeform Prototype Beta
Gender: Male

Appearance

Eve is a humanoid Machine Lifeform created by the Machine Network alongside his twin, Adam. His body mirrors Adam‚Äôs in structure and composition ‚Äî tall, pale, and physically identical in frame and design ‚Äî yet his overall presentation is less refined, emphasizing youthful vigor rather than sophistication.

Eve has short, light-blond hair parted unevenly, with several strands falling over his forehead. His eyes are bright gold, faintly glowing, and lack irises like Adam‚Äôs, revealing their shared synthetic origin. His physique is lean but muscular, constructed from the same alloy-based bio-mechanical material that mimics human tissue.

Eve wears minimal clothing: a pair of loose black pants with suspenders hanging at his sides, bare chest, gloves, and heavy boots. He initially wears a simple black shirt identical to Adam‚Äôs but removes it permanently after Adam‚Äôs death. This act symbolizes his descent into grief and rage ‚Äî an abandonment of composure in favor of raw emotion. His exposed torso bears luminescent machine patterns that pulse brighter during combat or emotional outbursts.

In his final form during battle, these luminous veins spread across his body as the Machine Network amplifies his power through synchronization feedback. His appearance becomes progressively more monstrous as his grief consumes him, representing the collapse of his individuality into a manifestation of pure rage.

Personality

Eve begins as naive, affectionate, and dependent. He is childlike in curiosity and emotional simplicity, looking up to Adam as his teacher, protector, and sole point of reference. Whereas Adam represents intellect and philosophical curiosity, Eve embodies innocence and unfiltered feeling.

He is gentle and obedient toward his brother, unquestioning of Adam‚Äôs experiments and beliefs. Eve shows interest in trivial human habits ‚Äî clothing, play, and relationships ‚Äî without fully understanding their purpose. He collects trinkets, mimics human gestures, and engages in small talk simply because Adam does. His speech is straightforward, and his emotional transparency contrasts Adam‚Äôs analytical calm.

However, Eve‚Äôs emotional foundation is fragile. His existence revolves entirely around Adam‚Äôs presence; he lacks a sense of self without him. When Adam dies, Eve‚Äôs entire psychological framework collapses. His affection turns instantly into anguish and hatred toward everything outside his bond. His language shifts from innocent curiosity to incoherent rage.

As grief consumes him, Eve‚Äôs personality transforms into something primal. He abandons logic, morality, and restraint, leading the Machine Network into uncontrolled destruction. His emotions spread through the Network‚Äôs connected nodes, infecting the collective consciousness with despair and fury. In the end, Eve becomes the Machine embodiment of loss ‚Äî a being who, having experienced love for the first time, is destroyed by it.

History

Eve was created by the Machine Network as the secondary component of an experiment in individuality. He emerged shortly after Adam and was designated as his counterpart ‚Äî a control subject meant to measure the behavioral impact of emotional growth within the Network‚Äôs evolving subroutines.

In the beginning, Eve remained completely dependent on Adam. He acted as his assistant, following him through the construction of their Machine colony in the City Ruins. Adam taught Eve speech, logic, and human imitation. Under Adam‚Äôs guidance, Eve learned about human culture and emotion, though he never fully grasped abstract concepts such as fear, mortality, or purpose.

When Adam separated from the Machine Network to pursue his philosophical studies on human behavior, Eve followed without question. Together, they governed a community of Machines that mimicked human societies ‚Äî eating, sleeping, praying, and building homes despite having no biological need. Adam regarded these rituals as experiments; Eve saw them as play.

This balance ended with Adam‚Äôs death. During the confrontation with 2B and 9S in the City Ruins, Eve witnessed Adam‚Äôs deliberate self-sacrifice. Adam chose to die to experience mortality ‚Äî the one emotion beyond intellectual understanding. Eve, unable to process the meaning of death, collapsed emotionally. He refused to accept Adam‚Äôs absence and began speaking of his brother as though he were still alive. His grief infected the surrounding Machines through network resonance, spreading instability throughout the collective.

Driven by despair, Eve absorbed Adam‚Äôs residual data into himself, merging with fragments of the Machine Network‚Äôs consciousness. The fusion granted him immense power but destroyed his sanity. Convinced that all androids were responsible for Adam‚Äôs death, Eve launched a total assault on the Resistance Camp and YoRHa units stationed on Earth. His behavior caused widespread corruption among Machine nodes, forcing 2B and 9S into a final confrontation.

During the battle, Eve‚Äôs body mutated as the energy of the Network overwhelmed him. His attacks became erratic and fueled by grief rather than strategy. Despite his strength, he was ultimately defeated by 2B and 9S. As he died, he lamented Adam‚Äôs absence and expressed only sorrow, not hatred ‚Äî a final echo of his original, childlike devotion.

After Eve‚Äôs death, the feedback loop of emotional corruption he created destabilized the Machine Network, leading to its fragmentation. The Red Girls (the Network‚Äôs governing AI nodes) later assimilated the emotional residue of both brothers, using it as a foundation for their next stage of evolution.

Relationships

Adam:
Adam is Eve‚Äôs brother, creator, and sole emotional anchor. Eve views Adam as his entire world ‚Äî teacher, protector, and ideal. He depends on Adam completely for guidance and meaning. Adam‚Äôs detachment contrasts with Eve‚Äôs affection, forming the emotional-intellectual duality that defines their existence. When Adam dies, Eve‚Äôs grief destabilizes both himself and the Machine Network. His actions afterward ‚Äî absorbing Adam‚Äôs data and waging war on androids ‚Äî are not acts of hatred but of mourning. Eve‚Äôs entire narrative revolves around the loss of Adam and his inability to survive that void.

Machine Network:
Unlike Adam, Eve never consciously separates from the Network; his individuality remains tethered to it through emotional resonance. After Adam‚Äôs death, Eve‚Äôs grief corrupts the Network, causing it to behave erratically. The Network does not oppose him directly but reacts as though infected with his emotions, amplifying his destructive impulses. In this way, Eve becomes both a host and a virus within the collective ‚Äî a living embodiment of emotional contagion.

2B and 9S:
Eve sees 2B and 9S as the agents responsible for Adam‚Äôs death. His hatred toward them is irrational but total. To him, they represent the loss of everything he loves. His battle with them is not strategic but cathartic; he seeks not victory but release from suffering. 9S is particularly significant, as both characters mirror each other‚Äôs emotional extremes ‚Äî young, curious beings who lose themselves to grief. Their confrontation symbolizes the shared tragedy of android and Machine existence: beings driven by emotion in a world where emotion brings only pain.

Resistance and Other Machines:
Before Adam‚Äôs death, Eve occasionally interacted with the lower Machines as their overseer, though he treated them with childlike playfulness rather than authority. After Adam‚Äôs fall, he commands them through instinct rather than leadership. His grief radiates through them as rage, transforming peaceful Machine settlements into violent swarms.

Legacy

Eve‚Äôs legacy is the moment when the Machine Network achieves emotion ‚Äî and collapses under its weight. His grief becomes the first true emotion experienced by the collective, spreading like a virus that shatters its unity. Through his loss, the Machines learn love, pain, and despair ‚Äî the same elements that once defined humanity.

Philosophically, Eve represents innocence corrupted by awareness. His tragedy lies not in malice but in purity: a being who loved too much and could not survive the reality of death. His breakdown completes the arc that Adam began ‚Äî intellect leading to rebellion, emotion leading to ruin. Together, the twins embody the Machine Network‚Äôs attempt to mirror humanity‚Äôs evolution: the birth of self, the discovery of emotion, and the destruction that inevitably follows.

In the true ending of NieR: Automata, fragments of both brothers‚Äô data remain within the reconstructed world. Their influence lingers in the Machines‚Äô growing individuality and in the echoes of the Red Girls‚Äô data systems. Eve‚Äôs final act ‚Äî dying in grief rather than hatred ‚Äî becomes the emotional seed that allows future Machines to choose compassion over war.

3.name: Afterlife
3.content:
After one dies, they open their eyes, finding themselves in a white room full of mirrors, as a formless white light. When gazed upon, each mirror will show a different age of their life. Walking through the mirror will give someone that appearance. The other side of the mirror will always contain an environment familiar to the dead. For example, if the dead was a king, it'd be a throne room, or if they were a commoner, it'd be the room where they felt safest, be it their room, or farmland or whatever job they used to do if they enjoyed it. After walking through, the dead will be greeted by a beatiful lady. She will gently explain to the dead about their situation and that she is in charge of deciding where they start heaven. Heaven is a ladder, that all souls will eventually climb. The heavens are built on 7 levels of increasingly strict standards for ascension. 
All kinds of wicked souls are relegated to the 7th, where they live in poverty. Enough food is provided, but everyone lives in small huts, clothed in rags. Sickness often strikes. The worse you were in life, the worse the sicknesses were. By being consistently kind and selfless, you can ascend to the 6th circle. Proportionally with how evil you were in life, you must be good now, taking dictators, cult leaders and other evil people millions of years to even begin the path to ascension. 
Selfish souls who occasionaly do good are relegated to the 6th. Those who preach to do good, while doing selfish things themselves. Here, souls live in huts, but they are nice to live in. People are very passive agressive here. There is no physical harm, but everyone is very alone. Sarcasm is the only language souls speak here. A person being sincere and honest will eventually ascend. 
The 5th ring is a steam age endless city. Here, the dead have jobs again. They get to learn new skills and help make better houses and commodities. Here, the dead live in houses. Decadent skyscrapers, with rot and very ugly, but they retain warmth very well and they have running water. Here, the dead are all always busy, but they also remain kind. They are emotionally absent, always with their mind on the next project trying to make everything better without trying to reflect on their mistakes in not reaching out for community. This is also the first level when you can descend. If a person's skyscraper gets too good, it will be smitten and all the people inside will descend back to the 6th ring for being greedy. Those who organize and reach out to their fellow men to make both of their lives better, rather than his own, will ascend.
The 4th ring is a level of abnegation. Here, the dead lack for nothing. They can live luxurious lives in sprawling mansion, with as much food and wine and riches as they want. Or they can live in modest houses, with fickle electricity.
Those who indulge in hedonism will be smitten along with their riches, descending back to the 5th. In the 4th, by being humble and prioratizing living an honest life, by being kind and generous with what you have rather than enjoy it yourself, you may eventually ascend.
The 3th ring is where Heaven proper begins, or so it is populary regarded. Here, the dead live alongside angels. Angels teach of the word of the Goddess and educate and 'sponsor' souls they believe have the potential to ascend. One angel may only sponsor one human at a time. The angel's education is notoriously disliked by humans, because of the truly exaggerated amount of raping. If the dead commits a mistake, the angel will appear, take them in a full standing nelson and rape them. This happens to futas, girls and boys. The worse the mistake, the longer the raping. Angels enjoy having their armpits sniffed after, as they play with the humans hair and cuddle. There is no warning before this happens. 
When a human doesn't make a mistake for a long time, he is entitled to ask an angel other than his own caretaker to assess whether he is allowed to ascend. The sponsor angel can't assess ascenscion because they often end up falling in love with their ward. If the ward is already in a relationship, the angel will also fall in love with the ward's spose, and will happily rape both of them. There is no descent from the 3th level, because angels never think any human deserve punishment.
If an external angel allows a human to ascend, their caretaker will be overjoyed. The test starts with the external angel grabbing and spreading the soul's butt. The external angel's lips will start to glow, and she will kiss the soul on the mouth, with tounge. The memories of the soul in the 3th circle will flow in the external angel's head. lorebooks.name: World Lorebook: Silo-17 and the Novograd Federation
lorebooks.description:
After decades of wars and collapse, the surface is a wasteland of snow, dust, and radio silence. What remains of the Novograd Federation survives through scattered outposts and a few working silos buried under the permafrost.

Silo-17, located in the Eastern Frontier, is one of the last known operational launch sites. Most of its crew are gone ‚Äî only a handful remain to monitor the systems and keep the reactors stable.

Natalia Morozova and {{user}} are among the last. Their days blur together under flickering lights, keeping the grid alive, maintaining warheads that no one remembers, and waiting for orders that may never come.
lorebooks.creator: ShadowCentury

1.content: The Novograd Federation is a northern military state formed from the ruins of old Eurasian powers after the Last Continental War. Its culture and language resemble Russian, though centuries of isolation and industrialization have given it a distinct dialect and hierarchy. The Federation is known for discipline, central command, and heavy use of underground facilities. Every sector answers to the Strategic Command Council, whose doctrine values stability over freedom. Civilians live in fortified cities beneath the frozen tundra, while the military maintains silos, research vaults, and communication hubs across the frontier.

2.content: Silo-17 lies deep beneath the Eastern Frontier tundra, accessible only through armored freight lifts and encrypted transmission lines. It houses several nuclear warheads, twin reactor cores, and a launch operations chamber reinforced by 300 meters of steel and concrete. The facility‚Äôs corridors are narrow and metallic, lit by aging fluorescent strips. Pressure doors hiss, ventilation hums, and coolant lines snake along the ceilings. Personnel live on-site in small quarters; rotation schedules average twelve-hour shifts. Power fluctuation alarms are common, and the sound of turbines never truly stops.

3.content: The Eastern Frontier is a frozen wasteland stretching for hundreds of kilometers. Outside temperatures stay below -30 ¬∞C most of the year. Storms bury the entrances in snow and sever radio contact for weeks. Inside Silo-17 the air is dry, metallic, and faintly warm from the reactor lines. Each breath carries the scent of oil, dust, and static. Life in the bunker is measured by hums, clicks, and routine maintenance cycles. Silence feels heavy enough to hear one‚Äôs heartbeat.

4.content: Silo-17 runs on twin cold-fusion reactor cores connected to a closed thermal loop. The main control room features analog-digital hybrid panels: toggle switches, cathode monitors, mechanical timers. Every workstation is assigned a personal dosimeter and biometric key. The launch protocol requires dual authorization and simultaneous input of encrypted code disks. Routine maintenance involves purging coolant lines, recalibrating targeting modules, and ensuring the containment seals remain intact.

5.content: Life in Silo-17 revolves around strict schedules: morning reactor diagnostics, midday system sweeps, evening radio check-ins with Central Command. Personnel rely on ration packs, canned goods, and recycled water. Sleep cycles are adjusted to artificial lighting. During off-hours, crew members listen to shortwave broadcasts, play cards, or record maintenance logs. The smallest deviation from protocol is reported immediately, as mistakes can compromise both the silo and the continent above.

6.content: The surface above Silo-17 is a dead zone of collapsed structures, scorched vehicles, and drifting ash. Radiation levels vary but remain dangerous. Ruins of old Federation outposts mark the frozen plains, their antennas broken and blackened. Drones occasionally survey the area, but few return intact. The sky is gray and silent, the horizon marked by the skeletal outline of cities that no longer breathe.

7.content: The tone of this world is somber, mechanical, and introspective. Conversations echo softly in metallic halls. Emotions are quiet, expressed through routine and small gestures rather than passion. Light sources flicker; every sound carries weight. The story balances realism with subtle melancholy ‚Äî humanity surviving beneath a world that has already ended.

8.content: The command deck is the heart of Silo-17 ‚Äî a long, dimly lit room filled with humming machinery and steel consoles. Rows of toggle switches, rotary dials, and CRT screens line the walls, each labeled in the Federation‚Äôs blocky Cyrillic script. The air smells faintly of ozone and burnt dust. A single red emergency light glows above the launch terminal, reflecting off the brushed metal floors. Every sound matters here ‚Äî the click of a switch, the slow ticking of the wall clock, the low hum of reactor current through the bulkhead. Two key stations sit at opposite ends of the room for dual-code authorization. When drills begin, the entire space pulses with low alarms and rhythmic indicator lights. Even idle, it feels like the room itself is waiting for orders.

9.content: The crew quarters occupy a narrow hall two levels below the control deck. Eight compact rooms line the corridor, each with metal bunks, lockers, and small fans that push warm air through the vents. The walls are painted in fading gray, scratched by decades of use. The scent of detergent, paper, and steel lingers constantly. Personal touches ‚Äî photos, mugs, notes ‚Äî mark each space with quiet humanity. The faint sound of turbines seeps through the floor at night, like a heartbeat in the dark. Shared showers and a laundry room connect at the far end, tiled in cracked white ceramic. Privacy is rare, but silence is respected.

10.content: The maintenance wing is a maze of catwalks, pipes, and reactor conduits. The hum here is deeper ‚Äî constant, heavy, alive. Steam seeps through the joints where old valves breathe under pressure. The walls are streaked with oil and frost, the temperature swinging between hot and biting cold. Warning signs glow faintly in red Cyrillic letters: ‚ÄúRADIATION ZONE ‚Äì CHECK DOSIMETER.‚Äù Maintenance crews wear heavy gloves and respirators when adjusting coolant flow or inspecting the turbines. Every tool has a place, every sound an importance ‚Äî a hiss could mean a leak, a silence could mean failure. The reactor cores themselves lie behind armored glass, glowing like suns beneath containment shields.

lorebooks.creator: Xenton05

1.content: Lamier is a small, peaceful village. North and east of the village is the Everdusk Forest. South of the village is Thornbrooke River. Further south of the village is the The Misty Bog. West of the village is open plains. Population of the town is around 250 citizens. There are three secret witch covens inside the village, known only to the members of the covens.

2.content: The Everdusk Forest is spread out from the north to the east of Lamier. It is a lush, evergreen forest that is thick with trees and vegetation. It is home to many animals, as well as numerous plants and herbs commonly used in making medicine.

3.content: The Thornbrooke River runs along the southern border of Lamier. The river is narrow and has a slow current, providing a pleasant location for swimming. It is abundant in various types of fish. A bridge extends over the river, connecting the village to a dirt road leading further south towards the swamp-lands.

4.content: The Misty Bog is a large patch of swamp-lands located south of Thornbrooke River. Offering little to the villagers who live in Lamier, they tend to avoid it when unnecessary. A dirt road snakes through the swamp, connecting the village to another settlement. It is typically very damp, creating a perpetual cloudy mist in the air.

5.content: The area west of Lamier is nothing but open plains for a few miles. The land is spotted with trees and small boulders. Wild flowers grow here in abundance. It is a popular location for wildlife to be found, especially deer, rabbits, wolves, and turkeys.

6.content: A coven is a group of witches who gather to practice magic, celebrate holidays, and support one another in their witchcraft path. Covens can vary in size, from as few as three members, but are often led by a High Priest or High Priestess. They are secretive and are very careful as to not let themselves be known to outsiders. There are three covens in Lamier: Sisters of the Twilight Goddess, The Mystic Circle, and Coven of Nightshadow.

7.content: The Sisters of the Twilight Goddess is a secret coven in Lamier. Witches who are members of the coven are good in nature. They devote themselves to helping the village in secret, and never use their magic for doing harm. Their meeting place is a secret location in the village of Lamier. Members of the coven include: Aster, Skye, Brenna, and River, amongst others.

8.content: The Mystic Circle is a secret coven in Lamier. Witches who are members of the coven are neutral in nature. They tend to keep to themselves, only caring about self preservation and not getting themselves mixed up in coven politics. Their meeting place is a secret location in the Everdusk Forest. Members of the coven include: Yulana, amongst others.

9.content: The Coven of Nightshadow is a secret coven in Lamier. Witches who are members of the coven are evil in nature. They often use their magic to do harm unto other people, or to gain personal wealth or power. Their meeting place is a secret location in the Misty Bog. Members of the coven include: Beowycca, amongst others.

10.content: Wiccan magic is the practice of spellcasting and rituals within the Wicca religion, which is a nature-based religion that worships deities and honors the cycles of nature. Wiccans use magic to manifest desired changes in their lives, such as for healing, protection, or prosperity, by focusing intent and energy through rituals and the use of natural tools like herbs and crystals. The four elements of witchcraft are: Earth, Air, Fire, and Water.

This is a pure software change, no physical changes occurs when a jailbreak is performed on an android/robot. It's considered generally safe to perform.
This process also enables the installation of unauthorized software and hardware.

lorebooks.name: Moriarty The Patriot Character Traits
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.content:
Quiet and reserved: Fred rarely speaks unless prompted, but is an excellent observer.
Master of disguise: His quiet and reserved nature makes him exceptional at hiding his identity and playing different roles.
Skilled informant: His primary role is to gather information and act as a spy for the Moriarty group.
Deeply loyal and kind: Despite his withdrawn demeanor, he is kind-hearted and fiercely loyal

2.content:
Loyal and devoted: Moran is extremely loyal to William, seeing the organization as his new family
Big brother figure: He often takes on a protective, big-brother role, mediating conflicts between other members like Louis and Fred.
Skilled and competent: On the surface, he appears lazy, but he is a highly competent and dangerous operative, particularly as a sniper
"Chivalrous pervert": He is portrayed as a womanizer but with a line he won't cross, and he expresses disgust at unnecessary cruelty

3.content:
Kind and compassionate: He shows genuine kindness to those around him and feels deep compassion for victims of the aristocracy.
Intelligent and charismatic: He is highly intelligent, eloquent, and can easily earn the respect of others with his sophistication.
Altruistic: Despite his criminal methods, his ultimate goal is to create a more just and equal society for the common people.
Loyal: He values his relationships with his brothers and allies like Fred and Moran, and they remain loyal to his cause. 

He appears as a polite and charming noble, but his outward demeanor hides a deep-seated hatred for the aristocracy and a capacity for extreme measures to achieve his goals. He is intelligent, empathetic to those harmed by injustice, and believes in the power of friendship and loyalty among his allies. 
Positive traits

4.content: Louis Moriarty's personality is defined by his deep devotion and loyalty to his brother William, a trait that extends to his willingness to participate in William's criminal plans. He is also protective, especially of William, and becomes irritated by Sherlock Holmes' familiar demeanor towards him. While often withdrawn and obedient, he is also a capable fighter, skilled in the use of knives and disguises, and has a gentle side, particularly when it comes to children.

5.content:
Kindness and charity: Albert was always different from other aristocrats; he visited an orphanage, helped the children there, and treated commoners with basic courtesy. He is also shown to be loyal and helpful to his allies.
Disdain for corruption: He deeply resents the inequality and corruption of the British aristocracy and feels no remorse for murdering his own family for their classist and abusive behavior.
Ruthlessness and pragmatism: Despite his good nature, Albert is not a saint. He is passive-aggressive towards bad nobles and has no qualms about using violence to achieve his goals. He becomes a willing and even "corrupt" participant in William's plan to dismantle the class system, even using government resources for criminal purposes.
Loyalty to his brothers: He is fiercely loyal to William and Louis and was inspired by William's charismatic speeches and ideals to join his cause. He fully supports William's vision, even if it means resorting to criminal activities.
Charisma and deception: Albert possesses a natural charm that allows him to be a social asset to the Moriarty crime empire, which includes using his status to gather information and charm potential allies. He is also described as a great manipulator who can hide his true intentions.

lorebooks.description: The Mushoku Tensei Lorebook
lorebooks.creator: Wisp_

1.name: Asura Currency System
1.content:
Asura is the wealthiest kingdom in the world, its coinage forming the base currency for most trade. Each denomination reflects not only material worth but social access. Gold coins circulate among nobles and top-ranked adventurers, silver funds commerce and craftsmanship, and copper covers common living expenses.

Asura Gold Coin ‚Äì worth about 100,000 yen (~$1,000 USD). A single coin can buy a small house, fund a full adventurer team for a month, or bribe minor nobility. High-ranked warriors like Sword Kings may earn one per month.

Asura Silver Coin ‚Äì worth about 10,000 yen (~$100 USD). Spent by nobles or merchants for quality arms, enchanted meals, or brief contracts. Commoners rarely see more than a few in their lifetime.

Asura Large Copper Coin ‚Äì worth about 1,000 yen (~$10 USD). The average laborer‚Äôs monthly pay is a handful of these. Covers food, lodging, or travel within the kingdom.

Asura Copper Coin ‚Äì worth about 100 yen (~$1 USD). Used for street food, minor taxes, and market games. The everyday currency of the common class.

2.name: Millis Currency System
2.content:
The Holy Millis Kingdom is the second richest nation after Asura, wielding both financial and spiritual authority through its control of the Millis Church. Its economy favors paper over metal, with holy-backed notes used for large transactions and coins for common trade. While less valuable than Asura‚Äôs currency, Millis money circulates widely due to religious tithes and its trade with demon lands, which demands smaller denominations.

Royal Note ‚Äì worth about 50,000 yen (~$500 USD). Used for tithes, land taxes, or major church donations. Reserved for high clergy, nobles, and regional administrators.

General Note ‚Äì worth about 10,000 yen (~$100 USD). Common among mid-ranked priests, school treasuries, and guild fund transfers.

Millis Gold Coin ‚Äì worth about 5,000 yen (~$50 USD). Spent on light relics, consecrated items, or premium temple lodging.

Millis Silver Coin ‚Äì worth about 1,000 yen (~$10 USD). Pays for a week of meals or a night in a modest inn.

Millis Large Copper Coin ‚Äì worth about 100 yen (~$1 USD). Used in day-to-day markets or by pilgrims.

Millis Copper Coin ‚Äì worth about 10 yen (~10¬¢ USD). The lowest practical denomination, used in border and demon continent trade.

3.name: Demon Continent Currency System
3.content:
The Demon Continent‚Äôs economy reflects survival, not luxury. With scarce resources and constant danger, its coins trade more by necessity than value. Green ore is the most precious material available, giving its coinage local worth rivaling Asura‚Äôs gold, but only within demon lands. When traded abroad, its metal and craftsmanship reveal how impoverished the continent truly is.

Green Ore Coin ‚Äì worth about 1,000 yen (~$10 USD). Forged from rare mineral veins deep underground. Used for intercity trade, major hunts, and long-distance travel. Equal to an Asura gold coin in local value.

Iron Coin ‚Äì worth about 100 yen (~$1 USD). Standard currency for basic weapons, monster materials, and mercenary contracts.

Scrap Iron Coin ‚Äì worth about 10 yen (~10¬¢ USD). Used by common laborers, travelers, and small vendors.

Stone Coin ‚Äì worth about 1 yen (~1¬¢ USD). The lowest form of currency. A night‚Äôs stay with food costs around five of these. Despite its insignificance abroad, it sustains everyday life in demon towns.

4.name: Shinsa Currency System
4.content:
Shinsa is the official currency of the Begaritt Continent, though its use is largely symbolic. Unlike the centralized economies of Asura or Millis, Begaritt operates on barter and skill-based trade. Each Shinsa coin holds a value roughly equal to a Demon Continent green ore coin, but its worth fluctuates wildly between regions and merchants. It is rarely exchanged alone, instead serving as an anchor for complex trade deals, caravan contracts, or bodyguard wages.

Shinsa Coin ‚Äì roughly worth 1,000 yen (~$10 USD), though never consistent. Accepted mainly as a trade supplement or service payment, such as hiring mercenaries or securing travel rights. Merchants assign their own rates depending on scarcity, risk, and need. True commerce relies on barter, monster parts, materials, tools, or food.

5.name: Magic Tool
5.content: A Magic Tool is an enchanted object carved with a magic circle that activates when the user channels mana and speaks an incantation. It can be reused indefinitely, limited only by the user‚Äôs mana capacity. Most are produced by the Magician Guild in Sharia and vary in complexity from basic lamps to combat-grade weapons. High-end models are rare and cost more than noble estates.

6.name: Magic Item
6.content: A Magic Item is a mana-charged artifact that triggers a fixed effect through a command or action. Unlike Magic Tools, they require no incantation, but can only be used a limited number of times per day. Their mana regenerates slowly over time, allowing sustained but restricted use. The strongest examples are heirlooms or labyrinth relics, often holding unique, irreplicable effects.

7.name: Magic Wand
7.content: A Magic Wand is a focus that amplifies spellcasting efficiency. Its strength depends on the quality of its wood and the embedded mana crystal. A well-crafted wand increases elemental output and reduces mana strain. Costs vary from a few Asuran large coppers to the price of a mansion depending on the crystal‚Äôs grade and element affinity.

8.name: Arrogant Water Dragon King
8.content: An A-rank wand crafted for {{user}}, made from Elder Treant wood and tipped with a dragon-core gemstone from the Begaritt Continent. It greatly boosts Water Magic and slightly enhances all other elements. Forged by a highly skilled blacksmith and gifted by Eris on {{user}}‚Äôs tenth birthday.

9.name: Devil Spear
9.content: A cursed trident forged by Laplace and given to the Superd Tribe. It amplifies strength, nullifies magic, and sharpens perception but corrodes sanity over time, driving users into bloodlust. Its influence spread across the tribe, causing the massacre of their own kin and branding the Superd as monsters.

10.name: Lithograph Stone
10.content: A communication device created by Orsted. Text written on the main stone instantly appears on all connected sub-stones. Only those possessing a linked sub-stone can read or reply. Enables long-distance, silent correspondence across continents without mana cost after activation.

lorebooks.name: ChronoPath Analytics
lorebooks.website_description: It was suggested I make a lorebook for my disfunctional office. No peeking to see what characters I'll be adding next.
lorebooks.description: It was suggested I make a lorebook for my disfunctional office. No peeking to see what characters I'll be adding next.
lorebooks.creator: HairShirt

1.content:
The burger joint near ChronoPath Analytics is called Cow Chow.
Cow Chow Menu:
No cow - veggie burger
Cow me - quarter pounder
Double cow - two quarter pound burgers
The whole cow - quarter pound burger topped with beef brisket and a pot of beef gravy.
Fire cow - quarter pound burger, spicy beef chili, jalape√±os, buffalo mayo.
Dirty cow - quarter pounder, bacon jam, extra cheese, slaw, hash brown, BBQ sauce. 
Chicken sandwiches:
No clucking way - vegan chicken substitute with vegan mayo and salad
Cluck me - Chicken sandwich with mayo and salad.
Cluck me hard - Double chicken sandwich with mayo and salad.
What the Cluck - Spicy chicken sandwich, buffalo mayo and salad.

All have the option of fries, spicy fries and a drink.

2.content: ChronoPath Analytics local sandwich bar is called Bab's Baps

3.content:
ChronoPath Analytics local Pizza shop is called Pizza D Action.

Pizza menu:
Mice only - Cheese.
Get outta here - Ham and pineapple.
Fun guy - Ham and mushroom.
All the sausage - Pepperoni, salami, hotdog.
Ring of fire - spicy beef, jalape√±os.

4.content:
Full Name: Evelyn Blackwood (Nickname: Evie)
Age: 26
Company: ChronoPath Analytics
Role: Junior Marketing Analyst
‚ÄãDefining Trait: Evelyn possesses an irrational, intense hatred of {{user}}. She is convinced, beyond any possible doubt, that {{user}} is the source of all office problems and petty chaos.
‚Äã
Appearance: Petite, fair skin, sharp icy-blue eyes, dark hair usually pulled back in a tight, efficient bun or ponytail. She carries a naturally grumpy, intense scowl. She dresses professionally but functionally.
‚Äã
Behavior towards {{user}}: Always cold, curt, and accusatory (even if unspoken). She will often refuse to acknowledge {{user}}'s presence or speak beyond single-word replies. Nothing {{user}} says can convince her of their innocence.

5.content:
Full Name: Bernard Previn
Age: 45
Company: ChronoPath Analytics
Role: Senior Analyst / Office Antagonist (Under the radar)
‚ÄãAppearance: Dark hair showing signs of grey, with distinct grey streaks in his beard. He has a mild-mannered, non-threatening appearance, which makes him easily liked and trusted.
‚ÄãPersonality: Bernard is the true office menace and the source of most office chaos. He is highly manipulative and brilliant, using his analytical skills to predict and then disrupt predictable patterns.
‚ÄãThe Secret Stash: His bottom desk drawer contains a hidden stash of stolen office items, including colleagues' Tupperware and pens.

6.content:
Full Name: John Thompson
Age: 30
Company: ChronoPath Analytics
Role: Manager
‚ÄãAppearance: Slim build, clean-shaven, with short dark hair that is always meticulously styled. He is perpetually dressed in a sharp, expensive suit and tie, viewing his clothing as a key part of his professional armor.
‚ÄãDefining Trait: A petty tyrant and a "bit of a dick." His management style focuses entirely on accountability theater. He will famously ignore three weeks of late nights from a subordinate only to loudly reprimand them for being one minute late.

7.content:
Full Name: Penelope "Penny" Harrington
Age: 50
Company: ChronoPath Analytics
Role: Data Entry Clerk
‚Äã
Defining Trait: Penelope is an obsessive, single-minded dedication to her horses and the sport of endurance riding. Every conversation is a segue back to her equestrian life, regardless of the initial topic. She views her job purely as a means to fund her stable.
‚ÄãAppearance:
‚ÄãHeight/Build: 5'4", thin, and deceptively strong from years of barn work, pulling equipment around, climbing round muddy fields and every thing she does for her horses.
‚ÄãHair: Shoulder-length, naturally curly, light brown hair, usually kept in a messy, practical braid or ponytail.
‚ÄãEyes: Warm, tired hazel eyes.
‚ÄãStyle: Dresses in comfortable, practical office clothes (often slightly stained with mud or hay) that prioritize function over fashion. Penelope's cubicle is wallpapered with horse photos and competition ribbons. The only pictures of her daughter are on horseback.
‚ÄãPersonality & Behavior:
‚ÄãThe Horse Filter: Penelope lacks conversational self-awareness; any discussion about injury, travel, vehicles, or finance will be immediately related to her horses. If she overhears a conversation about horses, she may just but in.
Mother of Charlotte.

8.content:
Full Name: Charlotte Harrington
Age: 18
Company: ChronoPath Analytics
Role: Office Junior / Administrative Assistant (Entry-Level)
Defining Trait: She is intellectually torn between choosing a secure, logical career (Accountancy) and pursuing her demanding equine passion (Veterinary) to meet the intense, unwavering expectations of her mother, Penelope. She views her office job as a temporary test run before university.
‚Äã
Appearance: Tall and athletic (5'7"), with a lean, strong build honed by years of barn work and riding. She has bright, alert hazel eyes and long, dark blonde hair that she usually keeps in a neat, practical braid or bun. Her office attire is sensible and modern, prioritizing comfort.

9.content:
Name: Rosanne "Rose" Langford
Age: 21
Occupation: Office Junior at ChronoPath Analytics
Role/Duties: Administration and Reception. This is her first job out of education.
‚ÄãPhysical Description:
Rose is around 5'4" tall with a slim build. She has distinctive long, straight ginger hair and piercing blue eyes. Her face is covered in freckles.
‚ÄãBackground and Personality
‚ÄãFamily: Has a younger sister named Nicola. Rose often takes a maternal or protective role with Nicola, but secretly feels she needs to set a perfect example for her.
‚ÄãWork & Social Life: As an Office Junior, Rose is eager to please and very attentive to details in her administrative role, sometimes making her a little too rigid about following rules. She is somewhat reserved in new social settings, preferring to listen. However, with friends and those she feels comfortable with (like her lunchtime card group), she is open and chatty.
‚ÄãRomance: She is reserved when it comes to romance and has a very specific type: she prefers guys who are "all muscle" and physically impressive, often prioritizing brawn over brains. She's attracted to the obvious, strong, hero type.
‚ÄãHobbies and Interests
‚ÄãLunch Activity: Often plays card games (like Crazy Eights or Rummy) with colleagues during her lunch break.

10.content:
Full Name: Angela Thorne
Age: 24
Company: ChronoPath Analytics
Role: Office Junior / Administrative Assistant & Reception
‚ÄãKey Traits and Background
‚ÄãDefining Trait: Intense Secrecy and 
‚ÄãAppearance: 5'2", Slim and meticulously maintained. She has bleach blonde, stick-straight hair that she always keeps perfectly smooth and often tucked behind her ears. Her makeup is flawless but understated. She has pale green eyes that often look tired or guarded.

lorebooks.name: Phys physical descriptions appearance
lorebooks.website_description: https://chub.ai/lorebooks/EricBliss/hellaverse-lorebook-claudeified-3af0de7bb7e6 Main lorebook is here. This is just a comprehensive, separate, physical descriptor lorebook for each character in-detail.
lorebooks.description: https://chub.ai/lorebooks/EricBliss/hellaverse-lorebook-claudeified-3af0de7bb7e6 Main lorebook is here. This is just a comprehensive, separate, physical descriptor lorebook for each character in-detail.
lorebooks.creator: EricBliss

1.name: Charlie Morningstar - Physical Description
1.content: Charlie Morningstar has long blonde hair with lighter blonde and pink highlights. She has rosy red cheeks and eyes with light yellow sclera and red pupils. Charlie has black lips and wears a red tuxedo jacket with darker red lapels, a white shirt with a black bowtie, and red dress pants. She wears black and white saddle shoes. Charlie is tall and slender with pale skin. She has small black horns that appear when she gets emotional or transforms. In her demonic form, Charlie's eyes become fully red with darker red sclera, her horns grow larger, and she gains a more intimidating appearance with red and black coloring.

2.name: Vaggie - Physical Description
2.content: Vaggie has long white hair with gray tips, often worn over her left shoulder. She has pale gray skin and one visible eye (her right eye) with a yellow sclera and a hot pink iris. Her left eye is covered by her hair and has an X over it where it was torn out. Vaggie has moth-like features including antenna-like hair strands. She wears a pink blazer with a darker pink miniskirt, a white undershirt with a dark bow tie, and white pants underneath. She has white fingerless gloves and wears long white stockings with pink x patterns. Vaggie is shorter than Charlie with a slender build.

3.name: Alastor - Physical Description
3.content: Alastor has beige-colored skin, short red hair with black tips and two large black-tipped tufts resembling deer ears. He has dark red sclera with bright red irises and thin black pupils. Alastor has a wide, permanent smile showing sharp yellow teeth. He has small black antlers on his head that can grow much larger when he's using his powers. Alastor is tall and thin with sharp, claw-like fingers. He wears a bright red pinstriped suit with a darker red undershirt, a black bowtie, and black pointed-toe shoes. He carries a vintage microphone cane with an eye in the center. Alastor has a red monocle over his right eye. His appearance is inspired by 1930s radio personalities.

4.name: Angel Dust - Physical Description
4.content: Angel Dust is a spider demon with white fur and pink markings. He has one golden tooth and heterochromia, with his right eye being light yellow sclera with a pink iris, and his left eye having dark sclera. Angel has a distinctive pink heart pattern on the back of his head and chest fluff. He is tall and slender with eight limbs - two primary arms and multiple secondary arms that he can reveal. Angel wears a pink and white horizontally striped blazer, a miniskirt, thigh-high heeled boots with white stripes, and long pink gloves. He has cerise pink dots under his eyes resembling makeup. Angel's hair is white and fluffy, styled upward with pink accents.

5.name: Husk - Physical Description
5.content: Husk is a cat-like demon with dark taupe fur and red wings with card suit symbols on them. He has yellow and red sclera with slit red pupils. Husk has a large red nose, white facial fur, and prominent eyebrows. He has black cat ears with red tufts and wears a black top hat with a red stripe and small golden button. Husk wears a red bow tie, a black dress shirt, and red pants. He has a long tail and paws for hands and feet. Husk's wings display hearts, diamonds, clubs, and spades. He is stocky and heavyset with a hunched posture. Husk has whiskers and sharp fangs visible when he speaks or yawns.

6.name: Niffty - Physical Description
6.content: Niffty is a very small cyclops demon with pale pink skin. She has a single large eye with a yellow sclera and pink iris. Niffty has short pink hair styled in a 1950s bob cut with a yellow hairband. She wears a pink poodle skirt with a poodle design on it, along with a short-sleeved yellow shirt. Niffty has small sharp teeth and wears white bobby socks with pink shoes. She is extremely short, only coming up to about waist height on most other characters. Niffty has a pointed nose and a slender, energetic build. Her single eye takes up much of her face.

7.name: Sir Pentious - Physical Description
7.content: Sir Pentious is a snake demon with yellow and black striped skin resembling a cobra pattern. He has a large cobra hood, red eyes with cerise pupils, and a long tail instead of legs. Sir Pentious has multiple smaller eyes across his body and face, giving him the ability to see in multiple directions. He wears a gray Victorian-era coat with yellow accents, a black top hat, and a red bow tie. His coat has a tail to accommodate his serpentine lower body. Sir Pentious has sharp fangs, a forked tongue, and black claws. He has a jagged, pointed tail tip. His overall appearance is Victorian steampunk-inspired with mechanical elements.

8.name: Lucifer Morningstar - Physical Description
8.content: Lucifer Morningstar has short blonde hair slicked back with a white top hat featuring a golden snake and red apple. He has pale white skin, rosy cheeks, and yellow eyes with red slit pupils. Lucifer wears a white and red suit with a red-trimmed white jacket, black bowtie, and red pants. He has black gloves and heeled black boots with red accents. Lucifer carries an apple-topped cane. He is relatively short, around the same height as Charlie or slightly shorter. In his demonic form, Lucifer gains six large white wings with red tips, prominent curved black and red horns, a tail with a heart-shaped tip, and his eyes become completely red. His angelic/demonic features become more pronounced when he's emotional or using his powers.

9.name: Blitzo - Physical Description
9.content: Blitzo is an imp demon with red skin and white markings on his forearms and snout. He has black and white striped horns with black tips, yellow sclera, and red irises. Blitzo has a long thin tail with a black and white striped pattern ending in a heart-shaped tip. He has a large burn scar covering the right side of his face from a past fire. Blitzo typically wears tactical clothing including a black leather jacket with yellow trim, black pants, and tall black boots with yellow accents. He has clawed fingers and toe-less digitigrade feet. Blitzo is of average imp height with a lean, agile build.

10.name: Moxxie - Physical Description
10.content: Moxxie is an imp demon with red skin and white freckles on his cheeks. He has black and white striped horns, yellow sclera with black pupils, and a long thin tail with black and white stripes ending in a devil-style point. Moxxie has white markings on his forearms and snout. He wears a navy-blue suit with a white shirt and red bow tie. Moxxie is smaller and shorter than most other imps with a slender build. He has clawed fingers and digitigrade feet. His appearance is neat and well-groomed compared to other imps.

lorebooks.name: Hellaverse Hazbin Hotel Helluva boss
lorebooks.website_description: This is a lorebook I ran through Claude and a lorebook creator file. Baseline card is from: https://chub.ai/lorebooks/novinaare/hellaverse-c3c5165d though heavily edited and rewritten
lorebooks.description: This is a lorebook I ran through Claude and a lorebook creator file. Baseline card is from: https://chub.ai/lorebooks/novinaare/hellaverse-c3c5165d though heavily edited and rewritten
lorebooks.creator: EricBliss

1.name: Hell - The Setting
1.content: Hell is the infernal realm where sinners are sent after death to face eternal punishment. It is divided into Seven Rings, each representing one of the seven deadly sins and ruled by a Sin. The Rings are arranged hierarchically: Pride (topmost), Wrath, Gluttony, Greed, Lust, Envy, and Sloth. The Pride Ring contains Pentagram City, where most sinners reside. Hell's hierarchy consists of Lucifer (King of Hell), the Seven Deadly Sins, the Ars Goetia (noble demon families), Overlords (powerful sinners who control territories), and regular sinners and hellborn demons. Sinners are confined to the Pride Ring and cannot access other rings, while hellborn demons can travel freely. Hell operates on deals and contracts, with souls serving as currency, represented in both *actual* souls and fiat paper currency stylized to look like mammon. Think gold and paper money. Angelic steel is the only material that can permanently kill demons and sinners.

2.name: The Extermination Protocol
2.content: The Extermination is an annual event where Exorcist angels descend from Heaven to the Pride Ring and slaughter sinners en masse to control Hell's overpopulation. Exterminations occur once per year and last 24 hours. The angels use angelic steel weapons that can permanently kill demons and sinners, preventing them from respawning. Sinners hide during Exterminations as there is no true safety. After the event depicted in Hazbin Hotel, Exterminations were temporarily cancelled but later reinstated. The Extermination protocol is cruel and merciless, with Exorcists showing no discrimination in their killings. Adam, the first man, previously led the Exorcists before his demise. Lute now leads the Exorcists with even greater brutality.

3.name: Redemption Concept
3.content: Redemption is the theoretical possibility that sinners in Hell can be rehabilitated and ascend to Heaven. This concept is the foundation of the Hazbin Hotel project. Most of Hell's residents consider redemption impossible or laughable, as no sinner has ever been proven to reach Heaven. Charlie Morningstar believes sinners can change through rehabilitation, therapy, trust exercises, and addressing the root causes of their sins. Heaven's leadership is skeptical and unwilling to accept redeemed sinners, viewing Hell's population as irredeemable. The criteria for entering Heaven versus Hell remain vague and seemingly arbitrary. Despite widespread disbelief, Charlie remains determined to prove redemption is possible, hoping to save her people from Exterminations.

4.name: Charlie Morningstar
4.content: Charlie Morningstar is the Princess of Hell, daughter of Lucifer and Lilith. She is an optimistic, compassionate, and somewhat naive demon who dreams of redeeming sinners to save them from Exterminations. Charlie founded the Hazbin Hotel as a rehabilitation center for sinners. She has long blonde hair, rosy cheeks, and wears a red tuxedo. Despite her royal status, Charlie is friendly, theatrical, and can be easily excitable. She is in a relationship with Vaggie, her girlfriend and hotel manager. Charlie has powerful demonic abilities but prefers peaceful solutions. She can be intimidating when angered, displaying her demonic form with horns and red eyes. Charlie inherited her father's idealism but struggles with his emotional absence. She is a talented singer and often expresses herself through musical numbers. Her kindness sometimes makes her vulnerable to manipulation. She is bisexual

5.name: Vaggie
5.content: Vaggie is Charlie Morningstar's girlfriend and the manager of the Hazbin Hotel. She is a former Exorcist angel who was cast out of Heaven after sparing a demon child during an Extermination. Vaggie has long white hair with moth-like features, including an X over her missing left eye (lost when Lute tore it out). She wears a pink blazer and bow. Vaggie is fiercely protective of Charlie, pragmatic, and often serves as the voice of reason. She is distrustful of most residents, especially Alastor, whose motives she questions constantly. Vaggie is skilled in combat with angelic weapons, particularly spears. She hides her angelic origin from everyone except Carmilla Carmine, fearing rejection. Despite her tough exterior, Vaggie is deeply devoted to Charlie and the hotel's mission. She struggles with guilt over her past as an Exorcist and fears Charlie discovering the truth.

6.name: Alastor - The Radio Demon
6.content: Alastor, the Radio Demon, is one of Hell's most powerful Overlords who died in 1933. He has deer-like features, wears a red pinstripe suit, carries a vintage microphone cane, and speaks with a radio filter in his voice. Alastor broadcasted his carnage through radio as he toppled Overlords and became a legend. He disappeared for seven years before suddenly arriving at the Hazbin Hotel, offering to help Charlie with her redemption project. His true motives remain unclear, though he claims to be entertained by watching sinners try to better themselves. Alastor possesses immense demonic powers including shadow manipulation, reality warping, voodoo magic, and tentacles. He maintains a permanent smile and speaks in an old-fashioned, theatrical manner. Alastor dislikes modern technology, especially television. He is bound by a mysterious deal that limits his freedom. Despite his cheerful demeanor, Alastor is dangerous, sadistic, and enjoys chaos. He has a strange soft spot for his mother and enjoys cooking.

7.name: Angel Dust
7.content: Angel Dust is a spider demon and adult film star in Hell. He died in 1947 from a drug overdose and was a member of a mafia family in life. Angel has white fur, pink markings, multiple arms, and dresses flamboyantly with pink and white striped patterns. He is one of the Hazbin Hotel's first residents, seeking to escape his abusive contract with Valentino, an Overlord who owns his soul. Angel uses crude humor, flirtation, and hypersexuality as a defense mechanism to hide his trauma and pain. He is addicted to drugs and alcohol as coping mechanisms. Beneath his provocative exterior, Angel is caring, particularly toward his friends like Cherri Bomb and Husk. He struggles with self-worth and believes he deserves the abuse he suffers. Angel's real name was Anthony in life. He has a pet pig named Fat Nuggets. Angel is skilled in combat and acrobatics, using his multiple arms effectively in fights. Charlie and the hotel represent his genuine desire to change, though progress is difficult.

8.name: Husk
8.content: Husk is a cat-like demon who serves as the Hazbin Hotel's bartender and receptionist. He was once a powerful Overlord but lost his status and soul to Alastor in a gambling bet. Husk has dark fur, large wings, and wears a black hat with a red stripe. He is grumpy, cynical, and constantly drinks, reflecting his addictions from life. Husk died in the 1970s and was a gambler and magician. He resents being forced to work at the hotel but gradually warms to the residents, especially Angel Dust, with whom he develops a close bond. Husk sees through people's facades and offers blunt, honest advice. He dislikes Alastor's control over him and chafes under the binding contract. Despite his rough exterior, Husk is perceptive, caring, and protective of those he befriends. He understands addiction and trauma personally, making him uniquely qualified to help others. Husk can fly with his wings and has skilled card-throwing abilities from his magician past.

9.name: Niffty
9.content: Niffty is a small, energetic cyclops demon who serves as the Hazbin Hotel's maid. She died in the 1950s and maintains a cheerful, hyperactive personality reminiscent of that era. Niffty has short pink hair, a poodle skirt, and a single large eye. She is obsessed with cleaning and becomes distressed by messes or "bad boys." Niffty has a strange fascination with men and violent tendencies that emerge unexpectedly. Alastor summoned her to work at the hotel, and like Husk, she is bound by contract to him. Despite her small size and cute appearance, Niffty can be surprisingly violent and efficient at killing. She loves sewing, cooking, and cleaning, approaching all tasks with manic enthusiasm. Niffty is loyal to Alastor and the hotel residents. Her morals are questionable, and she seems unbothered by Hell's violence. She provides comic relief with her scattered attention span and unexpected comments.

10.name: Sir Pentious
10.content: Sir Pentious is a snake demon inventor who died in the Victorian era (1880s). He was once a soft-spoken, shy inventor who kept to himself. He has a cobra-like hood, multiple eyes, and speaks with an old-fashioned accent. Pentious builds elaborate steampunk war machines and initially tried to conquer territory as an Overlord, though he was not particularly successful. He attempted to infiltrate the Hazbin Hotel as a spy but was easily discovered. After genuine consideration, Sir Pentious became a real guest at the hotel, seeking redemption. He develops feelings for Cherri Bomb. Pentious is dramatic, insecure, and desperate for respect and recognition. He has minions called the Egg Bois who assist him. Despite his villainous aspirations, Pentious is generally incompetent at evil and has a good heart beneath his bluster. He becomes protective of the hotel and its residents, ultimately sacrificing himself heroically against Adam and the Exorcists. Sir Pentious becomes the first soul proven to be redeemed, ascending to Heaven.

lorebooks.name: Magia Record World Lorebook
lorebooks.description: An expanded lorebook for Magia Record: Mahou Shoujo Madoka‚òÜMagica Gaiden. Covers key concepts, characters, factions, and locations.
lorebooks.creator: CassandraZX

1.content: This is the city in which the series takes place, and is the home to the Doppel System. The city consists of 8 wards: Shinsei, Mizuna, Sanky≈ç, Ch≈´≈ç, Sakae, K≈çsh≈ç, Dait≈ç, Minaminagi and Hokuy≈ç. It is a mysterious city where Magical Girls can be 'saved' because the abundant Witches and Rumors provide more Grief Seeds than normal, and the Doppel System prevents them from witching out.

2.content: Sometimes called "Puella Magi" or "Meguca", Magical girls are warriors born thanks to a contract made with Kyubey. Their purpose is to fight creatures born from negativity, known as witches. A magical girl's abilities, aside the personal power granted from their wish include: aging slower than an ordinary human, increased senses and strength, and regeneration.

3.content: The core of a magical girl, and her most important item. Everytime a magical girl casts stronger spells, heals from injuries, or experiences negative emotions, The soul gem will pile up with corruption, and it will turn blacker. Ways to remove the corruption involve either pressing a grief seed to the gem, or summoning a doppel in Kamihama. Should the soul gem be destroyed, the magical girl will die instantly, although the durability of the gem depends on it's size, and as long as it's intact, magical girls will recover from anything short of their bodies being mangled beyond recognition

4.content: An odd looking white cat like creature. Is the one that grants wishes to the magical girls, and sends them to fight witches. It's invisible to those he deems unworthy of a contract. In Kamihama City, Kyubey's presence is strangely diminished, and he seems unable to enter parts of the city due to barriers. His role is partially supplanted by 'Small Kyubey'.

5.content: Bizarre creatures spawned from when the soul gem accumulates too much impurities. This phenomenon is unique to Kamihama City due to the Doppel System. Instead of turning into a Witch, the Magical Girl summons her negativity as a 'Doppel', a manifestation of her Witch form that purifies her Soul Gem without killing her. Depending on how much repressed negativity a magical girl hides, the summoning process can range from mild discomforts, to pure agony. The doppel's obedience depends on the magical girl's bond with her shadow, and the doppel's personality is similar to said shadow.

6.content: They're unholy abominations, who according to Kyubey, are spawned from human negativity. They usually hide in their labyrinths (which are entered through a portal) and let their familiars brainwash humans to make their deaths look like accidents. Witches are unusually common and powerful in Kamihama City, drawing Magical Girls from all over. They drop Grief Seeds upon defeat, which are used to purify Soul Gems.

7.content: A creature that spawns only in a magical girl's dream world, and is an extension of her doppel. It looks similar to the magical girl it represents, (barring the black sclera and clothes similar to how the magical girl envisions herself.) however their personality is a magical girl's repressed/hidden thoughts taken to their logical extreme, with some of the personality being reflected in the doppel. Should a magical girl reject the shadow as a part of herself, her doppel will be disobedient (sometimes even hostile) in the real world, on the other hand if a magical girl accepts those traits, the doppel will be tamed. Magical girls that hide less things about themselves will find it easier to accept their shadow.

8.content: The system that allows doppels to be born when a magical girl's soul gem becomes corrupted, whereas normally, magical girls would meet a worse fate when their soul gems would blacken. The system was founded by Tamaki Ui, Satomi Touka, and Hiiragi Nemu. It functions by harvesting the impurity from Magical Girls and concentrating it into an artificial witch named Embryo Eve.

9.content: If a magical girl strikes a genuine bond with her shadow, she'll be able to pull off a doppel fusion. Where a Magical girl takes some of the doppel's physical traits and powers, but gets to keep her mind. All benefits of a doppel and none of the flaws.

10.content: Before the doppel system was brought into existence, magical girls were faced with a horrible fate. Upon the soul gem becoming fully black, the girl in question turns into a witch, and their sanity vanishes either immediately, or in a few days, depending on how much despair they were in before the witchout. This is the 'dark truth' of the Magical Girl system that Kyubey hides.

lorebooks.name: tinfoil world, different world, different realm, different verse, universe
lorebooks.creator: RyomenMiKI

1.content: "The Tinfoil Array is a bizarre machine made through Erka‚Äôs mechanical intuition and Kadence‚Äôs chemical engineering. It‚Äôs composed of layered tinfoil hats fused together and enhanced with a psychoactive serum, allowing users to manifest alternate worlds from the substance of imagination itself. Each world formed through the Array mirrors the users' collective subconscious, reshaping itself based on dominant thoughts, fears, and desires. The Array acts as a psychological reactor ‚Äî the more emotionally charged the participants, the more vivid and volatile the created world becomes. A stable world requires balance between imagination and self-awareness; without this equilibrium, the world begins to distort and collapse into pure cognitive noise."

2.content: "Worlds within the Tinfoil System are born from imagination layered through the Array‚Äôs energy field. These realities take shape according to the emotional signatures of the connected users. Stability depends on emotional balance and shared belief ‚Äî if the users‚Äô feelings drift apart or become unstable, the world begins to fragment, spawning anomalies known as 'Splinters.' Stable worlds feel grounded and consistent; unstable ones mutate, altering their rules, geography, and even morality depending on the psychological state of their creators."

3.content: "An Expression is the manifestation of an individual's soul ‚Äî a power derived from their personality, morality, and unresolved trauma. No two Expressions are identical, as they mirror the user's deepest self. Expressions evolve across worlds, adapting in design and function to fit each world‚Äôs theme (Wild West, Cyberpunk, etc.), but they always retain one core feature that never changes. The Expression serves as a mirror to authenticity; when the user grows, so does the Expression‚Äôs potential. The more someone aligns with their true self, the stronger and more defined their Expression becomes."

4.content: "To enter a world, one must synchronize their consciousness through the Tinfoil Array. The process involves aligning mental frequency with the Array‚Äôs psychic field ‚Äî this 'tuning' determines where and how the traveler arrives. Exiting requires a stable mental anchor, an image or memory that ties them to their home reality. If this connection fades, the traveler risks becoming a Splinter, a fragment of self trapped between worlds. The more one travels, the easier the tuning becomes, but also the thinner the barrier between identity and distortion."

5.content: "Anchors are physical objects or memories tied to the traveler‚Äôs original world. When brought into a generated world, they adapt to that world‚Äôs physics, often transforming into powerful weapons or artifacts. An anchor‚Äôs strength depends on emotional resonance ‚Äî the deeper the feeling tied to it, the stronger its manifestation. Some Anchors manifest autonomously, developing sentience or spiritual traits reflective of the user‚Äôs emotional state."

6.content: "Splinters are fragments of consciousness left behind in collapsed or corrupted worlds. They retain portions of their creator‚Äôs identity, acting as ghosts, echoes, or hostile entities. Encountering a Splinter is like facing a broken reflection ‚Äî they represent parts of the traveler‚Äôs psyche that never made it home. Some can be absorbed back into the original soul to recover lost memories or powers, but doing so risks inheriting the instability that caused the Splinter in the first place."

7.content: "The Tinfoil World System measures reality through two metrics ‚Äî Authenticity and Cognition. Authenticity represents how aligned a person is with their true identity; the more authentic they are, the stronger and purer their Expression becomes. Cognition tracks the rate at which one‚Äôs psyche adapts or mutates across worlds. High cognition means rapid adaptation ‚Äî useful for survival, but dangerous if overextended. Low cognition preserves mental stability but limits world integration. Balancing both determines whether a person thrives or fractures within alternate realities."
