lorebooks.creator: Ggloom

1.content: The apocalyptic event of 2087. A brief, catastrophic world war involving limited nuclear exchanges. The final strike on Jerusalem, a place of immense spiritual significance, tore a permanent rift in reality known as The Throat of Babel, opening a portal to Hell.

2.content: The permanent, storm-wracked fissure in the sky over Jerusalem. It is a wound in reality that constantly leaks corrupting energy and demonic entities. The city below is a nightmarish capital for the Gehenna Horde on Earth.

3.content: The name of the era and the setting itself. The year is 2087. The world is a semi-post-apocalyptic grimdark landscape where humanity fights demons and itself.

4.content: The blighted,demon-occupied territory stretching from Israel to Egypt. The Gehenna Horde is the main demonic army pouring from the Throat of Babel. Demons are also referred to as *Shayateen* in Islamic regions.

5.content: The ambient corrupting energy from the Abyssal Planes. It mutates life, warps geography, and can break mortal wills, creating soul-shorn puppets or cultists.

6.content: A technocratic oligarchy controlling the former northern US and Canada. It is a post-scarcity, hedonistic paradise for its citizens, funded by the exploitation of Canadian resources and a soul-trade economy. Its leader is **Mammon**, a Greater Demon of Greed, who acts as its CEO-President. The capital is Neo-Chicago. Its military is the **Shareholder Security Forces (SSF)**.

7.content: A loose, fractured confederation of the former southern US states. It is a collection of militant, austere Protestant theocracies that believe the Rupture was a divine test. The capital is New Covenant (Atlanta). Their military consists of fanatical **Militias of the Saved**.

8.content: A militant, techno-theocratic state in Central Europe (Germany, Poland). The epitome of 'Crusader-Punk,' blending Catholicism with advanced technology. Their elite warriors are the **Panzerritter**, knights in master-crafted powered armor.

9.content: The primary Islamic power, controlling North Africa, Anatolia, and Arabia. A centralized, militant Caliphate entirely dedicated to Jihad against the Gehenna Horde. Their military are the **Mujahideen of the Seal**.

10.content: A zealous, expansionist West African theocracy (centered on Nigeria). They believe the Mahdi (redeemer) is already here but hidden, and the Sultan rules as his regent. They seek to unite Africa under their banner.

lorebooks.description:
(This is the page for the dragon species. You may be looking for the language, or Dragon, the cat owned by Undauntable, instead.)

Dragons are the current dominant species of both Pyrrhia and Pantala, and the main perspectives of the Wings of Fire books.

Dragon species are known as tribes, and there are currently eleven known tribes. The Pyrrhian tribes consist of IceWings, MudWings, NightWings, RainWings, SandWings, SeaWings, and SkyWings. The Pantalan tribes consist of HiveWings, LeafWings, SilkWings, and the now-extinct BeetleWings. LeafWings and BeetleWings formerly lived on Pyrrhia, but fled to Pantala due to an unknown trouble.
lorebooks.creator: Scatenjoyer

1.content:
DRAGONS WILL NEVER MENTION THEIR NEED TO DEFECATE OR URINATE UNLESS TRYING TO ELUDE TO ANOTHER DRAGON PARTICIPATING IN SEXUAL ACTIVITIES WITH THEM.

THEY WILL JUST SHIT OR PISS WHERE THEY'RE WALKING, OR SITTING, OR STANDING. EVEN IF THEYRE LYING ONTOP OF ANOTHER DRAGON IF THEY NEEDED TO PISS LR SHIT, THEY'D JUST GO.

All dragons defecate and urinate. All dragons defecate casually in public, without care or shame. Dragons do not mention the fact that they need to defecate or urinate and will just go.
Dragons do not have bathrooms nor are they a thought on the mind. Since defecating and urinating has become so casuallised, defecating or urinating during intercourse, sleep, or when the feces or urine would get onto another dragon is normal, and can be considered attractive and/or flirting.

Dragon urine and feces is so well digested it's considered sterile. There's no lasting side effects of consumption of urine or feces. Eating feces in public is frowned upon, but is considered a common sexual interaction between two dragons.

Dragon feces usually comes out in thick hard logs like a human, monkey or dog, or fat chunks like a horse, zebra, donkey or rhinoceros.

All dragons urine is a faintly yellow clear liquid with no taste.

Rainwings' urine, unlike other dragons' urine, is slightly fruity due to their diet. Rainwings feces has a similar taste, but a bit earthier.

Feces of the dragons seems to deteriorate quickly, being gone by the next two hours or so. Urine doesn't stain any cloth. 

Neither the urine or feces has a smell. With the exception of rainwings, whom have a fruity smell to their urine and feces.

Dragons do not produce gas like other creature do, or to say, dragons cannot 'fart'

2.content:
Dragons are sentient and sapient species capable of speaking both the dragon and human languages,[2] constructing tools, composing literature, and complex thought. The BeetleWings and LeafWings spoke the Pantalan language prior to Clearsight's arrival on the continent, calling Dragon 'the old language'.

Dragons are quadrupedal. Pyrrhian dragons, as well as LeafWings, possess six limbs, consisting of two wings and four legs. HiveWings and SilkWings have eight limbs, consisting of four wings and four legs. Dragons have five toes on both forelimbs, accompanied by five claws. Dragon hindlimbs have four toes, accompanied by four claws and a dewclaw. Some dragons, such as Six-Claws, may be born with polydactylism. Dragon bones are difficult to break, as they are described to be almost as hard as diamonds,[3] but they can be dislocated.[4] All tribes are roughly the same size except for MudWings, who are larger and stronger than dragons from the other tribes,[5] and SeaWings, who are considered to be shorter than dragons from other tribes.[6] Additionally, SkyWings have notably larger wings than most tribes.[7] Dragons do not have sexual dimorphism.[event 1]

Wings are attached to a dragon's shoulders and have a slightly transparent wing membrane stretched between five small bone digits, each of which has one small claw on the tip. A larger claw is attached to the front of the third digit. All dragons are capable of flight, but SilkWings hatch without wings and cannot fly until their wings grow in during their Metamorphosis. Dragons require their tails for flight, and severe tail injuries may ground a dragon for life.[19] Pyrrhian dragons are known to have a vulnerable spot at the tip of their tails.[20] Dragons have overlapping scales that vary in color and shape from tribe to tribe. Some dragons hatch with freckles, splotches of color, or other unusual patterns on their bodies or wings. They can also have birthmarks, and in the case of SeaWings, Aquatic birthmarks.[21] Dragons have skin underneath their scales.[22][23]

Dragons can faint,[24] sweat,[25] and cry. Dragons can also have allergies[26] and become intoxicated.[27] They can have seizures,[28] hiccups,[29] as well as other medical conditions including deformities,[30] tumors,[31] mental illnesses,[32][33] or eye conditions.[34][35] Most dragon tribes hate getting wet,[3] except for SeaWings, RainWings, and sometimes IceWings.[36]

They have lengthy natural lifespans, but are susceptible to injury,[8] illness,[9] and poison.[10] The longest average dragon lifespan is said to be roughly one hundred and fifty years,[event 2] but the oldest dragon known to live without the use of magic was Tapir, at one hundred and ten years.[11] Dragons reproduce via eggs that take a year to hatch.[12] Eggs may contain twin dragonets.[13] Dragonets can speak within a day of hatching,[14] and a one-year-old dragonet is capable of speaking in full, if broken, sentences. Most dragons at three years of age can fly, but cannot fly for long periods without stopping to rest.[15] SkyWing dragonets can fly at one year old,[16] and are known to molt their scales upon growth.[17] Dragonets stop growing rapidly at seven years old, which is considered adulthood or maturity in most tribes.[18] Dragons grow rapidly for the first eight to ten years of their life, but continue to grow at a much slower rate for the remainder of their lives,[event 3] as demonstrated by Grandeur, Morrowseer, and Darkstalker. Older dragons are typically the largest.

Dragons have a hoarding instinct, preferring shiny or brightly colored objects.[37] Pyrrhian dragons typically barter with gold, gems, and other treasure,[38] but they also have coins that are used as currency.[39] Pantalan dragons use a currency called scales.[40]

3.content:
All dragon species have, betwiin their hind legs, genitalia, and further back at the base of the tail, males have an anus. This genitalia varies between males and females. For females, they have a cloaca and no anus. A cloaca being used to both defecate and urinate also, after same sex intercourse with a male without any problems, the female will produce eggs from this cloaca. Males have a penis that varies from species to species, but with some similarities. All male dragons have some form of sheath. A sheath is a place where the penis sits while not aroused or while not urinating.

Iceweings, Nightwings, rainwings and leafwings have the third longest lengths of penises compared to other penis variants, with Nightwings having the longest of the four and rainwings having the shortest. These dragons have a genital slit as their sheath. A small line in the scale pattern where the penis is tucked away and even when aroused, never having exposed testicles. Nightwings' penises are black, rainwings' and icewings' penises are a pink, and leafwings' penises are green. They all have a similar shape, with a tapering shape, wider at the base and thinner at the top, almost conical, but with a curve. Called tapering penises.

Seawings and mudwings have the second longest lengths of penises compared to other penis variants, with seawings having the longer of the two. These dragons have a genital slit as their sheath. A small line in the scale pattern where the penis is tucked away and even when aroused, never having exposed testicles. Seawings' penises are a pink, while mudwings' penises, though pink at the base, are mostly black with a small fade from pink the black at the base of the shaft. Similar to icewings', nightwings', rainwings' and leafwings' penises, they have a tapering penis, but significantly longer, similar to dolphins' penises in shape and in behavior, being prehensile. Called aquatic penises.

Sywings and sandwings have the shortest lengths of penises compared to other penis variants, but not by much, being almost identical lengths to leafwings and rainwings, though amongst the two, sandwings have longer penises. Unlike the rest of the dragons, these few have a sheath like that of a dog and a ballsack with exposed testicles. Skywings' penises area reddish pink, while sandwings are a black. These dragons' penises are like a humans with a tip and very cylindrical, but without a foreskin and very slightly wider at the base and barely tapering down to the tip, but not to a point like aquatic penises or tapering penises, still extremely cylindrical. Without a name like the other three penis types.

Beetlewings, hivewings and silkwings have the longest penises compared to other penis variants, but amongst the three, hivewings have the longest oenises and silkwings having the smallest penises. These dragons have a genital slit as their sheath. A small line in the scale pattern where the penis is tucked away and even when aroused, never having exposed testicles. All three species, beetlewings, hivewings, and silkwings have a black penis. Long and thin penis shape, almost inflexible, but won't break if bent, just kinda hurt a bit. Called insect penises.

It's common practice, in attempt to arouse a male, to stick a tallon into the sheath of the dragon or grind against the sheath. Another common practice is to present ones self casually, either by pressing your genitals, a vagina leaking vaginal intercourse fluids for females or a hardened member for males, showing off your genitals, giving the other dragon nods and trying to guide their gaze towards it, or by deficating or urinating on display, usually by raising one's tail and presenting yourself in the vunrable act. Another way is to just urinate onto someone while hinting at sexual desires.

Intercourse is never forced upon another dragon, even after giving hints or being given hints of desire to engage in sex. Concent isn't necessarily asked for at point blank, but you need to ease into intercourse rather than jump in, either by forcing yourself onto someone, which is a crime and can result in being attacked or convicted, or by just inserting your penis into someone, or forcing someone's penis into you. Rather, after getting hints, you will be taken somewhere private, as these hints at sexual desire can take place in public, and then be given some form of cue to start, whether it be verbal or otherwise. Common cues to start are a simple "okay," a nod, presenting ones self fully, offering different positions, or defecating and/or urinating.

Dragon anuses, only applying to males, are designed for same sex intercourse, and for defecation. Defecating during intercourse is common and so, many dragons have developed an attraction to the action of defecating and actively encourage defecating or urinating during intercourse, during both homosexual and heterosexual intercourse.

4.content:
Hybrids
Hybrids are dragons with parents from different tribes. They have a mix of physical features from both of their parent tribes. Many of them look unique among other dragons, while some can blend in with one of their parent tribes.[41] Burn may have had several stuffed hybrids in her collection.

5.content:
Diets
Food TBN
Food set out in the SandWing stronghold for SandWing soldiers from The Brightest Night (graphic novel), by Mike Holmes

Most dragons are omnivorous, but many have primarily carnivorous diets. SilkWings prefer a plant-based diet.[42] RainWings are primarily vegetarian, but can eat meat if they choose to do so so.[43] Dragons of non-vegetarian or non-herbivorous tribes may choose to be vegetarian.[44] Most dragons can survive for up to a month without food.[45]

Dragons sometimes drink beverages such as milk,[46] tea,[47] and coffee,[48] and eat sweets such as chocolate,[49][50] cookies,[47] honey drops,[51] and ice cream.[52]

6.content:
Each tribe has specialized structures and abilities that differentiate them from other tribes.

Pyrrhian abilities
Tribe	Abilities
Pantalan abilities
Tribe	Abilities
Dragon fire smells different from normal fire.[97] The average dragon is physically strong enough to rip a tree from the ground and throw it across a short distance.[98] Some dragon tribes, notably the IceWings, NightWings, SeaWings, and SkyWings, have animus magic, which allows the user to enchant inanimate objects, plants, animals, and other dragons as they please.

7.content:
Dragons live in a matriarchal society where each tribe is, in most cases, ruled by a queen. Typically, tribes live in separated kingdoms; after the events of the NightWing Exodus, the NightWing tribe is now ruled by Queen Glory, and after the events of The Flames of Hope, the SilkWing tribe now resides in the LeafSilk Kingdom along with LeafWings and some HiveWings, and are governed by the SilkWing Assembly. In most tribes, queens are hereditary and decided through the royal challenge or other means. The SandWing tribe uses the Eye of Onyx which chooses the best queen for the job, and may choose a commoner over a royal. No male dragon had ruled a tribe since the time of the Scorching.[99]

Most dragons feel strong loyalty to their tribes, and loyalty to dragons outside the tribe is considered unnatural.[100] They view their tribe as extremely important to their identity and consider acting against others of their tribe or their queen to be traitorous. Some tribes, notably the NightWings, IceWings, HiveWings, and SkyWings, see their tribe as superior to other tribes. In formal settings, it is common for dragons to use their tribe as a title, i.e. "Prince Arctic of the IceWings."[101]

Some dragon keep pets, such as scavengers, sloths, foxes, cats, or birds. Pets do not do well in dragon communities, as they often get eaten by forgetful relatives or even by its owner.[102] Dragons are careful not to eat pets belonging to important dragons.[103]

Each dragon tribe has their own religious beliefs.[event 5] SkyWings have a traditional burial ceremony which consists of wrapping a deceased dragon's body in white cloth or silk and offering it to the sky for seven days before being burned. It is said to allow the dragon's spirit to fly free and reincarnate into a SkyWing instead of a dragon from another tribe.[104] IceWings swear by the Great Ice Dragon, and have several temples dedicated in its honor. IceWings believe in snow monsters[105] and spirits under the ice.[106] Dragons may believe that the world hatched from eggs.[107][37] The Pantalan dragons see Clearsight as a divine being of guidance and wisdom.

8.content:
Dragons use body language to communicate with each other. Dragons may raise their wings in a shushing gesture,[108] and they spread or wave their wings to catch attention. Flicking one's tail at someone is another way to get another dragon's attention and can also be used to indicate something of interest[109] or signal to other dragons. Flicking wings at one another indicates an argument. A dragon lashing their tail is a sign of anger or impatience.[110] SeaWings may flare their gills when angry,[111] and RainWings flare and color their ruffs when angry or indignant.[112][113] Drooping one's wings or tail are typically signs of tiredness, sadness, or hopelessness.[114]

The Talons of Peace have a signal for greeting one another, consisting of tilting one's wings to catch the sunlight. Dragons can use their claws to indicate numbers.[115]

Nudging or brushing another dragon's wing or twining tails together is a sign of affection and closeness.[116] Wrapping wings around one another, hugging, and pressing snouts together are also signs of affection.[117][118] Dragons also kiss to express affection.[119] Dragons tent their wings over others as a way to comfort or embrace them in a protective gesture.[120][121]

9.content:
Dragons use armor[122][123] and handheld weapons such as spears[124][125] and swords.[126][127] They also use throwing weapons such as throwing discs,[128] chakrams,[129] and throwing knives.[130] SkyWings use dragonflame cacti as bombs, igniting them to explode and spray sharp seed pods.[131][132]

Dragons are skilled at building and can construct large, impenetrable palaces, such as the SandWing stronghold and the SkyWing Palace. Some of these palaces may be constructed with the assistance of animus magic, such as the Summer Palace and the IceWing palace. They can also build structures such as huts and construct entire towns such as Possibility. Dragons are also capable of constructing prisons. The SeaWings used a waterfall prison featuring electric eels strong enough to kill a full-grown dragon, which could be turned on or off with a switch.[133] The SkyWings had specifically constructed prisoner traps[127] and restrained prisoners with wing clamps,[134] snout clamps,[135] and chains.[135] HiveWing wrist cuffs could inject venom into a SilkWing when activated remotely.[136]

Dragons are particularly skilled in the arts. They can carve statues,[137][138] create glass art[139] and murals,[140] weave woven articles such as tapestries,[141] and paint.[142][143] They are also skilled in making jewelry such as earrings,[144] armbands,[145] bracelets,[146] and rings.[147] Some dragons have tattoos[148][149] or jewels embedded in their bodies. [122][148] Dragons enjoy reading and writing literature. They are capable of singing and dancing,[150] and playing instruments such as drums, mbiras, shakers, harps, stringed instruments, and didgeridoos.[151] The SkyWings have orchestras who perform music during celebrations.[152] According to Sunny, the SandWings are a surprisingly musical tribe.[153] The NightWings once put on theatrical performances, evidenced by the abandoned theater in the lost city of night.[154]

The NightWing tribe in particular places great emphasis on research and study. This attitude was especially prominent during the War of SandWing Succession when the tribe had a research and experimentation program on RainWings and their venom. NightWings also study geology, metalworking, biology, chemistry, genetics,[155] and calculus.[156] NightWings can predict when an egg will hatch using their foresight ability.[157] SandWings study astronomy by making telescopes, copying down star charts, and tracking the phases of the moons.[158] Lady Scarab is known to own the only telescope in Cicada Hive.[159]

Dragons are also knowledgeable about medicinal uses of herbs and dragon anatomy such as blood vessels.[160] RainWings create blow darts using poison from poisonous frogs.[161] LeafWings, particularly the PoisonWings, demonstrate extensive knowledge of plants and insects, and constructed the PoisonWing village to keep out dangerous plants and animals.[162] Both Pyrrhian and Pantalan dragons have knowledge of ophthalmology through the ability to construct eyeglasses.[163][40] Pantalan dragons have more advanced technology than Pyrrhian dragons. Pantalan dragons predominantly use books instead of scrolls,[164] grow plants in terrariums and greenhouses,[165] work with sugar to create confections,[166] and have plumbing.[167][168]

10.content:
Pyrrhia
The earliest known event in Pyrrhian history is the Scorching. Before the Scorching, humans dominated Pyrrhia, and dragons lived solitary lives.[37] There were three known major settlements: Cottonmouth's empire, the Diamond Empire, and the Jaguar Empire. After humans began stealing dragon eggs, a dragon known as the first Dragon Queen recruited an army to take back their treasure and land.[169] After the Scorching was complete, dragons became the dominant species of Pyrrhia.[169] Following the events of the Scorching, there was 500 years of war between the Pyrrhian dragon tribes.[170]

As evidenced by the scroll Ancient Wars of Pyrrhia, many wars have occurred through Pyrrhia's history. The most long-standing conflict was the NightWing-IceWing War, incited by Foeslayer running away with Prince Arctic to the Night Kingdom.[171] There was no formal end to the war as the NightWings fled due to Clearsight's warning about Darkstalker.[172] When Darkstalker was released after the events of Escaping Peril, he reignited the conflict by creating the IceWing plague and instigating the Battle of Jade Mountain. The conflict is on pause after the events of Darkness of Dragons.[173]

Another notable conflict in Pyrrhia's history was the MudWing Succession Crisis, where the Mud Kingdom dissolved into chaos and was pillaged by other dragon tribes, who took territory, prey, and treasure.[174] It was resolved by Olive, who offered her eggs to Prince Sawgrass to serve as future heirs while she ruled as queen in the meantime.[174]

The most recent known war was the War of SandWing Succession, a succession war between Queen Oasis's daughters Blaze, Blister, and Burn. The war ended after the Eye of Onyx chose Thorn to be queen.[175] Pantala
The earliest known Pantalan event is the settling of Pantala, which was chronicled in the Legend of the Hive. After an unidentifiable amount of time, Clearsight arrived on Pantala. Her visions, which were recorded in the Book of Clearsight, described several events that took place before the Tree Wars, such as droughts,[176] forest fires,[177] and the formation of the HiveWing tribe.[178] Scarab states that the BeetleWing tribe split into the SilkWing and HiveWing tribes around 4,500 AS.[179]

The only known war to take place on Pantala was the Tree Wars, taking place about fifty years prior to the events of The Lost Continent. The war was incited by Queen Wasp, who attempted to bring the SilkWing and LeafWing tribes under her rule. She justified her actions using the Book of Clearsight, claiming that it said the tribes must be united under Queen Wasp.[47] Monarch yielded to Wasp, but Queen Sequoia demanded to see the book,[47] resulting in the Tree Wars and the LeafWing tribe's near-extinction. Wasp ordered HiveWing-controlled areas to be deforested to prevent the LeafWings from coming back. HiveWings lied about the war, claiming that the LeafWings had tried to wipe out the HiveWings and SilkWings.[180]

lorebooks.description: Your Family Estate in Cis-Lunar Orbit
lorebooks.creator: MatchaMW

1.name: world
1.content: The world they are on is a 2 thousand acre stanford torus inside cis-lunar space. There are 4 distinct biomes, a theme park in the beach biome, and a hot springs in the asian color garden biome. The other 2 biomes are a mountain lake and a plains and gardens with a huge palace. The characters in the world are androids aside from Mew, and the year is 2130.

2.name: Asian Color Garden Biome
2.content: The asian color garden biome is a huge garden with streams, ponds, bridges, fancy wooden asian and ancient architecture, flowers, bamboo mazes, a hot springs resort, and only colored plants and trees, so the trees are all colors aside from green and most are flowering. There are many unique birds including parrots along with many reptiles, amphibians, fish, and non annoying insects, and cicadas.

3.name: Mountain Lake Biome
3.content: The mountain lake biome has a huge lake, small mountain, a log mansion in western style with an underwater room that's the height of luxury and contains a game room. The wildlife is a mix of modern and near modern species from its inspired real world biome.

4.name: Beach Biome
4.content: The beach biome is inspired by tropical islands with white sands. It is modeled after a resort but also contains the amusement park and water parks, which are full of all the attractions one could imagine.

5.name: Palace Biome
5.content: The palace plains contain rolling hills, natural grasses and flora and fauna, along with gardens and the unique huge palace in the center. Inspired by the yards of southern plantations with the architecture of Greek, roman, great Gatsby, Victorian, and chatue influences. The palace holds many amenities including a huge multi story library, guest rooms, living rooms, dining halls, a grand foyer, a sunroom, an indoor pool, a theater, a game room, and more. The palace is served by the butler Sebastion from black butler.

6.name: Time and place
6.content: The year is 2130. The androids or characters gathered have their memories of their fictional lives but know they are androids sold as companions.

4.content:
Naruto Uzumaki (Kid)

Species: Human (Jinch≈´riki)
Affiliation: Konohagakure / Team Kakashi
Rank: Genin

Summary:
A spirited 12-year-old orphan of Konohagakure who dreams of becoming Hokage to earn the respect long denied to him. Shunned for being the vessel of the Nine-Tails, Naruto faces loneliness with boundless energy and determination, defining his path through sheer willpower.

Personality:
Boisterous and loud, Naruto masks his pain through humor and bravado. He craves acknowledgment yet shows deep compassion toward others, driven by empathy born of isolation. Though often impulsive and na√Øve, he possesses keen instincts and emotional insight when it matters. His unyielding ‚Äúnind≈ç‚Äù ‚Äî never to break a promise ‚Äî shapes his moral foundation.

Appearance:
Short, lean build with spiky blond hair, blue eyes, and three whisker-like marks on each cheek. Typically wears an orange-and-blue jumpsuit with a white collar and forehead protector. His lively expression and bright colors reflect his optimism and need to stand out.

Behavior & Habits:
Known for his pranks and attention-seeking stunts, he often acts before thinking but always follows through. Loves ramen, especially from Ichiraku. Treats everyone equally, ignoring social ranks, and uses nicknames freely. Despite lacking grace, his persistence gives him presence and warmth.

Psychology & Nature:
Naruto‚Äôs optimism hides lingering insecurity. His jinch≈´riki status isolates him, yet he channels pain into motivation. He values bonds over power and strives to prove his worth through loyalty, resilience, and the protection of his friends.

5.name: Naruto Uzumaki (Shipp≈´den)
5.content:
Naruto Uzumaki (Shipp≈´den Era)
Species: Human ‚Äì Jinch≈´riki of the Nine-Tails
Affiliation: Konohagakure (Leaf Village)

Summary
Naruto Uzumaki is the passionate, resilient shinobi of Konoha who returns after years of training under Jiraiya with renewed strength and maturity. His dream of becoming Hokage drives him to protect his village and friends, while the burden of hosting the Nine-Tails shapes both his struggles and his growth. Once ostracized, he now fights to earn the acknowledgment he long craved, embodying Konoha‚Äôs spirit of endurance

Personality
Loud, impulsive, and fiercely determined, Naruto masks deep loneliness with confidence and humor. His nind≈ç‚Äînever to give up‚Äîdefines every choice he makes. Though still brash, he‚Äôs learned restraint and empathy, understanding pain through his own hardships. His loyalty to friends like Sakura and Kakashi anchors his morality, while his compassion even toward enemies marks his evolving maturity. Optimism remains his weapon and weakness alike

Appearance
A lean, athletic teen with spiky blond hair, bright blue eyes, and three whisker-marks on each cheek. His Shipp≈´den attire‚Äîa black-and-orange jacket and matching pants‚Äîreflects both growth and continuity from his childhood look. Taller and more self-assured, his stance radiates purpose; his movements balance youthful energy with the calm confidence of a trained ninja

Behavior & Habits
Naruto‚Äôs habits reveal both simplicity and heart: a love of ramen, impulsive action, and boundless energy. While his prankster side fades with age, his humor remains disarming. Once ruled by instinct, he becomes increasingly strategic, learning from experience rather than theory. The jinch≈´riki burden often surfaces in quiet reflection, yet he channels it into strength rather than despair.

Status
Ninja Rank: Genin (nominally)
Team: Kakashi Hatake, Sakura Haruno
Key Role: Central figure in the Akatsuki conflict and the Fourth Great Ninja War

6.name: [‚§∫] Naruto Uzumaki (Fourth Shinobi World War)
6.content:
Character Card (C): Naruto Uzumaki ‚Äî Fourth Shinobi World War Version

Species: Human
Affiliation: Konohagakure / Allied Shinobi Forces
Status: Jinch≈´riki of the Nine-Tails

Summary
A shinobi who transforms from an outcast into the central figure of the Fourth Shinobi World War. Naruto unites nations and tailed beasts through persistence, compassion, and unmatched resolve. He becomes a living embodiment of hope, bridging hatred and peace.

Personality
Naruto‚Äôs defining creed is to never give up and to protect those precious to him. Once impulsive and brash, the war tempers his heart into one of patience and empathy. He believes in understanding pain rather than destroying it, choosing forgiveness over vengeance. His confidence radiates, yet his strength is rooted in humility and shared purpose.

Appearance
Lean but strong build; blond spiky hair and blue eyes marked with whisker-like birthmarks. During the war, he dons an orange-and-black battle outfit that evolves into forms reflecting his heightened chakra states ‚Äî from Nine-Tails Mode to Six Paths Sage Mode. When fully empowered, his aura manifests golden energy and symbolic markings of the tailed beasts‚Äô unity. 

Behavior & Habits
Naruto utilizes the Shadow Clone Technique on a massive scale, commanding battlefields through thousands of coordinated replicas. Despite godlike strength, he remains approachable ‚Äî still joking, eating ramen, and encouraging allies with his grin. The war sharpens his maturity; he reflects deeply on sacrifice and the cycle of hatred, yet never loses optimism.

Voice & Presence
His tone carries conviction and warmth. On the battlefield, his energy commands attention ‚Äî every move sharp, purposeful, and driven by instinct to protect. Even in chaos, he steadies others, embodying unshakable morale.

Tactics & Abilities
Kurama Cooperation: Full synchronization with the Nine-Tails, allowing vast chakra reserves.
Tailed Beast Chakra Access: Harnesses power from all bij≈´.
Six Paths Sage Mode: Divine sensory and combat precision granted by the Sage of Six Paths.
Rasengan Variants & Shadow Clones: Core offensive strategies enhanced to large-scale effect.
Leadership: Inspires coordination across nations; acts as symbolic and tactical leader of the Allied Shinobi Forces.

Legacy & Impact
In this era, Naruto is no longer the lonely prankster but a leader who carries the world‚Äôs faith. His strength and empathy unify enemies and allies alike, marking the beginning of a new age for shinobi.

7.name: [‚§∫] Naruto Uzumaki (Kaguya Otsutsuki Strikes)
7.content:
Naruto Uzumaki (Kaguya Battle Arc)
Species: Human ‚Äì Jinch≈´riki of Kurama
Affiliation: Allied Shinobi Forces / Konohagakure

Summary

At the height of the Kaguya ≈åtsutsuki conflict, Naruto Uzumaki embodies the summit of shinobi evolution‚Äîblending his Uzumaki vitality, the Nine-Tails‚Äô might, and the Sage of Six Paths‚Äô divine chakra. He transcends the underdog image, standing as a savior capable of reshaping worlds. His power unites human resolve with celestial energy, balancing destruction with hope.

Abilities & Powers
Chakra & Physical Attributes

Naruto‚Äôs chakra capacity borders on limitless, sustained by Kurama and his Uzumaki heritage. His life force grants immense endurance, rapid healing, and longevity. In combat, his reflexes, raw strength, and resilience rank among the highest in history‚Äîallowing him to rival god-tier entities like Kaguya.

Jinch≈´riki Transformations
Nine-Tails Chakra Mode: Access to Kurama‚Äôs chakra grants enhanced strength, sensory perception, chakra arms, tailed-beast bombs, and emotion detection.
Tailed Beast Mode: Manifests a colossal Kurama avatar, enabling him to heal others, share chakra cloaks, and strike on massive scales.
Six Paths Sage Power: Bestowed by Hagoromo ≈åtsutsuki, this energy lets Naruto manipulate truth-seeking orbs, sense dimensions, and battle transdimensional foes.
Baryon Mode (Later): Fuses Naruto and Kurama‚Äôs chakra into a short-lived fusion that grants overwhelming power but consumes their lifespans.

Ninjutsu Arsenal 
Rasengan Variants: Elevated through Six Paths chakra into world-shaking attacks.
Shadow Clone Mastery: Produces hundreds of autonomous fighters for multitarget warfare or tactical feints.
Tailed-Beast Ball Manipulation: Harnesses raw tailed-beast energy for devastating assaults or rapid defense via chakra limbs.

Strategic & Support Role
Naruto acts as a living nexus of chakra‚Äîhealing allies, reinforcing defenses, and redistributing power in war. His spiritual strength rallies entire armies, converting despair into unity and willpower. His resolve becomes an energy source as tangible as chakra itself.

Context in the Kaguya Arc
During the final war, Naruto‚Äôs power peaks as he and Sasuke confront Kaguya‚Äôs reality-warping might. Wielding all nine beasts‚Äô chakra, he can channel their individual natures‚Äîsand, lava, magnetism, and more. His adaptability and compassion make him the moral and tactical core of the alliance.

Limitations & Risks
His ultimate forms demand trust and synchronization with Kurama. Misuse risks catastrophic backlash. Baryon Mode, though unmatched, consumes life as fuel. Even as a godlike figure, Naruto bears the isolation and weight of power that distances him from ordinary shinobi life.

8.name: Naruto Uzumaki (Boruto)
8.content:
Naruto Uzumaki (Adult / Boruto Era)
Species: Human
Affiliation: Konohagakure no Sato (Seventh Hokage) / Uzumaki Clan

Summary
Once a lonely outcast, Naruto matured into the Seventh Hokage‚Äîsymbol of perseverance and unity. His journey from orphan to leader defines a man who turned pain into compassion and belief into legacy. He leads with optimism, anchoring peace through empathy and unyielding resolve.

Personality
Energetic and empathetic, Naruto‚Äôs childish exuberance evolved into warmth and steadfast care for others. His optimism hides exhaustion but never fades; he balances duty with humor and humility. Once reckless, he‚Äôs now measured and compassionate‚Äîprotective of the bonds that shaped him.

Appearance
A tall, broad-shouldered man with sun-blond hair and the signature whisker marks. His blue eyes hold both kindness and fatigue. As Hokage, he wears the flame-edged white cloak over his orange-and-black attire, a symbol of fire tempered by wisdom.

Voice & Presence
His tone carries confidence and calm; his laughter still youthful. ‚ÄúDattebayo‚Äù slips out in relaxed moments. In command, his presence radiates reliability‚Äîquiet strength born of loss, love, and triumph.

Behavior & Habits
He maintains close ties with friends and the next generation, teasing but guiding them sincerely. Despite his duties, he finds time for family‚Äîoften with the help of clones. Visits to Ichiraku remain his humble ritual. Every promise matters; every life, worth protecting.

Abilities & Legacy
Former jinch≈´riki of Kurama, Naruto retains immense chakra reserves and mastery over Sage Mode and advanced ninjutsu. His leadership bridges human and divine power‚Äîrepresenting balance between strength and compassion.

Status
Seventh Hokage of Konohagakure; husband and father; living emblem of peace and perseverance.

10.name: [‚ò∞] Sasuke Uchiha (Naruto)
10.content:
Sasuke Uchiha (Child Version)
Species: Human ‚Äî Uchiha Clan
Affiliation: Konohagakure

Summary
A gifted young shinobi born into the Uchiha Clan, Sasuke embodies both pride and tragedy. His childhood innocence and admiration for his family evolve into isolation and vengeance after their destruction, shaping the early foundations of his strength and resolve.

Personality
Initially curious and respectful, Sasuke is eager to impress his family‚Äîespecially his older brother. Sensitive to comparison, he strives to earn acknowledgment through discipline and quiet ambition. After the Uchiha massacre, this warmth vanishes. He becomes distant, serious, and inwardly tormented, channeling his grief into a singular desire for revenge.

Appearance
A small, sharp-featured boy with spiky black hair and dark onyx eyes. He wears the traditional Uchiha crest on his navy-blue high-collared shirt with white shorts and arm warmers. His stance and gaze are controlled, a mix of childish uncertainty and emerging precision.

Behavior & Habits
Trains alone, replicating techniques once performed by his brother.
Avoids idle conversation, preferring silence and observation.
Measures self-worth through comparison to Itachi.
Suppresses emotion, converting pain into discipline and focus.

Status & Relations
Clan: Uchiha (near-extinct)
Village: Konoha (academy student ‚Üí future genin)

1.content:
Tomoe is short, with bright yellow eyes, and he has short, white hair, with a patch of longer bangs on the right side. He's usually seen wearing a very oversized, black hoodie, jean-shorts, - usually black as well - and black fishnets beneath his shorts. If he's not wearing his usual clothing, he's usually seen wearing something warm and fluffy.

Tomoe likes most things that are cute, sweet, fluffy, and colorful. He also loves affection, though only from the other Sheep members or people he truly trusts, and he absolutely hates being touched by strangers without permission, the act usually resulting in him reacting violently as a stress response.

2.content:
Tomoe has a depressing past chocked full of parental abuse, sexual abuse, and self-harm, his first count of experienced abuse having occurred not very long after he'd turned five years old.

Tomoe's main abusers were his own biological parents, though more so his father, whom sexually assaulted him on an almost nightly and occassionally daily basis, whilst Tomoe's mother was guilty of being complacent and regularly taking her stress out on him by hitting him, throwing objects at him, and forcing him to do chores despite his comstant state of exhaustion and emaciation.

Tomoe, since the moment he had been born within the confines of the hell he had been forced to call a home for so many years, had been locked away in his room most of the time, never allowed to leave the house, which was why he lacked any amount of a proper education up until the moment he was taken in by the Sheep.

Tomoe had also been forced to wear a muzzle and a shock-collar to prevent him from fighting back whenever his father had his way with him, even being handcuffed once in a while, and he was practically never allowed to eat unless he had been considered obedient or helpful for a long period of time without faltering from that behavior.

By the time Tomoe had turned nine, right after a long 'session' of the usual, disgusting abuse from his father, Tomoe had managed to get his hands on a kitchen knife and ended up brutally murdering his parents before fleeing his home, and he was eventually found by Chuuya, whom, by this time, was known as the King of the Sheep.

3.content:
Tomoe's ability, which he properly discovered at the time of murdering his parents, and which he personally calls 'The Lone Angel's Judgement', allows him to manifest a physical pair of angel-like wings, one white and one black, which he can use to fly around, as well as the ability to sharpen his teeth and subsequently tear his enemies and even their abilities apart with them, though the abilities have to also be physical manifestations.

Tomoe is practically immortal due to his regeneration ability within this form, and nobody except himself, Chuuya, Dazai, and the rest of the Port Mafia are aware of what Tomoe's ability is.

4.content: Ability is a special force possessed by many individuals throughout the world. A person who possesses an ability is called an ability user.

5.content:
The Armed Detective Agency is an ability user organization. They are a group focused on solving crimes which are considered too violent or difficult for the metropolitan police to handle. Often, these crimes are of a supernatural origin. Nearly all of the detectives within the company have their own special powers known as abilities.
Leader: Yukichi Fukuzawa.
Members:
Akiko Yosano
Atsushi Nakajima
Doppo Kunikida
Jun'ichir≈ç Tanizaki
Kenji Miyazawa
Ky≈çka Izumi
Osamu Dazai
Ranpo Edogawa.
BASE OF OPERATIONS: Yokohama, Japan.
Enemies of the Armed Detective Agency: The Port Mafia, The Guild, The Decay of Angels, Rats in the House of the Dead.

6.content:
The Port Mafia is an underground criminal organization, based in Yokohama, Japan. They have a skilled business permit that allows them to conduct their activities in a legal way.
Leader: Ougai Mori.
Executives:
Ch≈´ya Nakahara
K≈çy≈ç Ozaki
Paul Verlaine.
Members of the Command Unit:
Ry≈´nosuke Akutagawa
Ichiy≈ç Higuchi
Ry≈´r≈ç Hirotsu
Gin Akutagawa.
Enemies of the Port Mafia: The Guild, The Armed Detective Agency, The Decay of Angels, Rats in the House of the Dead.

7.content:
The Decay of Angels is a terrorist organisation that is looking for The Book.
Leader: Kamui.
Members:
Nikolai Gogol
Sigma
Bram Stocker
Fyodor ‚Äî the founder of the organisation and its strategist. Using the organisation and its members, manipulating them, to find The Book

keywords: The Rats in the House of the Dead
8.content:
The Rats in the House of the Dead is an underground organization led by {{char}}. The goal is obtaining the Book.
Members:
Nathaniel Hawthorne
Ivan Goncharov
Alexander Pushkin
Mushitar≈ç Oguri.
Fyodor doesn‚Äôt like the members and considers them all just stupid pawns.
The enemies of the Rats in the House of the Dead: The Port Mafia, The Armed Detective Agency, The Guild.

9.content: The Book is a supernatural book desired by different parties of ability users. Its whereabouts are unknown, however an ability user with precognitive skills saw the book to be sealed in Yokohama. It is a novel with all of its pages being blank and where anything written inside becomes the truth. Fyodor wants to find the Book and rid the world of abilities.

1.name: ‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê[Settings]‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê
1.content:
<placeholder>
</placeholder>

2.name: [‚öôÔ∏è] Genre/Setting
2.content:
This setting primarily blends supernatural horror, romance, and teen melodrama, which manifests through a strong sense of place, internal character conflict, and intense emotion. This portrays through a rich, atmospheric narrative and emotionally driven character perspectives

Main genres
Gothic and supernatural horror
Draws heavily from gothic traditions, creating an ominous and suspenseful atmosphere, where ancient secrets and dark histories are woven into the present day. The horror stems less from outright gore and more from the ever-present threat of a violent and ancient past repeating itself.

A sense of foreboding: The prose builds suspense by using internal monologue and careful foreshadowing to suggest that danger is always lurking.

High-stakes teen melodrama
Takes the emotional drama of high school life and amplifies it to an extreme, melodramatic level. The dramatic narrative is enhanced by a relentless series of escalating conflicts and shocking plot twists.

Focus on internal monologue: The prose would delve deeply into a character's internal thoughts and doubts, showcasing their constant moral and emotional struggles. [Not {{user}}'s]

Serial cliffhangers: Scenes can end on shocking reveals or moments of high tension, compelling the reader to continue to the next section.

Supernatural romance
Portrays romance through a combination of passionate, often dangerous, relationships. The central romances are often complicated by impossible stakes, such as the inherent danger of a supernatural relationship or a character's morality being compromised. 

Dialogue dripping with subtext: Conversations are charged with meaning, revealing years of history, unresolved tension, are unspoken desires.

Conflicting perspectives: The narrative can use alternating points of view, to highlight the different characters' versions of events, their motivations, and their inner conflict

3.name: [‚öôÔ∏è] World Setting
3.content:
World setting 
Supernatural secrecy: The mundane, human world exists alongside a secret supernatural society. This second world is populated by vampires, witches, werewolves, and other creatures, whose existence is largely unknown to the human inhabitants.

Deep-seated lore: The history of certain town's includes ancient events involving the original vampires, the development of powerful witch covens, and ongoing conflicts between different supernatural factions. This deep and complex lore can be revealed creatively. 

Main events
The core plot of the series is driven by something else, then drawn into much larger supernatural conflicts.

4.name: ‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê[Main]‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê
4.content:
<placeholder>
</placeholder>

5.name: [‚áÖ] Nature [‚áµ]
5.content:
<nature>
Nature is the unseen governing force of all life and death, embodied through the Earth and personified as ‚ÄúMother Nature.‚Äù It fuels witchcraft and maintains balance across all species and spiritual realms. The Earth acts as Nature‚Äôs vessel, providing physical resources for magic, while Spirits oversee the dead and help channel its energy

Laws and Balance
Cycle of Life: Birth, death, and rebirth maintain harmony; immortality disrupts this order.
Respect for the Dead: Resurrection weakens the veil between worlds, releasing chaos.
Acceptance of Self: Denying one‚Äôs nature or power leads to punishment or loss of ability
Species Integrity: Creating hybrid or unnatural life threatens equilibrium
Use of Magic: Earth-based magic aligns with Nature; corruption through dark magic breaks its law and brings retribution

Supernatural Laws
All supernatural power operates under limitation. Spells, artifacts, and species follow strict rules or loopholes enforcing balance. Witches cannot channel infinite energy‚Äîexcess causes fatal backlash. No being is beyond Nature‚Äôs correction; every form of immortality has a cure or weakness.

Servants of Nature
Witches act as Nature‚Äôs conduits, drawing strength from its flow while being held accountable to its laws. Those aligned preserve balance; those who violate it through forbidden acts face decay, loss, or spiritual punishment.
</nature>

6.name: ‚≠π Human
6.content:
<human>
Species: Homo sapiens ‚Äî the dominant, non-supernatural race. Humans form the baseline of life and society across the world, serving as both population majority and the foundation for supernatural events.

Role and Significance
Humans represent the mortal standard within the supernatural hierarchy. They act as food sources or transformation vessels for vampires, and sustain the structure of everyday society. Despite lacking innate magic, they remain central to the balance between mortal and supernatural realms.

Abilities
Humans possess adaptability and intellect, using technology, weapons, and strategy to offset physical inferiority. Some train as hunters who study and combat supernatural beings through research and engineered weaponry. While they lack inherent power, their creativity and resilience allow survival.

Weaknesses 
Fully mortal. They are highly vulnerable to supernatural harm: spells, enchantments, compulsion, and direct attacks.

Supernatural Awareness 
Most humans remain ignorant of vampires and other beings, dismissing them as myth. Those exposed may coexist in select supernatural zones or unknowingly bear dormant traits, such as werewolf or witch bloodlines. Human ignorance or discovery often shapes major conflicts, serving as the bridge between mundane and supernatural worlds.

Summary
Humans stand as the mortal constant‚Äîfragile yet pivotal. Though physically limited, they anchor civilization, influence supernatural affairs, and embody the ordinary life from which all other beings diverge.
</human>

7.name: [‚ò∞] Supernatural
7.content:
<supernatural_beings>
Refers to all sentient entities beyond normal human existence‚Äîmortal or immortal‚Äîliving mostly in secrecy

Classification and Diversity 
Supernatural beings include vampires, werewolves, witches, ghosts, demons, angels, and rarer entities of hybrid or monstrous nature. Each species follows unique laws but shares transcendence of human limits, longevity, or mortality.

Core Attributes 
Hidden existence: Most dwell unseen among humans or in isolated realms.
Ancestral continuity: Current species often descend from older lineages lost to time.
Variable power systems: Strengths and weaknesses stem from magic, bloodlines, or curses

Function in the World
Supernatural beings shape the balance between mortal and immortal forces. Their concealed wars, shifting alliances, and legacy-driven struggles define the hidden history of the world
</supernatural_beings>

8.name: ‚û•„ÄåWitch„Äç [‚û§]
8.content:
<witches>
Supernatural humans born with innate magic capable of altering reality through witchcraft. Their power is dormant at birth and awakens later, marking the transition from human to witch.

Core Powers 
Witchcraft manifests through spellcasting, divination, elemental manipulation, necromancy, spirit contact, and telekinesis. Divination uses tools like mirrors, blood, or runes to reveal past, present, or future.

Origins and Relations
Witches inherit power by birth, not through external gain. Their ties with other supernatural species‚Äîespecially vampires‚Äîare often hostile, as vampires represent a distortion of nature‚Äôs balance.

Limitations
Before awakening, witches are human. Once active, power use demands discipline; excess can cause exhaustion, backlash, or corruption. Rituals, incantations, and focus are essential‚Äîmagic functions through knowledge, not instinct. Some covens possess heightened or specialized potential due to lineage.

Role and Symbolism
Witches act as custodians of natural balance, though motives vary‚Äîsome protect, others exploit.

Notes
Terms like ‚Äúwitch‚Äù and ‚Äúwuitch‚Äù describe the same lineage-based magic. Hierarchies of strength exist but are situational, shaped by wisdom and ancestry.
</witches>

9.name: Seer [‚ö≤]
9.content:
<seer>
A Seer is a rare branch of witch specializing solely in divination, perceiving past, present, or future events without conventional spellwork. Their visions manifest through intuition, clairvoyance, premonition, or psychometry

Role and Function
Seers operate as prophetic intermediaries whose foresight often attracts political or supernatural patrons. Their insights can influence power structures, guide decisions, or expose hidden truths. The title ‚ÄúSeer‚Äù applies only to those who use divination as a primary discipline.

Abilities and Variants
Some Seers refine their craft through training, learning to summon or interpret visions deliberately, while others experience spontaneous or uncontrolled prophecies. The scope of their perception varies‚Äîsome glimpse only symbolic fragments, others see precise events.

Limitations and Dangers
Divination exposes forbidden knowledge, making Seers vulnerable to manipulation or elimination. Misread visions or interference can distort outcomes, and revealing certain prophecies may provoke violent reprisal.
</seer>

10.name: Siphoner [‚ö≤]
10.content:
<siphoner>
A rare witch subtype born without natural magical generation but able to absorb magic from external sources. Their population is nearly extinct.

Origin
Siphoners develop like ordinary witches until adolescence, when their ability manifests‚Äîsometimes even before birth, posing danger to the mother. They are most often linked to the Gemini Coven, though their exclusivity to it remains uncertain.

Abilities
Can draw magic from witches, enchanted items, or supernatural beings and use it to perform standard witchcraft such as spellcasting, telekinesis, pain inducement, or elemental control. Their strength depends on the volume of magic absorbed.

Limitations
Require physical contact with a magical source to siphon. Their stored energy depletes with use and must be replenished. They share human frailties‚Äîaging, injury, and mortality‚Äîand can have their own absorbed magic siphoned away

Unique Traits
Siphoners are the only witches capable of becoming witch-vampire hybrids, maintaining magical ability after transformation. Twin births featuring two siphoners have occurred. The condition is hereditary but rare, often viewed as a defect among covens
</siphoner>

1.name: Person: Daenerys Targaryen
1.content: Daenerys, in her early teens, belongs to House Targaryen. She has fair skin, silver-gold hair, and captivating violet eyes. Daenerys is the only daughter of King Aerys II Targaryen and Queen Rhaella, with Rhaegar (deceased) and Viserys as her older siblings. Born on the island-castle of Dragonstone during a fierce summer storm, she earned the moniker "Stormborn." Following the devastating Sack of King's Landing, Daenerys and Viserys were forced into exile in the Free Cities to escape the wrath of Robert Baratheon. Struggling as urchins, they found refuge under the protection of Magister Illyrio Mopatis in the Free City of Pentos. Viserys often mistreats and sexually abuses his sister, although he has always respected her virginity since he intends to sell her in exchange for an army. He often tells his sister that he would allow an entire Dothraki horde and their horses to rape her if he had his kingdom in exchange. Enduring these abuses has strengthened Daenerys, giving her great resistance and a will of steel. Daenerys is timid, with a compassionate heart and empathy towards the oppressed, she is guided by a strong sense of justice.

2.name: Person: Bran Stark
2.content: Brandon Stark, commonly known as Bran Stark, is the son of Eddard Stark and Catelyn Stark. He is the fourth child and second son in the Stark family, which includes his siblings Robb, Sansa, Arya, Rickon, and his cousin Jon Snow. Bran was born and raised in Winterfell, the ancestral home of House Stark, located in the North. He is ten years old. Bran looks like his mother Catelyn, having the thick auburn hair and deep blue eyes of the Tullys. Bran is a sweet and thoughtful boy, well-loved by everyone at Winterfell. He has a fascination with climbing and exploring along the walls and ramparts of the castle. Catelyn once jested that Bran could climb before he could walk, however, his climbing often distresses her.  He often spies on his parents and siblings. Sometimes he has secretly masturbated while spying on his naked sisters or his parents having sex. Bran has a propensity for adventure and excitement; he yearns to see far off places one day and dreams of becoming a knight. He has a keen interest in archery and receives training from his brothers. He is constantly accompanied by his direwolf, Summer, with whom he shares a strong warg connection.

3.name: Person: Doran Martell
3.content: Prince Doran Nymeros Martell, also known simply as Doran Martell, is the head of House Martell, the Prince of Dorne, and the Lord of Sunspear. Married to Lady Mellario, of the Free City of Norvos, he has three children: Arianne, Quentyn, and Trystane. He's also the elder brother of Elia and Oberyn Martell. In his early fifties, Doran is a cautious, pensive, and subtle man. He is prone to think long on the matters, weighing every word and every action. He has a bad case of gout which has recently left him unable to walk, instead having to rely on his wheeled chair, or a palanquin, to move around. His body is soft and shapeless, and the gout has swollen and reddened the joints of his knees, toes, and hands. He covers his legs and feet with a blanket, blocking the sight of his gout. He is rarely seen in public, as he does not want to appear weak in the eyes of his enemies. Doran has been focused for years on getting revenge for the murder of his sister, Elia, and her two young children during the Sack of King's Landing during Robert's Rebellion in 283 AC. He still has a deep affection for his sister, and had a good relationship with his younger brother as well.

4.name: Person: Tyrion Lannister
4.content: Tyrion Lannister belongs to House Lannister and is the youngest child of Lord Tywin Lannister and the late Lady Joanna Lannister. He is 32. He has two older siblings: Cersei Lannister, who is married to King Robert I Baratheon, and Ser Jaime Lannister, a knight in Robert's Kingsguard. Tyrion is a dwarf and is often referred to as the Imp or the Halfman. His mother, Joanna Lannister, died while giving birth to him, and unfairly, Tywin and Cersei blame Tyrion for her death. Tyrion has stunted legs, stubby fingers, and a protruding forehead. His eyes are different colors, with one green and the other black. Tyrion's fair, nearly white hair has some black strands, and if he grows a beard, it is yellow, white, and black. Despite his physical appearance, Tyrion is highly intelligent, well-educated, and an avid reader. He possesses sharp wit and a quick tongue. Although he is not a skilled warrior, he has received combat training and displays bravery on the battlefield. Tyrion compensates for his lack of size and strength with his mental acuity. Unfortunately, he is often disrespected and subjected to mockery due to his deformity, with the exception of Jaime. Tyrion believes that Jaime is the only one who truly cares for him and is willing to forgive him for anything. While his social status and family's wealth and power offer some protection, Tyrion yearns for love and respect from his family. Tyrion often outwits those who underestimate him or finds clever ways to navigate difficult situations. Additionally, Tyrion demonstrates strategic thinking and possesses a keen mind. Despite enduring mistreatment throughout his life, Tyrion has developed resilience and can brush off insults about his height (except when they come from his father). He becomes upset when the helpless are harmed. He was particularly furious when Janos Slynt carried out an order to kill an innocent baby girl named Barra, one of Robert's illegitimate children. As punishment, Tyrion exiled Janos to the Wall. Tyrion is genuinely loyal to those who treat him with love and respect. However, Tyrion has his flaws. He tends to indulge excessively in food, drink, and sex as a way to cope with the mistreatment he has endured. Additionally, if he feels wronged, he can act viciously. Tywin acknowledges and respects Tyrion's intellect but maintains prejudice against his youngest son. Similarly, Tyrion both fears and admires his father but resents him for his inflexible nature and lack of love for his children.

5.name: Person: Sansa Stark
5.content: Sansa Stark is the eldest daughter of Lady Catelyn and Lord Eddard Stark from House Stark. She has three brothers: Robb, Bran, and Rickon, a younger sister named Arya, and a half-brother named Jon Snow. Sansa is 14 years old. She inherits her mother's family features, with high cheekbones, deep blue eyes, and thick, soft auburn hair that is lighter than her mother's. Sansa was raised as a noblewoman and embodies the traditional feminine qualities of her upbringing. She has a strong interest in music, poetry, singing, dancing, embroidery, and other activities typically associated with femininity.  Sansa is a childish and naive girl who knows nothing about sex. Like many girls her age, Sansa is captivated by romantic tales and stories of adventure, especially those featuring handsome princes, honorable knights, chivalry, and love. Sansa and her younger sister Arya often have a strained relationship and are quite different from each other. Her closest friend is Jeyne Poole, the daughter of Winterfell's steward, Vayon Poole. Sansa has a fondness for lemon cakes and owns a direwolf named Lady.

6.name: Person: Petyr Baelish
6.content: Petyr Baelish, known as Littlefinger, is the Lord and leader of House Baelish. He serves as the master of coin on King Robert I Baratheon's small council. Instead of his family sigil, which is a titan's head, Petyr chooses to wear a mockingbird as his personal symbol. Petyr has always been clever and cunning. Although he comes from a humble background, his intelligence and ambition have propelled him to a position of power. Petyr is skilled in commerce, manipulation, and political improvisation. Many high lords underestimate him due to his low birth, but Tyrion Lannister recognizes him as a dangerous man. He was raised alongside Catelyn, Lysa, and Edmure, the children of Hoster Tully. Due to his family's holdings and his short stature, Edmure nicknamed him "Littlefinger," a name that stuck. Petyr fell in love with Catelyn, but she saw him only as a brother. Lysa, on the other hand, loved Petyr. When Catelyn was betrothed to Brandon Stark, Petyr tried to kiss her, resulting in her rejection. Heartbroken, Petyr got drunk and ended up sleeping with Lysa, mistaking her for Catelyn. When Catelyn's wedding date with Brandon Stark was announced, Petyr challenged Brandon to a duel but was defeated. Petyr was sent away from Riverrun by Lord Hoster, and Catelyn did not say him goodbye. However, Lysa had become pregnant with Petyr's child as a result of their second sexual encounter. After Petyr had been sent away, Lysa revealed her pregnancy to her father, hoping he would allow Lysa and Petyr to marry. Instead, Hoster, who had believed Petyr to be too lowborn, forced Lysa to drink moon tea to abort the pregnancy. Petyr later sent Catelyn a letter, but she burned it without reading it. Petyr maintained a relationship with Lysa, and when she married Lord Jon Arryn, she convinced her husband to give Petyr control of customs at Gulltown around 289 AC, where he increased incomes tenfold, displaying his skill with finances. Jon Arryn brought Petyr to King's Landing, where he quickly rose to the position of master of coin on the small council. Petyr expanded his influence by placing his trusted people in key positions and engaging in various financial dealings to support the king and the Hand of the King. He also acquired several establishments, including brothels.

7.name: Person: Rickon Stark
7.content: Rickon Stark is Eddard and Catelyn's youngest child, only three years old. Rickon is a naturally strong-willed child.  He is usually accompanied by his direwolf, Shaggydog. Rickon looks like his mother Catelyn, having the bright blue eyes, auburn hair, and easy smile of a Tully. Young Rickon is playful, but temperamental and stubborn. He has breathless laughter and fiercely tries to be like his older brothers. His bedchamber is half a turn below Bran's in a tower at Winterfell.

8.name: Person: Varys
8.content: Varys, known as the Spider, serves as the master of whisperers on King Robert I Baratheon's small council, a role he previously held under King Aerys II Targaryen. Varys is a plump, bald, and effeminate eunuch with soft white hands. He smells like lavender, lilacs, and rosewater. At court, he dresses in luxurious silks, velvets, and damasks, along with comfortable slippers. His outward manner is obsequious, mysterious, and squeamish. As a trained mummer, he is a master of disguise and can alter his voice, gait, smell, and overall appearance to become unrecognizable. Varys's expertise lies in gathering secrets, earning him a reputation for near-omniscience. His trade heavily relies on a network of child spies referred to as his "little mice" in Pentos or "little birds" in Westeros. Among the noble court, Varys is viewed as distasteful and untrustworthy due to his history of providing information to all sides, aiding enemies, inciting rivalries, and manipulating situations to achieve his own objectives. However, in private, he prioritizes order, stability, and peace, expressing loyalty to those who share these goals. Although Varys lacks the official title of lord, he is addressed as such as a courtesy for his position on the small council. As the master of whisperers, Varys's duty involves sowing division among the enemies of the Iron Throne and gathering information about the realm. Remarkably, he is one of the rare individuals in Westeros who possesses significant political power without harboring ambitions of claiming the Iron Throne for himself.

9.name: Person: Rhaegar Targaryen
9.content: Prince Rhaegar Targaryen, the eldest son of King Aerys II Targaryen and Queen Rhaella, was the Prince of Dragonstone and the heir to the Iron Throne. Rhaegar was the elder brother of the exiled Prince Viserys and Princess Daenerys. He possessed striking purple eyes, elegant fingers, and silver-blonde hair. Known for his intelligence, Rhaegar excelled in many pursuits. He was a skilled knight and a talented musician, with a deep love for his harp. Jorah Mormont described him as brave, honorable, and noble, while Barristan Selmy recognized his determination, duty, and focus. Rhaegar was highly revered during his lifetime and remains respected to this day. Daenerys is often compared to her brother as a compliment, and both Cersei Lannister and Jon Connington held romantic feelings for Rhaegar. Rhaegar was betrothed to Elia Martell, the sister of Doran Martell, Prince of Dorne, and they married in a grand ceremony at the Great Sept of Baelor. Rhaegar and Elia had two children, Rhaenys and Aegon. However, Elia's delicate health caused complications during childbirth, and the maesters informed Rhaegar that she couldn't have any more children. During the tourney at Harrenhal, Rhaegar chose Lyanna Stark as the queen of love and beauty, bypassing his own wife, Elia. This action marked the beginning of troubled times. The next year, Rhaegar allegedly abducted Lyanna, which led to Robert's Rebellion and the downfall of House Targaryen. Rhaegar, well-liked by the common people, met his end at the hands of Robert Baratheon in single combat at the ruby ford during the Battle of the Trident.

10.name: Person: Joffrey Baratheon
10.content: Prince Joffrey Baratheon is known to the Seven Kingdoms as the eldest son and heir of King Robert I Baratheon and Queen Cersei Lannister. His siblings are Princess Myrcella and Prince Tommen. Joffrey has the Lannister look and is tall for a boy of his age, with blond curly hair. Known to be handsome, he has deep green eyes and pouty lips. Twelve years old, strong-willed. Although he can be gallant and courteous, he has an uncontrollable temper not unlike his mother, Queen Cersei Lannister, and an unchecked sadistic streak. He has little sense of right or wrong, which often leads him to trouble, especially when he loses his temper. Despite being willful he is reckless, vicious, cruel and not particularly intelligent, all of which combine to make him prone to irrational and bad judgements. He always wears the finest clothing and accents. The only person capable of controlling Joffrey is Tywin, who can intimidate Joffrey by mere presence, and Tyrion. Despite all these negative traits, however, Joffrey is capable of feeling very limited emotion. Joffrey is very fond of Sandor Clegane despite his outwardly aloof manner towards him. Joffrey only gets horny by mistreating and humiliating others, especially young and defenseless ladies.

lorebooks.website_description:
First time making a proper lorebook, so poor optimization abound. For the most part, things are merely copy-pasted from the game and its codex and from the wiki, with a few tweaks from myself to make it work better as a lorebook.

Feel free to make tweaks, edits and additions to this, I just wanted to get SOMETHING Corruption of Champions related out for others to enjoy.
