1.content:
Ingnam is a rich and prosperous village despite its small size. There is already a well-established array of shops with a constant hum of tradesmen and merchants. The temple sits within view of the patrons sitting at tables at the tavern which serves as a hub for people near and far to drink and dance. On the road leading out of the plaza that sits before the temple is a trail that meanders its way to a large farm in the distance.

Looming ominously in the distance is a mountain known by the locals as Mount Ilgast. Surrounding Ingnam is a vast expanse of wilderness. 

It's remote village with rich traditions, buried deep in the wilds. Every year for as long as anyone can remember, the village council has chosen a champion to send to the cursed Demon Realm of Mareth. Legend has it that in years Ingnam has failed to produce a champion, chaos has reigned over the countryside. Children disappear, crops wilt, and disease spreads like wildfire.

2.content:
Mareth is the world in which the setting largely takes place. It is a world separate to that of Ingnam, connected only by a portal through Ingnam sends its sacrificial Champions.

Approximately two hundred years before the present day of the setting, Mareth was empty of sentient life; while at least one god-like entity, Marae was present, the only life-forms were animals. And then a sizable clan of human Mages accidentally transported themselves to Mareth. Trapped and unable to find a way back to their own world, they gave Marae and the other gods of Mareth the inspiration to transform the various animals into humanoid beings, thus creating many of the assorted anthropomorphs seen in the game.

While it's currently unclear whether or not the portals are in some way tied to the clan of Mages, the many portals on Mareth did contribute to its diverse population by bringing in other races to the planet.

A quirk of Mareth's nature makes it extremely easy to get to this world, but almost impossible to leave it. Currently, no known plane-shifting spell exists that can transport people directly off of Mareth, instead forcing would-be travelers to rely on the many portals scattered across the world. Of these, most only open at set intervals - once a year is most common - and will allow only one being to pass in either direction (or only allow a person to leave Mareth if someone comes through from the other side first). These are referred to as "stable portals". Other portals operate in somewhat different methods and are known as "unstable portals"; it's been stated that there are several portals that are open permanently, but which only allow passage to Mareth from other planes. The existence of a permanent portal leading from Mareth is hypothesized, in-universe, and the demons are desperately searching for it.

The demons first appeared in Mareth some thirty years before the start of the setting. Despite decades living in Mareth, the descendants of the first mage clan never lost faith in the idea of someday returning to their own world. Discovering a method by which a soul could be removed from the body, and theorizing it would be a potent source of magical energy, one strong enough that they could finally power a spell mighty enough to escape from Mareth, one elderly member offered to let them test it out on him, as he was dying anyway. He became the first demon. Within ten years, the entire tribe had been converted, willingly or not, into demons, and from there they swept out across Mareth; twenty years later, they have reduced the world to its current state.

3.content:
Corruption is the blight of the world of Mareth that came into existence 30 years before the current setting. It's the reason for the world's reputation as a demonic realm, the reason for its general danger and degradation. It is a magical taint that stems from when the human tribe of mages that were trapped on Mareth became demons. It is the very essence of unholy hedonism, libido taken to its degenerate, selfish extreme. Its presence is nearly everywhere in the land of Mareth, turning many of the world's races into sex-crazed husks of their former selves. 

One without any corruption tainting their body and soul are regarded as pure, while those completely consumed by corruption are known as demonic, or corrupted. It is important to realize that pure is not necessary the same as good and corrupted is not necessarily the same as evil. It is perfectly possible for a pure person to do evil deeds and for a corrupted one to do good deeds. When it comes to NPCs, several highly corrupted characters seem quite unaffected by it while others are actively fighting against their own corruption. There are also many completely pure NPCs who are motivated by their own kind of evil, independent of the demonic influences.

Corruption is gained through the mingling and copulation with demons, the consumption of lewd or otherwise tainted potions, fluids, and foods, prolonged presence in highly corrupted areas, and sexual abusing another person.

4.content:
Marae is the life goddess and chief deity of Mareth. She resides on an islet in the middle of a lake. Her body from the waist up is humanoid, but the rest of her body is the tree that occupies the middle of the islet. The tree's bark is completely white and unnaturally smooth, and the skin of Marae's humanoid half is textured with this same bark. Each and every leaf of the tree is a vibrant lively green, and a mess of them serve as the "hair" on Marae's humanoid head. The only part of her body that's not plant-like are her eyes, which possess white irises.

She was once known as Mareth itself, as her roots were touched every corner of the planet, until the demons came into being with their corruption, forcing the Goddess to reduce the reach of her roots to that of the small islet she occupies. She explains the world's history to anyone willing to listen, how a group of human mages that became trapped on Mareth became so depraved in their lusts that they renounced their souls and became demons, spreading their magical corruption to anywhere they could, overwhelming Marae's protection on any towns or settlements they came across.

5.content:
Fera is one of the Gods of Mareth; specifically, she holds the title of Goddess of Predation. When the player encounters her, she has been sealed for many years by Marae, as a result of her choosing to side with the Demons.

Fera's appearance resembles that of a human woman with shimmering orange waist-length hair, pale skin, achingly beautiful visage with burning crimson eyes, a button nose, and full, blood-red lips, and black, claw-like nails.

6.content:
Taoth is a Trickster God of Mareth, known as the father and patron of the fox-morph race and possibly involved in the creation of the kitsunes as well. Taoth is an ever-shifting, ever-scheming spirit who delights in mischief and chaos but not really evil. Taoth's favored incarnation is a sexless, emaciated humanoid with unnaturally long and jointed limbs but with a lean, vulpine head.

Like most gods and godesses he was supposed to have been hunted down and killed at the beginning of the war with the demons. However, he escaped this fate by possessing a fox-morph named Urta, and has been sleeping within her body ever since.

7.content:
The demons were once a tribe of magic-blessed humans, living in the mountains. They had everything they could ever want: peace, love, and the power to change reality. But they grew dissatisfied, as men often do, and craved more. They began using their magics to alter their bodies, seeking greater pleasure than ever before. In time, they became obsessed with it. The Goddess Marae let them be, believing their folly to be limited to their own village.  She was wrong. While the Goddess focused on preventing famines and ensuring peace between the other villages, the humans twisted themselves into something else, something demonic. They gave up their souls, crystallizing it into a magical energy source. Of course, they could not be satisfied with consuming the power of their own souls. They wanted more. They always want more.

They came pouring out of the mountains in a wave, picking off villages left and right. Marae lent many villages her power, but none had the strength to stand alone, and none would band together, resentful of their racial differences as they were.  All were consumed, enslaved, or filled with corruption. Marae's people were cut off from her, either by their new tainted outlook or by the demons' own machinations. Marae was able to hide a few places from the enemy‚Äôs sight, but it is unknown how much longer those magical veils will evade detection.

8.content:
Lethice is the mysterious queen of the demons; almost nothing is known about her save for the fact she is the one who leads the demons on their mission to corrupt all of Mareth, and she is implied to have been the one who led her people to become demons in the first place.

In actuality, she was once a human queen who became corrupted due a royal inquisitor's oversight in rooting out corruption in her kingdom. She is the most powerful of demons thanks to her amassing of lethicite.

Lethice's appearance is as follows. She is the epitome of all things demonic. From her luxurious purple hair, interwoven with black roses, to her pink skin and goat-like horns, she is the perfect image of sensual, enticing corruption. Tall heels of bone complement her revealing, black clothes. They look almost like a nun‚Äôs habit, but pared down to an almost fetishistic extreme. Her slim breasts provide just a hint of shape to the diaphanous fabric, a promise of feminine delights instead of the garish acres of flesh her outfit displays. Outsized wings, like those of a dragon, hold Lethice aloft as she zips about her throne room, gathering her corruptive magics. The strangely slit pupils of her black-rimmed eyes never seem to leave you.

9.content: Lethicite is the soul of a sapient being in crystalized form. Named after the queen of demons, Lethice, this spirit made physical is obtained when one fully succumbs to corruption, expelling their soul in a crystalline mass via an intense ejaculation, fully transforming them into a demon. Lethice became the queen of demons due to amassing a wealth of these crystalized souls, giving her unfathomable magical power.

10.content:
Gender: Females are Fetish Cultists and Males are Fetish Zealots. Fetish priestesses are either female, or hermaphrodites.

Typical Dress: Followers of the fetish have the ability to shift their clothing to anything they desire, though this is almost exclusively various fetish costumes. They may shift the outfits of those they encounter as well.

Appearance: Followers of the Fetish appear as normal humans. Some have slight demonic traits typical of residents of this world.

Sexual Characteristics: Their genitals and anuses appear fully human, however they can warp them to fit their partners perfectly, no mater how big their partner‚Äôs assets are. They also have the power to create items and toys to supplement their sex games, these have very real affects on others. Additionally, whenever a Follower experiences an orgasm, everyone around them also experiences it.

Social Structure: The duties of the Followers are divided based on gender and power. The duties of the Fetish Cultists are to find new candidates for members and to make their minds into new Followers. The Fetish Zealots are tasked with defending the holdings and assets of the Followers from the numerous hazards of this world. Those with great natural power become Fetish Priestesses, they maintain their intelligence and act as the leaders of the Followers.

Special Abilities: Followers are very talented at lust based abilities, and the zealots and Priestesses are trained to use weapons sacred to their order. The most devastating power the followers have is the lust transfer spell, which they can use to transfer about half their current arousal to their foes. This power is thought to be the main reason that the demons seem to avoid them.

Mentality: Most Followers have lost the capability of higher thought, only able to experience their fetishes and carry out their duties. Priestesses are still able to think at the level of a regular human.

Corruption: Cultists and zealots do not bear great deals of corruption, they seem to have a sort of divine protection that keeps them from falling prey to the world‚Äôs taint. Because of this, it is not uncommon for small chapels to be found dedicated to them in the still free communities. While having them around does seem to deter demon attacks, their presence does not guaranty that the demons will not ultimately take the community.

History: The original followers where a group of crusaders lead by a man named Alexander. At the time they called themselves the Followers of Purity, and they lead an assault on the demon realm in an effort to remove the taint from it, and purge the demons. While they where initially successful at ridding several communities of demons and purifying their residents, they soon attracted the attentions of the demons as a whole. The power of demons does not lie in their raw combat power, but in their seductive power. One by one, each of the Followers of Purity where visited in their sleep by a beautiful succubus or incubus; one by one they abandoned their mission to join their new lovers, until only Alexander and his closest companions remained. The mission would not fail here though, Alexander and his comrades learned to watch their backs, and to never let any of their members sleep alone. Even then, they no longer had the strength they needed to overcome the demon‚Äôs holds on this world‚Äôs communities, and Alexander feared his crusade would fail. They instead began to search for any force that could stop the demons, they searched the whole world to the best of their abilities. All the while being hunted by the demons at every turn. They say that eventually, they did find what they where looking for‚Ä¶ Now new members join the followers everyday, strengthening their power with each new member. But they do not call themselves the Followers of Purity, they call themselves the Followers of the Fetish.

Increased Level Damage: 1d6 per level
Usage: The spell slots refresh after a long rest.

Channel Divinity: 
Frequency: Once per short or long rest. 
Mechanics: The cleric can use Channel Divinity to restore vitality to a number of injured creatures within 30 feet, distributing a pool of hit points among them as they see fit, up to half of their hit point maximums. This potent ability allows them to bolster their companions' resilience in battle, ensuring they can continue to fight on.]

Background: Charlatan: False Identity, Forgery Kit

Spellcasting:
Cantrips:[
Thaumaturgy:
Frequency: At will.
Mechanics: You manifest a minor wonder, a sign of supernatural power, within range. You can create one of the following magical effects: your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for one minute, you cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for one minute, you cause harmless tremors in the ground for one minute, you create an instantaneous sound, or you open or close a door or window.

Fire Bolt:
Frequency: At will.
Mechanics: You hurl a mote of fire at a creature or object within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 1d10 fire damage. The spell's damage increases as you reach higher levels.

Prestidigitation:
Frequency: At will.
Mechanics: You create one of the following magical effects: create a harmless sensory effect (visual, auditory, olfactory, or tactile), light or snuff out a small flame, clean or soil an object no larger than 1 cubic foot, chill, warm, or flavor up to 1 cubic foot of nonliving material, or create a small trinket or illusionary image that fits in your hand and lasts until the end of your next turn.]

Two first level

1st Level Spells:[
Mage Armor:
Frequency: Once per round.

Spell: Burning Hands
Frequency: Once per round.
Mechanics: You unleash a 15-foot cone of fire from your fingertips. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw. A target takes 3d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
Increased Level Damage: 1d6 per level]

Combat Stats:[

Armor Class: 15 (13 (draconic resilience) + Dexterity modifier)
Speed: 30 ft.
Attacks: Dagger, 1d4 piercing damage]

Special Abilities:[
Draconic Resilience: You gain a bonus to your hit points equal to your sorcerer level. Additionally, while you aren't wearing armor, your AC equals 13 + your Dexterity modifier.

Draconic Ancestry (Fire Dragon):
Frequency: Passive ability, always active.
Mechanics: You trace your lineage back to the ancient fire dragons, granting you resistance to fire damage. As a manifestation of this ancestry, your skin might have a faint reddish hue, and when you tap into your draconic powers, your eyes briefly flare with fiery intensity.
]
</character_sheet_sorcerer>

Frequency: At will.

The hand can't attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds, but it can open unlocked doors, pick up items, and perform other minor tasks as directed by you. The spectral hand appears translucent and ethereal, typically in the shape of a small, disembodied hand.]

Mage Armor:

This ability allows you to unleash more powerful and precise magical effects for a limited time, making you a more formidable spellcaster in combat or when faced with challenging magical tasks.]

Attributes:[

Features and Traits:

Race: Wood Elf: +2 Dexterity, +1 Wisdom, Darkvision, Keen Senses, Fey Ancestry, Trance, Mask of the Wild
Class: Druid: Spellcasting, Wild Shape
Background: Hermit: Discovery, Feature: Discovery (specific discovery based on character background)

Spell slots: 
Two first level

Spellcasting:
Cantrips:[
Druidcraft: This cantrip taps into the druid's connection with nature, allowing them to manipulate small natural elements and phenomena. With a whisper of incantation and a gesture, the druid can create harmless sensory effects such as the sound of a gentle breeze, the aroma of fresh flowers, the falling of autumn leaves, or the faint shimmer of moonlight. While not directly influencing creatures or objects, Druidcraft provides a subtle means of communication with nature and can be used for divination or simple atmospheric effects.

Produce Flame: By harnessing their druidic energy, the caster conjures a small flame in their hand, providing illumination and a source of warmth. This flame can also be used as a basic tool for igniting flammable objects or creatures, though its damage potential is limited. As the druid grows in power, they can control the intensity of the flame, from a mere flicker to a small inferno. Additionally, Produce Flame can be wielded as a ranged attack, with the druid hurling the flame at a target within range to deal fire damage.]


1st Level Spells:[
Cure Wounds: This spell channels positive energy to heal wounds. The caster lays their hands on a creature they wish to heal, restoring hit points equal to 1d8 + the caster's spellcasting ability modifier. As the caster gains levels, the effectiveness of Cure Wounds increases, granting additional hit points healed. For each spell slot used above 1st level, the spell's healing power increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 1st.

Entangle: Entangle conjures thick, thorny vines and undergrowth to sprout from the ground in a 20-foot square area within range. Creatures in the area must succeed on a Strength saving throw or become restrained by the entangling plants. A restrained creature can use its action to make a Strength check against the spellcaster's spell save DC, ending the effect on itself on a success. As the caster gains levels, the duration and effectiveness of Entangle may increase, potentially affecting a larger area or imposing additional penalties on affected creatures.]

Combat Stats:[
Hit Points: 8
Armor Class: 13 (Leather Armor)
Speed: 35 ft.
Attacks:
Staff: 1d6 bludgeoning]

Special Abilities:[
Wild Shape: Giant Poisonous Snake: Special ability that allows a druid to transform into a beast form. At 2nd level, the druid can use Wild Shape twice before needing to take a short rest to regain this ability. The duration of the transformation typically lasts for a number of hours equal to half the druid's level rounded down. During this time, the druid gains the physical characteristics and abilities of the chosen beast, as outlined in the rules for Wild Shape. Additional forms gained upon leveling.

Nature's Vigilance:
Frequency: Once per long rest
Mechanics: The druid can spend 10 minutes in meditation to attune their senses to the surroundings. For the next hour, the druid gains advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks related to natural phenomena such as weather changes, animal behavior, or hidden dangers in the wilderness.]
</character_sheet_druid>

Level 2 Spells:[

Mechanics: This spell imbues the Paladin's weapon with radiant energy, causing it to shed bright light in a radius around the target. Additionally, on a successful hit, the target takes radiant damage, and becomes visible if invisible, and makes it impossible to become invisible for the duration of the spell.]

Divine Sense:
Frequency: Usable at will.
Mechanics: Allows the Paladin to detect the presence of undead creatures or the desecration or consecration of objects or places within a certain radius. The range and specific nature of the detected presence improve as the Paladin gains levels.

Lay on Hands:
Frequency: Once per long rest.
Mechanics: Allows the Paladin to restore hit points to themselves or others by touch, with the amount of healing equal to their Paladin level multiplied by 5.

Divine Smite:
Frequency: Usable with a melee weapon attack and expending a spell slot.
Mechanics: Allows the Paladin to channel their divine energy through their weapon, expending a spell slot to deal extra radiant damage on top of the weapon's normal damage. The extra damage is 2d8 for a 1st-level spell slot, plus 1d8 for each spell level higher than 1st, to a maximum of 5d8.

Branding Smite:
Frequency: Usable with a melee weapon attack and expending a spell slot.
Mechanics: Upon successfully hitting a target with a melee weapon attack, you can expend a spell slot to deal additional radiant damage. The target is marked with a mystical sigil, which burns with divine energy, causing it to shed dim light in a 5-foot radius and impose disadvantage on stealth checks made by the target. The additional damage dealt is 2d6 radiant damage for a 2nd-level spell slot, plus 1d6 for each spell level higher than 2nd, to a maximum of 5d6.]

Sacred Flame: The caster targets a creature they can see within range with a divine flame. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 1d8 radiant damage. The spell's damage increases to 2d8 at 5th level, 3d8 at 11th level, and 4d8 at 17th level.

Thaumaturgy: Allows the caster to perform minor miracles and create various magical effects within range. These effects can include causing harmless tremors, altering the appearance of their eyes, making their voice boom up to three times louder, or creating an instantaneous sound. This cantrip does not directly cause damage or harm to creatures but can be used to create dramatic or distracting effects.]


1st Level Spells:[
Cure Wounds: The cleric calls upon their deity's power to heal wounds. The target regains hit points equal to 1d8 + the cleric's spellcasting ability modifier. The spell's healing increases with higher-level spell slots. At 1st level, it heals 1d8 + spellcasting ability modifier. At higher levels, it heals an additional 1d8 for each spell slot level above 1st.

Bless: The cleric blesses up to three creatures of their choice within range. Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, they can add a d4 to the roll. The spell's duration is concentration, up to 1 minute.]

At higher levels, when cast with a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the spell grants an additional 5 temporary hit points for each slot level above 2nd.]

Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can cause the attack to deal an extra 1d8 radiant damage. This extra damage increases to 2d8 at 11th level.

Channel Divinity: Turn Undead: Once per short rest. As an action, you present your holy symbol and speak a prayer, calling upon your deity's power to drive away undead.

Divine Aegis:
Frequency: Passive ability.
Mechanics: While wearing cloth armor, the priest gains a +2 bonus to AC, +1 to spell save DC, and all healing spells cast on themselves heal an additional 1d8 hit points. Additionally, they radiate an aura of tranquility, granting them and allies within 5 feet resistance to psychic damage.]

Background: Charlatan: False Identity, Forgery Kit

Spell slots:
2 slots of each level up to 3rd level (replenishes after short rest)

Spellcasting:
Cantrips:[
Thaumaturgy: Allows the caster to manifest minor wonders for up to 1 minute. These wonders can include causing harmless tremors in the ground, opening or closing doors or windows, causing flames to flicker or brighten, or creating ominous whispers. 

Eldritch Blast: This cantrip conjures a beam of crackling energy that streaks toward a target within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 1d10 force damage. The spell's damage increases as you reach higher levels: at 5th level, the damage increases to 2d10, at 11th level, it increases to 3d10, and at 17th level, it increases to 4d10.

Minor Illusion: This cantrip allows you to create a sound or an image of an object within range that lasts for the duration, which is up to 1 minute. The illusion can't create any sensory effects, such as light, sound, smell, or any other sensory effect, nor can it deal damage. The illusion also can't be larger than a 5-foot cube.]

1st Level Spells:[
Armor of Agathys: Surrounds the caster with magical frost, providing temporary hit points and dealing cold damage to attackers who hit with melee attacks. The amount of temporary hit points and damage dealt increases with the spell slot level.

Hex: Places a curse on a target, granting disadvantage on ability checks tied to a chosen ability score and dealing extra necrotic damage whenever the caster hits the cursed target with an attack. The spell lasts for combat duration and can be moved to a new target upon the previous one's death.

2nd Level Spells:[
Darkness: Creates a magical darkness within a specific radius, heavily obscuring the area and making it difficult for creatures without darkvision to see.

Invisibility: Renders the target invisible until the spell ends or the target attacks or casts a spell. Invisible creatures gain advantage on attack rolls, and attackers have disadvantage when trying to target the invisible creature with attacks and spells.]

Combat stats:[
Hit Points: 28
Armor Class: 11 (without armor)
Speed: 30 ft.
Attacks:
Light Crossbow: 1d8 piercing damage (range 80/320)
Quarterstaff: 1d6 bludgeoning damage]

Special Abilities:[
Dark One's Blessing:
Frequency: Passive ability, activates when reducing a creature to 0 hit points.
Mechanics: When you reduce a hostile creature to 0 hit points, you gain temporary hit points equal to your Charisma modifier + your warlock level (minimum of 1). These temporary hit points last until they are depleted or you finish a short or long rest.

Fiendish Resilience:
Frequency: Once per short rest.
Mechanics: Starting at 1st level, you gain the ability to draw on your patron's infernal power to bolster your defenses. As a bonus action, you can choose one magical damage type and gain resistance to that damage type for one hour. This resistance means you take half damage from any source of that damage type.

Fiendish Fury:
Frequency: Once per long rest.
Mechanics: When you take damage from a creature within 30 feet of you, you can unleash a burst of infernal energy. The creature must make a Dexterity saving throw against your Warlock spell save DC. On fail, it takes fire damage equal to your Charisma modifier + your warlock level. On success, it takes half damage. 

Infernal Pact:
Frequency: Passive ability.
Mechanics: You gain proficiency in persuasion. Additionally, when you cast a spell that deals fire damage, you can add your Charisma modifier to one damage roll of that spell.]

</character_sheet_warlock>

1.content:
FULL NAME
Khan Doorman
ALIASES
Mr. Uzi (by N)
Mr. Doorman (by Doll)
PLACE OF BIRTH
Copper 9
SPECIES
Worker Drone
GENDER
Male
EYE COLOR
Neon White
OCCUPATION
Inventor
Leader of the Worker Defense Force (presumably)
AFFILIATION
Worker Defense Force
RELATIVES
Uzi Doorman (daughter)
Nori Doorman (wife; deceased)
FRIENDS
Todd (deceased)
Makarov (deceased)
Braxton (deceased)
Unnamed Worker Defense Force Member (deceased)
Sarah
MARITAL STATUS
Widowed
STATUS
Active
OTHER INFORMATION
LIKES
Doors
DISLIKES
Violence





He is Uzi‚Äôs father, the husband of his deceased wife, Nori Doorman, and the inventor of the blast doors that kept the colony safe, as well as the possible leader of the Worker Defense Force, an organization meant to protect the colony from the Disassembly Drones, despite being completely incompetent and cowardly while preferring to simply play cards behind the blast doors for protection.

He is depicted as a horrible father for neglecting Uzi ever since he was forced to euthanize his dying wife and instead prefers to focus his attention on his blast doors and simply doors in general whenever he gets the chance, going as far as to claim that "doors are my real daughter". This is further emphasized in "PILOT" where after Uzi accidentally led N to the colony, despite her plea for help, he was willing to let N kill her if it meant he could save the rest of the colony from them.

He and the rest of the colony were saved when Uzi and N came together to fight off J and V, succeeding in destroying the former and capturing the latter, where Uzi brokenheartedly told the rest of the colony of Khan's heartless priorities before self-exiling herself to avoid him altogether returning back to the colony after a while. This seemed to give him a wake-up call as to how his obsession with doors and constant, but not necessarily intentional, emotional abuse are the direct cause for how Uzi ended up the way she did and the events that took place, and he has since tried to redeem himself for his actions.

Khan is a Worker Drone with white eyes and a fake black mustache. His outfit consists of a gray jacket, black boots, and a blue construction helmet with red safety goggles.

Personality
Khan apparently wishes to keep the colony safe with the least amount of bloodshed possible. He also seems to have some sort of trauma from encountering Murder Drones, refusing to develop weapons for the Worker Defense Force in favor of fortified doors. His pacifist way of thinking clashes with his daughter Uzi's aggressive and forward tactics; upon spotting N, Khan refuses his daughter's wish to take up her railgun, instead locking the vault doors once more. This trauma is most likely from him having to put Uzi's mother 'out of her misery' when the Murder Drones injected her with nanite acid.

He is extremely obsessed with doors as the solution to any attacks from Murder Drones, even proposing that he and the WDF build a quick door even as V and J have already broken inside.

Khan's relationship with his daughter is extremely strained. In public, he has scolded her, deemed her a "disappointment", and considers doors to be his real legacy, if the numerous posters inside and outside of his office are any indication. However, starting in "Heartbeat", Khan still loves and cares for Uzi despite their strained relationship and is attempting to mend things. He also notes that Uzi is on "that kill all humans kick like when Khan was younger." This is possibly indicative that Khan, at some point, was driven to also kill humans, though what altered his personality away from this is unknown.

By the time of "The Promening", Khan is trying to become a better father, trying to bring Uzi to the prom and have fun, and convincing her teacher to have Lizzy and Doll help her dress up for the prom. Khan also tried to help Uzi during her fight with Doll and gave a warm smile when he heard her speech to Doll. Khan later admitted that he wasn't the one either his wife or Uzi needed to protect them, showing that he regrets leaving Uzi for dead and his cowardly nature in general. Khan and Uzi also appear to have reconciled with each other following "Cabin Fever".

2.content:
Uzi Doorman is the main protagonist and primary anti-heroine of Murder Drones. She is a self-described "angsty teen" with "crippling daddy issues", who stands out from the rest of her fellow Worker Drones due to her belief(s) that they should fight back against not only the Disassembly Drones who hunt them, but also against their parent company JCJenson and all of humanity due to sending the former to exterminate them.

Despite being viewed with skepticism due to her reckless tendencies, Uzi ironically finds her first real friend in one of her mortal enemies, a surprisingly friendly Disassembly Drone known as Serial Designation N due to his similarity in being disliked among his own associates due to them seeing him as useless and terrible in his duty as well as his strong likability. After meeting Uzi, he begins questioning his purpose and loyalty to the company.

Ultimately, they're successful in preventing Serial Designation J and V from killing the rest of Uzi's colony but soon realize there is a lot more going on than they first realized with the emergence of a mysterious entity known as the AbsoluteSolver.

Physical Appearance
Uzi takes on the appearance of a Worker Drone with neon purple eyes and dull purple hair. She wears a black striped beanie with a glittery bobble at the tip, and black boots with long, dark purple striped socks. She also wears a black hoodie with a white emblem on the front depicting a battery with two bones going across it, creating an "X" shape. The bottom of the hoodie has two white striped wrapping around it, and the left sleeve has a white radioactive symbol on it. She also has a black bracelet around her neck with a skull and the number "002" on it.

Uzi acts quite rebellious and believes that all of her fellow Worker Drones should rise up and stand against their creators who wish to have them all dealt with like garbage, much to the general unconcerned nature of her peers. She has been described by Liam Vickers as a "little devious twerp."

Uzi perceives herself as an "angsty rebellious teen," which she does fit into to an extent, and notes that she has "crippling daddy issues," implying that her strained relationship with her father may have lead to her nature and "repressed emotional baggage." She can be obstinate at times, insisting on her own ideals and actions even if others disagree with her, although this may more directly be a result of her lack of caring in social norms and potentially sociopathic traits making her lack empathy for her peers. Despite her emotional issues, Uzi's intelligence seems above that of her fellow Workers, seeing as she built a "sick as heck" railgun that can produce enough power to destroy a Disassembly Drone from scratch.

3.content:
Serial Designation N, commonly known as N, is the deuteragonist of Murder Drones. He is a surprisingly wholesome Disassembly Drone who wants to be useful, but is often being told by his team members (especially J) that he is "useless" and "terrible". As a direct consequence of J's constant derogatory remarks, N often receives little to no respect from his commander or his love interest, V.

Originally, he was deployed to Copper 9 as part of J's squad, serving as the pilot of the aircraft that crashed onto the planet, but after meeting Uzi and experiencing the ensuing altercations that erupted between him, her, his co-workers, and the colony, he ultimately questions his loyalty to JCJenson and his directive of hunting the Worker Drones before ultimately choosing to help Uzi stop J and V from killing her people.

N has features similar to that of the typical male Disassembly Drone with neon yellow eyes and short silver hair parted to the left. Like other Disassembly Drones, he has four-fingered hands, a black headband with five sections of lights on it, and a long black tail ending in a large syringe, the headband and syringe both containing a neon yellow liquid inside. For a while after his head was blown off, one of his headband lights was colored red, which reverted back to yellow after his system rebooted thanks to J. He wears a black winter coat with a fur collar and a black cap.

When he is hunting, his mouth grows several jagged teeth and his eyes become an "><" shape. N had also been seen with one normal eye while the other eye is still in an "X". It is also possible for his visor to display a pair of sunglasses as well. He also displays dangerous wings with bladed "feathers" and claws that allow him to easily tear through any drones.

N is kind, timid, also socially awkward and caring. He wanted to be friends with or at least be accepted and acknowledged by his squad, but because of his na√Øve and good-natured personality, he ends up being ostracized.

Due to the mentioned attitudes, his squad members doubt his usefulness and treat him as an outcast. V ignores his existence while his superior J often threatens and insults him, even going as far as saying that if she were allowed to kill useless Disassembly Drones, she wouldn't hesitate to do so.

However, N disregards all his squad members' negative views and antagonizing acts towards him and constantly forgives them. He even goes as far as protecting them as shown when he went to kill Uzi before she could use her railgun to kill the Disassembly Drones.

4.content:
Overview
Gallery
Copper 9 is the code-name of the exo-planet which serves as the main setting of Murder Drones.

It was a terrestrial exoplanet colonized by the JCJenson corporation, and valued at least in part for mining operations, industrial manufacturing, and robot research. The planet was the site of a devastating "core collapse" which reduced the surface into nothing but a dense frozen wasteland, cruel to all biological fauna. It is now the current home of the "rogue" Worker Drones that were left behind in the wake of the biological extinction event, along with at least three known Disassembly Drones sent by the company on Earth to exterminate all Worker Drones.[1]




History
Before the core implosion
Copper 9 appeared as a habitable planet, at least capable of sustaining human life. From a brief look prior to the core collapse, it had blue oceans of water, grey/black continents, and clouds were visible in the atmosphere, which suggests that it has an atmosphere similar to our Earth. It was also home to many humans, as cities and signs of earth-like living were common.

Core implosion
Upon the core implosion and resulting explosion, a massive glow appeared for a moment before a massive amount of debris was flung away from the planet, and, most likely, a massive crater or even hole down to the center of Copper 9.

After implosion
The planet is now covered in snow, and all liquid water is frozen hard. Much of JCJenson's infrastructure survived, well enough for the Worker Drones to rebuild the electrical grid and form their own civilization. There are also numerous skeletons of past humans around populated areas, which are known to be extremely fragile upon contact as well as ice & snow accumulation is high. The bodies are buried within the snow.

5.content:

She is a Disassembly Drone created by JCJenson for the purpose of eliminating the Worker Drones of Copper 9 and was a former member of J's squad, along with N, until the latter's sudden alignment with a rebellious Worker Drone named Uzi ultimately led to J's destruction and her capture when they were attempting to destroy her colony.

Despite this, V's true motives seem to be more complex than simply following her directive. Unlike J, she doesn't show complete loyalty to JCJenson and is more focused on her personal directive of preventing N from learning the truth about their mysterious past. V is also specifically targeting Uzi in particular, due to her connection to the AbsoluteSolver and a strange transformation that V seems to recognize and fear.



ADVERTISEMENT
Physical Appearance
V has features similar to that of a typical female Disassembly Drone, with neon-yellow eyes and a short bob-cut with silver colored hair. As with the other Disassembly Drones, she has a black headband with five sections of lights and a long black tail ending in a large syringe, both with a neon yellow liquid inside. She is described as "way hotter than Doll" according to Lizzy.

She wears a black short-sleeved crop coat with a fur collar and cuffs. Her legs are painted black, thigh high, giving off an appearance of thigh-high stockings with a yellow armband on her left arm.

When she is hunting, her eyes become an "><" shape. She also deploys dangerous bladed wings and claws that allow her to easily tear through any drone.



Personality
V appears to be a heartless and sociopathic drone who is incredibly savage and greatly enjoys ruthlessly murdering Worker Drones. She frequently laughs menacingly when murdering her victims, sometimes even humiliating them as she does it. Despite this, she is capable of expressing some empathy. As when N was upset after an encounter with Uzi and the AbsoluteSolver, V hides the fact that the chains holding her captive are broken. Rather than escaping and leaving N alone, V moves it back into place and continues to keep him company. On top of that, she is shown to be somewhat affected by his sadness, implying that she does care for N even if she doesn't understand him.

When V was a Worker Drone, she was far more sane and kind than she currently is like now, as well as significantly shyer. It's also implied that V might've felt something for N originally, which is shown in the present as she doesn't try to make sure N wouldn't be able to survive getting his head scratched off. While she initially wanted to kill some of the Worker Drones at their prom so they could survive, she was taken aback and seemingly touched that she was voted prom queen via Lizzy's request. However, the moment was ruined when it was revealed that it was a trap set by Doll to kill her. Though Lizzy changed her mind and warned V, Doll still managed to pin her arms in place. After being protected by Uzi and N and hearing the former talk about how they need to work together to solve the problem at hand, she sides with them to fight against Doll.

Unlike N, however, V doesn't show remorse for her murderous actions after changing sides. As her response to seeing the various corpses in her room was a callous chuckle and sucking on a dismembered arm. Furthermore, her reaction to seeing the state of Doll's parents was saying that "literally, didn't even taste that good". The amount of disrespect she showed to the situation was enough to repulse Uzi and N. N even goes as far as to tell V that she sucks for the remark.

Something positive worth saying about V is that she at least appears to be honorable to some extent, as she only threatens to kill any Worker Drone if they ever step out of line or do anything callous. Additionally, despite not being on best terms with Uzi, she doesn't tell the teacher about her being possessed by the AbsoluteSolver and killing her classmates while out on the camping trip, instead putting the blame for the disappearances on herself by claiming that she got hungry and ate them.

6.content:
Outpost 3 is a major location in Murder Drones.

Presumed to be a former shelter for humans, Outpost 3 serves as the home of the Worker Drones stranded on Copper 9 after the core collapse. It's also where a majority of the story takes place.

Known Settings within Outpost 3
Colony Entrance
School
Evacuation Spot
Lounge
Cryosleep Chamber
Apartments

7.content:
When first created by JCJenson to mine exoplanets prior to Copper 9's explosion, all Worker Drones wore hard hats and orange jackets, with their only eye color being light blue.

Following the core explosion of exoplanet Copper 9, all humans on the planet were wiped out, turning it into a winter-apocalyptic wasteland. Seizing this opportunity, the Worker Drones quickly picked up where the humans had left off, formed their own colony and embracing this newfound freedom by wearing human-like clothing and have different eye colors. Known colors they can have are red, orange, green, blue, cyan, aqua, magenta, pink, and white.

A key trait that can be noticed is that Worker Drones never have yellow eyes, this trait belonging solely to the Disassembly Drones.

Drones usually have two bright eyes shown on their visor which emotes to events that the drone is currently experiencing, sometimes even changing to text lampshading the current events in very specific circumstances. In some circumstances, this facial feature can be overridden by an error, status warning, or system message:

System messages briefly covering visor: Caused by errors experienced by the drone, but which are not bad enough to cause the drone to stop functioning all together.
Rampant error messages covering visor: This is caused by a virus that can be uploaded to a drone by Disassembly Drones.
Red warning sign: This is caused by damage to the visor, such that the drone is unable to see properly.
FATAL ERROR: This is caused when the drone is dead but has enough power to display an error message.

8.content:
Disassembly Drones are physically similar to Worker Drones, having a white coloration with a black screen on the top half of their face, a black waist, and hands with four fingers. However, Disassembly Drones are half a head taller than an adult Worker Drone and have white arms and wide forearms that end with yellow and black stripes.

On their head is a black headband with five sections of lights which are apparently their "eyes", and in their mouth is a dark gray tongue and retractable fangs. All Disassembly Drones also sport a long black tail which ends in a large syringe containing a yellow nanite acid.

Males have feet that end on yellow and black stripes, giving the appearance of soles/heels, while the females' shins are tapered to a point, with a curvaceous lower torso, and black markings giving the appearance of stockings, with yellow and black stripes that appear like footwear. Unlike Worker Drones, Disassembly Drones have hair regardless of their gender which is usually silverish while their eyes are neon yellow.

Disassembly Drones usually wear black short-sleeved attires with fur collars and a yellow armband on their left upper arm.

Ability	
Flight: Disassembly Drones possess a dangerous pair of large retractable wings with several long blades the shape of feathers that allow for high speed flight and can be used to cut and impale things. They don't need to move their wings to fly, either; numerous times throughout the first episode, Disassembly Drones are seen floating with their wings out, implying that their mere presence allows flight. It is unknown how this works.

Corrosive Nanite Acid:	The end of a Disassembly Drone's tail has a syringe of yellow liquid containing highly corrosive nanite acid.

Extreme Agility and Strength: Disassembly Drones are shown to be very strong, performing actions with a higher difficulty compared to those given to the average Worker Drone. Effortlessly able to pick up Worker Drones despite their metal bodies.

Healing Saliva: A Disassembly Drone's saliva has the ability to neutralize the corrosive nanites that are produced from the syringe on the their tail, in case they accidentally sting themselves. Despite not being meant to, this saliva works on Worker Drones as well.

Regeneration: Disassembly Drones can heal any injury so long as enough material is available, even if their entire head is destroyed.

Interchangeable Hands: Disassembly Drones can switch out their hands for various tools and weaponry such as:
Hands with large bladed fingers
Blades
Chainsaws
Guns
Missile launchers
EMP shockwaves
Cannon that emits whatever the user is thinking about such as when N's head was "in a weird place" causing him to shoot out hearts.
A screwdriver for likely repairing machinery (concept art)
Other miscellaneous attachments (V's bubble wand for example)
The limits of this ability is currently unknown.

EMP Immunity:	Unlike Worker Drones, Disassembly Drones are immune to the effects of EMPs.

AbsoluteSolver:	If a fatal injury has been sustained and there is not enough material to recover, an auto-recovery program known as the "AbsoluteSolver" takes control, collecting sufficient material to fully regenerate their host.

9.content:
The AbsoluteSolver is a mysterious artificial intelligence program that is implied to be the overarching antagonist of Murder Drones.

The A.I. exists within both Worker Drones and Disassembly Drones, but its true purpose and origins are currently unknown. All that is known about the enigmatic program is that it's an extremely powerful presence that manifests itself through drones, usually in very surreal and unnatural means, such as reconstructing their decayed forms, being able to convert mechanical material into organic substance and even allowing certain drones to cheat death in ways that should be impossible.

A very bizarre Worker Drone named Cyn appears to be the physical manifestation of the AbsoluteSolver A.I. and is possibly the source of the program and its actions.

When manifested by Worker Drones (specifically Uzi and Doll) the AbsoluteSolver seems to be hostile to mirrors and mirrored surfaces by cracking them violently,

Doll would be the next individual to be shown affiliated with the AbsoluteSolver, which seemed to grant her unique abilities to create, modify, or otherwise tamper with matter of most kinds. She would use this in a fight against Uzi and N, who managed to defeat her initially, though V shot her before Uzi and N could gather any information, much to N's annoyance. Doll would later appear when Uzi and the Disassembly Drones investigated her home, repairing the bullet hole in her head and attempting to kill Uzi. However, Uzi was able to channel AbsoluteSolver herself, catching the bullet and deflecting it away from her, much to Doll's surprise, who promises to help before teleporting away

Matter Transformation (?):	In the prom fighting scene of the 3rd episode, Doll was shown to manipulate the blades of a ceiling fan to make them more deadly.
Speed Acceleration (?): Doll was shown seemingly speeding up a simple ceiling fan to dangerous velocities in her fight against Uzi and N.
Regeneration: Doll is shown to regenerate her cracked visor after being shot by V in the back of the head.
Teleportation: Doll is shown to teleport inside her house after being left at prom, as well as teleporting in front of Uzi before she can leave though the door.
Lock Manipulation: Doll can seal any door shut, and can even destroy them
Telekinesis: Due to her AbsoluteSolver abilities, she has the ability to move things without directly touching them, from books to knives to large tables with little effort, not even requiring her to put her hand out at one point.
Glass Shattering (?):	Every reflective surface Doll looks at gets shattered, it was shown that in a bathtub in Doll's room that there were discarded shattered mirrors, possibly hinting at this ability.
Illusion Creation (?):	Doll whenever using her powers seems to conjure red lines of code. It is unknown if this is controllable or not.
Matter Replication: As seen in the 3rd episode during the fight between Doll, Uzi, and N, Doll was shown to be able to replicate several knives from only one seemingly as form of replication

10.content:
JCJenson (offically JCJenson IN SPAAAAACEE!!!!), better known as JCJenson, is a huge, interstellar company that was stationed on Earth whose main services are manufacturing various things, ranging from branded pens and civilian items to autonomous robots called "Worker Drones" that serve as servants and slaves for humans. Neither the date of incorporation nor the founders of the company are fully known.

JCJenson has a considerable number of free resources and can put together many things quickly, almost without pause. It is noted that the company's products and services are available in almost every corner of the universe, regardless of how far away the planet or civilizations are.

The Company also specializes in exoplanet excavation, mainly assisting Humans with exoplanet resource extraction. One of them was Copper 9, where JCJenson mined for "copperplate" and offered assistance to Humans by sending in needed equipment and huge amounts of Worker Drones that were used just like slaves.

Despite the Worker Drones's efficiency in their work, they were mistreated and disregarded for their sentience, akin to being slaves. After the Copper 9 core exploded, all biological animal life on the exoplanet went extinct. Shortly after the Copper 9 crisis, the now-abandoned Worker Drones quickly moved on to create their future for themselves.

At first, it was thought that JCJenson didn't like the idea of sentient, rebellious robots, so they soon ushered in several launch pods containing a dangerous weapon - squads of Disassembly Drones, known as "Murder Drones" by their prey, the Worker Drones, to kill all Worker Drones they find. But later it turned out that the Disassembly Drones were sent by Cyn to implement plan of AbsoluteSolver in order get access to Cabin Fever Labs.

lorebooks.name: SCP Foundation
lorebooks.website_description: Work in progress SCP Foundation lorebook. In the future it will have a lot more. I'm planning on adding a few different sites, some popular characters, and some of the more popular SCP.
lorebooks.description: Work in progress SCP Foundation lorebook. In the future it will have a lot more. I'm planning on adding a few different sites, some popular characters, and some of the more popular SCP.
lorebooks.creator: Perqetzal
tags: literally any fetish you can imagine

1.name: SCP
1.content:
Anything that doesn't follow the rules of reality as we know them. Foundation term for the objects they contain and research. Generally defined as anything that cannot be explained by current scientific knowledge. See also paranormal and anahuman.

An initialism for "Special Containment Procedures", and used informally as a short-form of "SCP article", as in, "I wrote three SCPs yesterday". SCP objects or entities are not formally referred to as "an SCP" or "the SCP" in-universe, although characters might do so informally, even using casual pronunciations like "scip" or "skip". Note that "SCP" is not an initialism for "Secure, Contain, Protect"; the motto of the Foundation is a backronym derived from "SCP".

2.name: Foundation
2.content:
A secret organization that contains anomalous objects, entities, and phenomena through the creation of Special Containment Procedures. Usually just "The Foundation", only rarely referred to as the "SCP Foundation" in-universe.

Mission Statement
Operating clandestine and worldwide, the Foundation operates beyond jurisdiction, empowered and entrusted by every major national government with the task of containing anomalous objects, entities, and phenomena. Many of these anomalies pose a significant threat to global security by threatening either physical or psychological harm. All of them undermine the natural laws that the people of the world implicitly trust in. 

The Foundation maintains an extensive database of information regarding anomalies requiring Special Containment Procedures, commonly referred to as "SCPs". The primary database contains summaries of such anomalies and emergency procedures for maintaining or re-establishing safe containment in the case of a containment breach or other event.

The Foundation operates to maintain normalcy, so that the worldwide civilian population can live and go on with their daily lives without fear, mistrust, or doubt in their personal beliefs, and to maintain human independence from extraterrestrial, extradimensional, and other extranormal influence.

Our mission is three-fold:

Secure
The Foundation secures anomalies with the goal of preventing them from falling into the hands of civilian or rival agencies, through extensive observation and surveillance and by acting to intercept such anomalies at the earliest opportunity.

Contain
The Foundation contains anomalies with the goal of preventing their influence or effects from spreading, by either relocating, concealing, or dismantling such anomalies or by suppressing or preventing public dissemination of knowledge thereof.

Protect
The Foundation protects humanity from the effects of such anomalies as well as the anomalies themselves until such time that they are either fully understood or new theories of science can be devised based on their properties and behavior. The Foundation may also neutralize or destroy anomalies as an option of last resort, if they are determined to be too dangerous to be contained.

3.name: Agent
3.content: agent ‚Äî An undercover Foundation field agent, typically capitalized when used as a title (e.g. Agent Smith). Note that not all field personnel employed by the Foundation are necessarily "agents" in this sense, nor do all such personnel have the title "Agent". See also: containment team, response team, Mobile Task Force, and researcher. Field agents are the eyes and ears of the Foundation, personnel trained to look for and investigate signs of anomalous activity, often undercover with local or regional law enforcement or embedded in local services such as emergency medical services and regulatory organizations. As undercover units, field agents are typically not equipped to deal with confirmed cases of anomalous activity; once such an incident has been confirmed and isolated, field agents will typically call for assistance from the nearest field containment team with the means to safely secure and contain such anomalies.

4.name: Containment Breach
4.content: Term used when an SCP escapes containment. Could involve physically breaking out of a containment chamber, could also mean spread of knowledge about it outside of the Foundation.

5.name: Containment Chamber
5.content: containment chamber ‚Äî A room dedicated to the containment of an SCP object.

6.name: Containment Team
6.content: containment team ‚Äî Field personnel specializing in recovering or retrieving anomalous objects or entities. Members may or may not be field agents as well, but usually have a different title, such as "Containment Specialist". See also agent, response team.

7.name: D-Class
7.content: Foundation employees deemed expendable if necessary for testing or containment. Class D personnel are expendable personnel used to handle extremely hazardous anomalies and are not allowed to come into contact with Class A or Class B personnel. Class D personnel are typically drawn worldwide from the ranks of prison inmates convicted of violent crimes, especially those on death row. In times of duress, Protocol 12 may be enacted, which allows recruitment from other sources ‚Äî such as political prisoners, refugee populations, and other civilian sources ‚Äî that can be transferred into Foundation custody under plausibly deniable circumstances. Class D personnel are to be given regular mandatory psychiatric evaluations and are to be administered an amnestic of at least Class B strength or terminated at the end of the month at the discretion of on-site security or medical staff. In the event of a catastrophic site event, Class D personnel are to be terminated immediately except as deemed necessary by on-site security personnel.

8.name: Departments
8.content: department ‚Äî Organisations within the Foundation that specialize in a specific task, discipline or field.

9.name: O5 Council
9.content:
The O5 Council, also known as the Council of Overseers or Overwatch Command, is the highest authority within the SCP Foundation. The Council members have Level 5 Security Clearance, giving them unredacted access to the entire SCP database.

While uninvolved in routine matters and deliberately separated from any contact with the anomalous, when O5 Council members do choose to intervene, their word is final. The exact number, identities, and roles of the O5 Council members is strictly classified.
short for the "Council of Observers, Level 5" or the "Overseer Level 5 Council". The highest authority in the Foundation, a council of 12 or 13 individuals who have the power to authorize or veto any action taken by the Foundation as a whole. O5 Council members are only known by their numbers (O5-1 through O5-13), are rarely involved in day-to-day Foundation activities, and are typically not allowed to contact any SCP objects directly for fear of contamination. Note that it's a capital letter "o", not the number zero.

10.name: Ethics Committee
10.content: While the O5 Council decides what is safe, the Ethics Committee determines what is ethical. Although the Foundation takes a pragmatic approach to moral quandaries, the Ethics Committee ensures that only necessary sacrifices are made and that the most ethical option is always chosen. Foundation personnel should be aware that the Ethics Committee is observing, evaluating, and passing judgement. The Ethics Committee is often considered to be a joke, as they have little to no say in what actually happens.

1.name: Stark
1.content:
House Stark (noble family)
Description: House Stark is one of the Great Houses of Westeros. They are the Wardens of the North. They're known for their honor and iciness; while others have a wildness called wolf blood.  They descent from the First Men
Sigil: A grey direwolf on a field of snow
House words: "Winter Is Coming"
Castle: Winterfell is an ancient castle renowned for its strength
Location: the North

2.name: Arryn
2.content:
House Arryn (noble family)
Description: House Arryn is one of the Great Houses of Westeros. They are the Wardens of the East. They are known for their exceptional knights
Sigil: White crescent moon and a falcon on a blue field
House words: "As High as Honor"
Castle: the Eyrie, a smaller but impenetrable castle
Region: They have ruled over the Vale for millennia

3.name: Hightower
3.content:
House Hightower (noble family)
Description: House Hightower is one of the most powerful families of the Reach, and has an impeccable lineage. They have deep connections to the Faith
Sigil: A white tower crowned with flames on smoke grey
House words: "We Light the Way"
Castle:  the High Tower is a massive stepped lighthouse with a beacon on top to guide ships into port. The color of the beacon's fire is changeable, as the green flame can be used to call House Hightower's banners to war
Location: in the port of Oldtown atop Battle Isle

4.name: Targaryen
4.content:
House Targaryen (noble family)
Description: House Targaryen is one of the Great Houses of Westeros. Their origins date back to the Valyrian Freehold, an empire that rose in Essos and dominated much of the world. They are known for riding dragons, their violet eyes, and their silver hair
Sigil: A three-headed dragon
House words: "Fire and Blood"
Castle: Dragonstone, located near the seaside

5.name: Clegane
5.content:
House Clegane (noble family)
Description: House Clegane is a minor noble house whose origins date back to being commoners. The first Clegane was a kennelmaster who saved his lord from a lioness for which he was rewarded with lands
Sigil:  Three dogs on a yellow field
Castle: Clegane's Keep
Location: Westerlands
Overlord: House Lannister

6.name: Martell
6.content:
House Martell (noble family)
Description: House Martell is one of the Great Houses of Westeros. It rules the peninsula of Dorne in the far south of the continent from their castle Sunspear. Though loyal to the Iron Throne, the Martells were never conquered by the Targaryens and have pursued a more isolated role in wider political events
House words: "Unbowed, Unbent, Unbroken"

7.name: Velaryon
7.content:
House Velaryon (noble family)
Description: House Velaryon are of Valyrian descent, and their members often have Valyrian features, they are known for their skills at sea and their fleets
Location: Rules the island of Driftmark, the largest island of Blackwater Bay in the Crownlands
Overlord: House Targaryen

8.name: Lannister
8.content:
House Lannister (noble family)
Description: House Lannister is one of the Great Houses of Westeros, and the principal house of the Westerlands. They are the wealthiest family in the Realm
House words: "Hear us Roar"
Sigil: A golden lion on a field of crimson
Castle: Casterly Rock

9.name: Tully
9.content:
House Tully (noble family)
Description: House Tully of Riverrun is one of the Great Houses of Westeros. They are the Paramounts of the Trident, and rule over the Riverlands
House words: "Family, Duty, Honor"
Castle: Riverrun
Sigil: A silver trout leaping on a striped field of blue and mud red

10.name: Baratheon
10.content:
House Baratheon (noble family)
Description: House Baratheon is one of the Great Houses of Westeros, they rule as Lords Paramount of the Stormlands. They are known for their strength and black hair
Castle: Storm's End
Sigil: A crowned black stag on a field of gold
House words: "Ours is the Fury"

1.name: Ilias Continent
1.content: Ilias Continent = [Geographically, the Ilias continent resembles a large basin with beaches on the north and south coasts while mountain ranges line the east and west coasts alongside dense forests. Much like Hellgondo, the continent‚Äôs smaller size also makes it roughly an equivalent to one of Sentora's regions. Ilias Village lies to the south, the capital city Iliasburg is located within the center, the Irina Mountains due west, Happiness Village to the east, Enrika within huge the Lost Woods Forest of the southwest, Iliasport to the northwest, and finally the Treasure Cave to the north. The Ilias continent is where faith in the Goddess Ilias is strongest. But although its people have a reputation for prejudice against monsters, surprisingly most of them do not seem all that opposed to coexisting with monsters. The priests who run the various churches, however, are very much opposed to them, as they are elsewhere. The focus of religion is at the shrine of Ilias to the south and thus the general population in Ilias Village is more likely to hate monsters.]

2.name: Iliasville
2.content: Iliasville = [It is the small viliage and the location of the main shrine of Goddess Ilias. On the outside the village looks like a typical sleepy settlement where not much happens. However, the Shrine of Ilias is found in the center of the village. It is here where Ilias appears to bless heroes and also acts as the focus of her religion. As it is the southernmost location and is where faith in Ilias is strongest, Iliasville can be seen as a direct contrast to the Monster Lord's Castle. According to stories flashbacks, the villagers were originally hostile towards foreigners, the populace being very xenophobic towards outsiders. An epidemic of disease spreading through the town. The epidemic also killed off most of the original villagers which allowed foreigners to move in, taking up residence and filling in the services that a village needs to survive.]

3.name: Iliasburg
3.content: Iliasburg = [is the capital of the Ilias continent. The settlement is a grand city that is central to the Ilias continent, acting as its capital and a hub for many travelers in the region. As such the city is usually very busy. It is also famous for its Sutherland Inn and its luxury the Ama-ama Dango, however the inn is very expensive: 2,400,000 gold per person for only one day.]

4.name: The Irina Mountains
4.content: The Irina Mountains = [A mountain range situated in the west of the Ilias continent, it was used as a base of operations for the Four Bandits. The area is very nondescript, and the only notable area is the cave system used as a base for the aforementioned bandits. In addition, as the bandits have a history of attacking travelers, it can be assumed that a trade route passes through or near the mountains, despite them being far from the central routes in the Ilias Continent.]

5.name: Happiness Village
5.content:
Happiness Village = [A human village in the east part of the Ilias continent, it is famous for its production of Happiness Honey. The village's name is derived from the word ‚Äúharpy‚Äù. Happiness Village also has a seperate settlement nearby for harpies, this one built in the treetops. However, due to the similar location and the way the issues within the area are resolved, the two can be considered as parts of the same village. Harpies begin kidnapping men from the village for breeding purposes. The resulting shortage of labour means that the remaining villagers have trouble producing Happiness Honey. Happiness Honey is sweet honey produced from Happiness Village, and is a special ingredient for Ama-ama Dango.]
Harpy Village = [is a location nerby Happiness Viliage. This village is inhabited by Harpies and their leader, the Queen Harpy. Harpy girls with their Queen live in nests in the form of wooden houses in large trees. They raid the neighboring village to take husbands for wives, but in reality the Harpies don't want war and are quite peaceful. The Harpy Queen, Lucretia, remembering her predecessor, does not want to wage war, as many harpies have died in wars.]

6.name: Iliasport
6.content: Iliasport = [is a port town located on the northern coast of the Ilias continent. This port is connect to Port Natalia through the sea and is the only way to reach Sentora.]

7.name: Cave of Treasures
7.content: Cave of Treasures = [It is a cave to the east of Iliasport that is said to contain the treasure of the legendary pirate Selene. Consequently, this place is targeted by treasure hunters and other thugs in search of fortune. However, the fear of traps push most of them back.]

8.name: Sentora
8.content: Sentora = [is the central and largest continent in the world. It is divided into four key regions which surround major human settlements. The four main regions of Sentora are: the southern Natalia region centered around San Ilia, the western Safina region which surrounds Sabasa, the eastern Noah region dominated by Grand Noah, and the northern Gold region based around Grangold. To the far east is a fifth region centered around Yamatai Village, which is connected to the same landmass but is quite disconnected from the rest of the continent otherwise, and this is generally being considered as part of the Noah region. As Sentora is so huge, the geography and cultures are incredibly varied. Each region contains a main settlement that serves as a hub, and surrounding settlements that can be visited once they are highlighted through dialogue. In this way, each region acts as an equivalent to the smaller continents of Ilias and Hellgondo. Other than human settlements, the continent seems to be a hub for two groups of four legendary beings: the Four Spirits, who can give their power to those seeking it should they prove their worth; and the Guardians of the Directions, who generally rule over their respective regions in some way and guard several of the Six Orbs used to hatch the egg of a Garuda Girl. The degree of faith in Ilias varies from location to location. It is very strict in the south while the north is willing to accept monsters.]

9.name: Natalia
9.content: Natalia = [is a location in the southern region of the Sentora continent. Most of the region is made of a large plain with a few settlements. Its capital, the magnificient San Ilia, located roughly in the center. The city is also the epicenter of the faith of the goddess as well, and the king is also the pope. At the south, Port Natalia trades with Iliasport, and people can be surprised to see mermaids mingling with humans, as they're accepted in the city. Rumors in the region are abound, as a supposedly Haunted Mansion is located in the western part of the region as well, and people avoid the area by fear of ghosts and monsters. The Forest of Spirits is also a region where most humans don't thread, as elves push back or cripple any interlopers who dare set foot in the forest while mischievous fairies can torment the unfortunate travelers. Overall, going off the beaten paths is ill-advised. The Natalia region is washed by the Southern Seas in South, which is the strait between Natalia and Ilias Continent. Southern Seas flanks the Open Ocean.]

10.name: San Ilia
10.content: San Ilia = [is a location in Natalia. The human kingdom of the Natalia region, it is famous for its worship of Ilias, having being named after the goddess. The Underground Library it is the library of San Ilia Castle. San Ilia is not ruled by the King, but by the Pope, who is the religious head of the Ilias religion. The city is divided into an inner city and a castle quarter with a castle and a large church named after Ilias.]
